More than once , in truth , [Tom]90-tom was near to breaking down and confessing [himself]90-tom unequal to [his]90-tom tremendous part ; but the tact of [the Princess Elizabeth]585-the princess elizabeth saved [him]90-tom , or a word from one or the other of [the vigilant lords]586-the vigilant lords , thrown in apparently by chance , had the same happy effect . Once [the little Lady]587-the little lady [Jane]97-the lady jane grey turned to [Tom]90-tom and dismayed [him]90-tom with this question,-- “ Hast paid [thy]90-tom duty to [[the Queen]3284-the queen ’s majesty]3285-the queen ’s majesty to - day , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord ? ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom hesitated , looked distressed , and was about to stammer out something at hazard , when [Lord St. John]109-lord st. john took the word and answered for [him]90-tom with the easy grace of [a courtier accustomed to encounter delicate difficulties and to be ready for them--]588-a courtier accustomed to encounter delicate difficulties and to be ready for them-- “ [He]109-lord st. john hath indeed , [madam]3287-madam , and [she]590-she did greatly hearten [him]109-lord st. john , as touching [[his]109-lord st. john majesty]3254-his majesty ’s condition ; is it not so , [[your]3287-madam highness]3271-your highness ? ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom mumbled something that stood for assent , but felt that [he]90-tom was getting upon [dangerous ground]589-dangerous ground . Somewhat later it was mentioned that [Tom]90-tom was to study no more at present , whereupon [[her]590-she little ladyship]591-her little ladyship exclaimed-- “ ‘ Tis a pity , ’ tis a pity ! [Thou]3290-thy wert proceeding bravely . But bide [thy]3290-thy time in patience : it will not be for long . [Thou’lt]3290-thy yet be graced with learning like [[thy]3290-thy father]3066-thy father , and make [thy]3290-thy tongue master of as many languages as [his]3066-thy father , good [[my]591-her little ladyship prince]3184-my prince . ”[591-her little ladyship] “ [[My]90-tom father]3049-my father ! ”[90-tom] cried [Tom]90-tom , off [his]90-tom guard for the moment . “ [I]90-tom trow [he]3049-my father can not speak [his]3049-my father own so that any but the swine that kennel in [the styes]3294-the styes may tell [his]3049-my father meaning ; and as for learning of any sort soever-- ”[90-tom] [He]90-tom looked up and encountered a solemn warning in [[my]0-my Lord]3168-my lord St. [John]109-lord st. john ’s eyes . [He]90-tom stopped , blushed , then continued low and sadly : “ Ah , [[my]90-tom malady]3295-my malady persecuteth [me]90-tom again , and [my]90-tom mind wandereth . [I]90-tom meant [the King]294-the king ’s grace no irreverence . ”[90-tom] “ [We]3297-we know it , [sir]3053-sir , ”[593-the princess] said [the Princess]593-the princess [Elizabeth]91-the lady elizabeth , taking [[her]91-the lady elizabeth ‘ brother]594-her ‘ brother ’s ’ hand between [her]91-the lady elizabeth two palms , respectfully but caressingly ; “ trouble not [thyself]3299-thyself as to that . The fault is none of thine , but [thy]3299-thyself distemper ’s . ”[593-the princess] “ [Thou’rt]3299-thyself a gentle comforter , [sweet lady]3300-sweet lady , ”[90-tom] said [Tom]90-tom , gratefully , “ and [my]90-tom heart moveth [me]90-tom to thank [thee]3299-thyself for’t , an ’ [I]90-tom may be so bold . ”[90-tom] Once [the giddy little Lady Jane]97-the lady jane grey fired a simple Greek phrase at [Tom]90-tom . [The Princess Elizabeth]110-the princess elizabeth ’s quick eye saw by the serene blankness of [the target]595-the target ’s front that the shaft was overshot ; so [she]110-the princess elizabeth tranquilly delivered a return volley of sounding Greek on [Tom]90-tom ’s behalf , and then straightway changed the talk to other matters . Time wore on pleasantly , and likewise smoothly , on the whole . Snags and sandbars grew less and less frequent , and [Tom]90-tom grew more and more at [his]90-tom ease , seeing that all were so lovingly bent upon helping [him]90-tom and overlooking [his]90-tom mistakes . When it came out that [the little ladies]596-the little ladies were to accompany [him]90-tom to [the Lord Mayor]597-the lord mayor ’s banquet in the evening , [his]90-tom heart gave a bound of relief and delight , for [he]90-tom felt that [he]90-tom should not be friendless , now , among that multitude of [strangers]598-strangers ; whereas , an hour earlier , the idea of [their]596-the little ladies going with [him]90-tom would have been an insupportable terror to [him]90-tom . [[Tom]90-tom ’s guardian angels]599-tom ’s guardian angels , [the two lords]581-the two lords , had had less comfort in the interview than the other parties to it . [They]599-tom ’s guardian angels felt much as if [they]599-tom ’s guardian angels were piloting [a great ship]601-a great ship through [a dangerous channel]602-a dangerous channel ; [they]599-tom ’s guardian angels were on the alert constantly , and found [[their]599-tom ’s guardian angels office]603-their office [no child]604-no child ’s play . Wherefore , at last , when [the ladies]605-the ladies ’ visit was drawing to a close and [the Lord Guilford Dudley]111-the lord guilford dudley was announced , [they]599-tom ’s guardian angels not only felt that [their]599-tom ’s guardian angels charge had been sufficiently taxed for the present , but also that [they]599-tom ’s guardian angels [themselves]599-tom ’s guardian angels were not in the best condition to take [[their]599-tom ’s guardian angels ship]606-their ship back and make [their]599-tom ’s guardian angels anxious voyage all over again . So [they]599-tom ’s guardian angels respectfully advised [Tom]90-tom to excuse [himself]90-tom , which [he]90-tom was very glad to do , although a slight shade of disappointment might have been observed upon [my]0-my [Lady Jane]97-the lady jane grey ’s face when [she]97-the lady jane grey heard [the splendid stripling]607-the splendid stripling denied admittance . There was a pause now , a sort of waiting silence which [Tom]90-tom could not understand . [He]90-tom glanced at [Lord Hertford]107-hertford , who gave [him]90-tom a sign -- but [he]90-tom failed to understand that also . The ready [Elizabeth]110-the princess elizabeth came to the rescue with [her]110-the princess elizabeth usual easy grace . [She]110-the princess elizabeth made reverence and said-- “ Have [we]3301-we leave of [the prince]236-the prince ’s grace [[my]90-tom brother]3303-my brother to go ? ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom said-- “ Indeed [[your]107-hertford ladyships]3304-your ladyships can have whatsoever of [me]90-tom [they]3304-your ladyships will , for the asking ; yet would [I]90-tom rather give [them]3304-your ladyships any other thing that in [my]90-tom poor power lieth , than leave to take the light and blessing of [their]3304-your ladyships presence hence . Give [ye]107-hertford good den , and [God]87-god be with [ye]107-hertford ! ”[90-tom] Then [he]90-tom smiled inwardly at the thought , “ ‘ Tis not for nought [I]90-tom have dwelt but among [princes]314-princes in [my]90-tom reading , and taught [my]90-tom tongue some slight trick of [their]314-princes broidered and gracious speech withal ! ”[90-tom] When [the illustrious maidens]608-the illustrious maidens were gone , [Tom]90-tom turned wearily to [[his]90-tom keepers]609-his keepers and said-- “ May it please [[your]107-hertford lordships]3306-your lordships to grant [me]90-tom leave to go into some corner and rest [me]90-tom ? ”[90-tom] [Lord Hertford]107-hertford said-- “ So please [[your]107-hertford highness]3271-your highness , it is for [you]107-hertford to command , it is for [us]3308-us to obey . That [thou]3309-thou should’st rest is indeed a needful thing , since [thou]3309-thou must journey to [the city]370-the city presently . ”[90-tom] [He]90-tom touched a bell , and [a page]610-a page appeared , who was ordered to desire the presence of [Sir William Herbert]112-sir william herbert . [This gentleman]611-this gentleman came straightway , and conducted [Tom]90-tom to [an inner apartment]612-an inner apartment . [Tom]90-tom ’s first movement there was to reach for a cup of water ; but [a silk - and - velvet servitor]613-a silk - and - velvet servitor seized it , dropped upon one knee , and offered it to [him]90-tom on a golden salver . Next [the tired captive]614-the tired captive sat down and was going to take off [his]614-the tired captive buskins , timidly asking leave with [his]614-the tired captive eye , but [another silk - and - velvet discomforter]615-another silk - and - velvet discomforter went down upon [his]614-the tired captive knees and took [the office]616-the office from [him]614-the tired captive . [He]614-the tired captive made two or three further efforts to help [himself]614-the tired captive , but being promptly forestalled each time , [he]614-the tired captive finally gave up , with a sigh of resignation and a murmured “ Beshrew [me]614-the tired captive , but [I]614-the tired captive marvel [they]619-the former do not require to breathe for [me]614-the tired captive also ! ”[614-the tired captive] Slippered , and wrapped in a sumptuous robe , [he]614-the tired captive laid [himself]614-the tired captive down at last to rest , but not to sleep , for [his]614-the tired captive head was too full of thoughts and [the room]507-the room too full of [people]321-people . [He]614-the tired captive could not dismiss [the former]619-the former , so [they]619-the former stayed ; [he]614-the tired captive did not know enough to dismiss [the latter]620-the latter , so [they]619-the former stayed also , to [his]614-the tired captive vast regret -- and [theirs]619-the former . [Tom]90-tom ’s departure had left [[his]90-tom two noble guardians]621-his two noble guardians alone . [They]621-his two noble guardians mused a while , with much head - shaking and walking the floor , then [Lord St. John]109-lord st. john said-- “ Plainly , what dost [thou]621-his two noble guardians think ? ”[109-lord st. john] “ Plainly , then , this . [The King]294-the king is near [his]294-the king end ; [[my]109-lord st. john nephew]3312-my nephew is mad -- mad will mount the throne , and mad remain . [God]87-god protect [England]2-england , since [she]2-england will need it ! ”[109-lord st. john] “ Verily it promiseth so , indeed . But . . . have [you]622-the speaker no misgivings as to . . . as to . . . ”[622-the speaker] [The speaker]622-the speaker hesitated , and finally stopped . [He]622-the speaker evidently felt that [he]622-the speaker was upon delicate ground . [Lord Hertford]107-hertford stopped before [him]622-the speaker , looked into [his]622-the speaker face with a clear , frank eye , and said-- “ Speak on -- there is none to hear but [me]107-hertford . Misgivings as to what ? ”[107-hertford] “ [I]107-hertford am full loth to word the thing that is in [my]107-hertford mind , and [thou]3313-thou so near to [him]294-the king in blood , [[my]107-hertford lord]3168-my lord . But craving pardon if [I]107-hertford do offend , seemeth it not strange that madness could so change [his]294-the king port and manner?--not but that [his]294-the king port and speech are princely still , but that [they]3315-they _ differ _ , in one unweighty trifle or another , from what [his]294-the king custom was aforetime . Seemeth it not strange that madness should filch from [his]294-the king memory [[his]294-the king father]306-his father ’s very lineaments ; the customs and observances that are [his]294-the king due from such as be about [him]294-the king ; and , leaving [him]294-the king [his]294-the king Latin , strip [him]294-the king of [his]294-the king Greek and French ? [[My]107-hertford lord]3168-my lord , be not offended , but ease [my]107-hertford mind of its disquiet and receive [my]107-hertford grateful thanks . It haunteth [me]107-hertford , [his]294-the king saying [he]294-the king was not [the prince]236-the prince , and so-- ”[107-hertford] “ Peace , [[my]109-lord st. john lord]3168-my lord , [thou]3320-thou utterest treason ! Hast forgot [the King]294-the king ’s command ? Remember [I]109-lord st. john am party to [thy]3320-thou crime if [I]109-lord st. john but listen . ”[109-lord st. john] [St. John]109-lord st. john paled , and hastened to say-- “ [I]109-lord st. john was in fault , [I]109-lord st. john do confess it . Betray [me]109-lord st. john not , grant [me]109-lord st. john this grace out of [thy]3320-thou courtesy , and [I]109-lord st. john will neither think nor speak of this thing more . Deal not hardly with [me]109-lord st. john , [sir]3053-sir , else am [I]109-lord st. john ruined . ”[109-lord st. john] “ [I]109-lord st. john am content , [[my]109-lord st. john lord]3168-my lord . So [thou]3320-thou offend not again , here or in the ears of [others]3324-others , it shall be as though [thou]3320-thou hadst not spoken . But [thou]3320-thou need’st not have misgivings . [He]3325-his is [[my]109-lord st. john sister ’s son]3326-my sister ’s son ; are not [his]3325-his voice , [his]3325-his face , [his]3325-his form , familiar to [me]109-lord st. john from [his]3325-his cradle ? Madness can do all the odd conflicting things [thou]3320-thou seest in [him]3325-his , and more . Dost not recall how that [the old Baron Marley]113-the old baron marley , being mad , forgot the favour of [his]113-the old baron marley own countenance that [he]113-the old baron marley had known for sixty years , and held it was another ’s ; nay , even claimed [he]3325-his was [the son of [Mary Magdalene]114-mary magdalene]3327-the son of mary magdalene , and that [his]3325-his head was made of Spanish glass ; and , sooth to say , [he]3325-his suffered none to touch it , lest by mischance some heedless hand might shiver it ? Give [thy]3320-thou misgivings easement , good [[my]109-lord st. john lord]3168-my lord . This is [the very prince]3329-the very prince -- [I]109-lord st. john know [him]3329-the very prince well -- and soon will be [[thy]3320-thou king]3330-thy king ; it may advantage [thee]3320-thou to bear this in mind , and more dwell upon it than the other . ”[109-lord st. john] After some further talk , in which [the Lord St. John]109-lord st. john covered up [his]109-lord st. john mistake as well as [he]109-lord st. john could by repeated protests that [his]109-lord st. john faith was thoroughly grounded now , and could not be assailed by doubts again , [the Lord Hertford]107-hertford relieved [[his]107-hertford fellow - keeper]623-his fellow - keeper , and sat down to keep watch and ward alone . [He]107-hertford was soon deep in meditation , and evidently the longer [he]107-hertford thought , the more [he]107-hertford was bothered . By - and - by [he]107-hertford began to pace the floor and mutter . “ Tush , [he]3329-the very prince _ must _ be [the prince]236-the prince ! Will any be in all [the land]3332-the land maintain there can be two , not of one blood and birth , so marvellously twinned ? And even were it so , ’ twere yet a stranger miracle that chance should cast the one into [the other ’s place]3333-the other ’s place . Nay , ’ tis folly , folly , folly ! ”[107-hertford] Presently [he]107-hertford said-- “ Now were [he]3329-the very prince impostor and called [himself]3329-the very prince [prince]3334-prince , look [you]3335-you _ that _ would be natural ; that would be reasonable . But lived ever [an impostor]3336-an impostor yet , who , being called [prince]3334-prince by [the king]294-the king , prince by [the court]3339-the court , [prince by all]3340-prince by all , _ denied _ [his]3329-the very prince dignity and pleaded against [his]3329-the very prince exaltation ? _ No _ ! By the soul of [St. Swithin]115-st. swithin , no ! This is [the true prince]3154-the true prince , gone mad ! ”[107-hertford] CHAPTER VII . [Tom]90-tom ’s first royal dinner . Somewhat after one in the afternoon , [Tom]90-tom resignedly underwent the ordeal of being dressed for dinner . [He]90-tom found [himself]90-tom as finely clothed as before , but everything different , everything changed , from [his]90-tom ruff to [his]90-tom stockings . [He]90-tom was presently conducted with much state to [a spacious and ornate apartment]624-a spacious and ornate apartment , where a table was already set for one . [Its]624-a spacious and ornate apartment furniture was all of massy gold , and beautified with designs which well - nigh made it priceless , since they were the work of [Benvenuto]116-benvenuto . [The room]507-the room was half - filled with [noble servitors]626-noble servitors . [A chaplain]627-a chaplain said grace , and [Tom]90-tom was about to fall to , for hunger had long been constitutional with [him]90-tom , but was interrupted by [[my]0-my lord the Earl of [Berkeley]23-berkeley , who fastened a napkin about [his]117-my lord the earl of berkeley , who fastened a napkin about his neck neck]117-my lord the earl of berkeley , who fastened a napkin about his neck ; for the great post of Diaperers to [the Prince of Wales]3050-the prince of wales was hereditary in [[this nobleman]629-this nobleman ’s family]630-this nobleman ’s family . [[Tom]90-tom ’s cupbearer]631-tom ’s cupbearer was present , and forestalled all [his]90-tom attempts to help [himself]90-tom to wine . [The Taster to [his]90-tom highness [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales]632-the taster to his highness the prince of wales was there also , prepared to taste any suspicious dish upon requirement , and run the risk of being poisoned . [He]632-the taster to his highness the prince of wales was only an ornamental appendage at this time , and was seldom called upon to exercise [his]632-the taster to his highness the prince of wales function ; but there had been times , not many generations past , when the office of taster had its perils , and was not a grandeur to be desired . Why [they]634-they did not use a dog or [a plumber]635-a plumber seems strange ; but all the ways of [royalty]436-royalty are strange . [My]0-my Lord d’Arcy , [First Groom of the Chamber]637-first groom of the chamber , was [there]3216-there , to do goodness knows what ; but there [he]632-the taster to his highness the prince of wales was -- let that suffice . [The Lord Chief Butler]118-the lord chief butler was [there]3216-there , and stood behind [Tom]90-tom ’s chair , overseeing the solemnities , under command of [the Lord Great Steward]640-the lord great steward and [the Lord Head Cook]641-the lord head cook , who stood near . [Tom]90-tom had [three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these ; but [they]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these were not all in [that room]643-that room , of course , nor the quarter of [them]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these ; neither was [Tom]90-tom aware yet that [they]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these existed . [All those that were present]644-all those that were present had been well drilled within the hour to remember that [the prince]236-the prince was temporarily out of [his]236-the prince head , and to be careful to show no surprise at [his]236-the prince vagaries . These ‘ vagaries ’ were soon on exhibition before [them]644-all those that were present ; but [they]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these only moved [their]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these compassion and [their]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these sorrow , not [their]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these mirth . It was a heavy affliction to [them]644-all those that were present to see [the beloved prince]646-the beloved prince so stricken . [Poor Tom]90-tom ate with [his]90-tom fingers mainly ; but [no one]554-no one smiled at it , or even seemed to observe it . [He]90-tom inspected [his]90-tom napkin curiously , and with deep interest , for it was of a very dainty and beautiful fabric , then said with simplicity-- “ [Prithee]100-prithee , take it away , lest in [mine]90-tom unheedfulness it be soiled . ”[90-tom] [The Hereditary Diaperer]648-the hereditary diaperer took it away with reverent manner , and without word or protest of any sort . [Tom]90-tom examined the turnips and the lettuce with interest , and asked what they were , and if they were to be eaten ; for it was only recently that [men]649-men had begun to raise these things in [England]2-england in place of importing [them]642-three hundred and eighty - four servants beside these as luxuries from [Holland]24-holland . { 1 } [His]90-tom question was answered with grave respect , and no surprise manifested . When [he]90-tom had finished [his]90-tom dessert , [he]90-tom filled [his]90-tom pockets with nuts ; but [nobody]650-nobody appeared to be aware of it , or disturbed by it . But the next moment [he]90-tom was [himself]90-tom disturbed by it , and showed discomposure ; for this was the only service [he]90-tom had been permitted to do with [his]90-tom own hands during the meal , and [he]90-tom did not doubt that [he]90-tom had done a most improper and unprincely thing . At that moment the muscles of [his]90-tom nose began to twitch , and the end of that organ to lift and wrinkle . This continued , and [Tom]90-tom began to evince a growing distress . [He]90-tom looked appealingly , first at one and then another of [the lords about [him]90-tom]651-the lords about him , and tears came into [his]90-tom eyes . [They]652-their sprang forward with dismay in [their]652-their faces , and begged to know [his]90-tom trouble . [Tom]90-tom said with genuine anguish-- “ [I]90-tom crave [your]652-their indulgence : [my]90-tom nose itcheth cruelly . What is the custom and usage in this emergence ? [Prithee]100-prithee , speed , for ’ tis but a little time that [I]90-tom can bear it . ”[90-tom] [None]3179-none smiled ; but [all]654-all were sore perplexed , and looked [one to the other]655-one to the other in deep tribulation for counsel . But behold , here was a dead wall , and nothing in English history to tell how to get over it . [The Master of Ceremonies]656-the master of ceremonies was not present : there was [no one who felt safe to venture upon [this uncharted sea]658-this uncharted sea , or risk the attempt to solve this solemn problem]657-no one who felt safe to venture upon this uncharted sea , or risk the attempt to solve this solemn problem . Alas ! there was no [Hereditary Scratcher]119-hereditary scratcher . Meantime the tears had overflowed [their]652-their banks , and begun to trickle down [Tom]90-tom ’s cheeks . [His]90-tom twitching nose was pleading more urgently than ever for relief . At last nature broke down the barriers of etiquette : [Tom]90-tom lifted up an inward prayer for pardon if [he]90-tom was doing wrong , and brought relief to the burdened hearts of [[his]90-tom court]659-his court by scratching [his]90-tom nose [himself]90-tom . [His]90-tom meal being ended , [a lord]660-a lord came and held before [him]90-tom a broad , shallow , golden dish with fragrant rosewater in it , to cleanse [his]90-tom mouth and fingers with ; and [[my]0-my lord]3168-my lord [the Hereditary Diaperer]648-the hereditary diaperer stood by with a napkin for [his]90-tom use . [Tom]90-tom gazed at the dish a puzzled moment or two , then raised it to [his]90-tom lips , and gravely took a draught . Then [he]90-tom returned it to [the waiting lord]663-the waiting lord , and said-- “ Nay , it likes [me]90-tom not , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord : it hath a pretty flavour , but it wanteth strength . ”[90-tom] This new eccentricity of [the prince]236-the prince ’s ruined mind made all the hearts about [him]236-the prince ache ; but the sad sight moved none to merriment . [Tom]90-tom ’s next unconscious blunder was to get up and leave the table just when [the chaplain]665-the chaplain had taken [his]665-the chaplain stand behind [his]665-the chaplain chair , and with uplifted hands , and closed , uplifted eyes , was in the act of beginning the blessing . Still [nobody]650-nobody seemed to perceive that [the prince]236-the prince had done a thing unusual . By [his]236-the prince own request [[our]668-our small friend]669-our small friend was now conducted to [[his]236-the prince private cabinet]670-his private cabinet , and left there alone to [his]236-the prince own devices . Hanging upon hooks in the oaken wainscoting were the several pieces of a suit of shining steel armour , covered all over with beautiful designs exquisitely inlaid in gold . This martial panoply belonged to [the true prince]3154-the true prince -- a recent present from [Madam Parr the Queen]120-madam parr the queen . [Tom]90-tom put on the greaves , the gauntlets , the plumed helmet , and such other pieces as [he]90-tom could don without assistance , and for a while was minded to call for help and complete the matter , but bethought [him]90-tom of the nuts [he]90-tom had brought away from dinner , and the joy it would be to eat them with [no crowd]672-no crowd to eye [him]90-tom , and [no Grand Hereditaries]673-no grand hereditaries to pester [him]90-tom with undesired services ; so [he]90-tom restored the pretty things to [their]674-their several places , and soon was cracking nuts , and feeling almost naturally happy for the first time since [God]87-god for [his]90-tom sins had made [him]90-tom [a prince]392-a prince . When the nuts were all gone , [he]90-tom stumbled upon some inviting books in [a closet]676-a closet , among them one about the etiquette of [the English court]677-the english court . This was a prize . [He]90-tom lay down upon [a sumptuous divan]678-a sumptuous divan , and proceeded to instruct [himself]90-tom with honest zeal . Let [us]679-us leave [him]90-tom there for the present . [CHAPTER VIII]121-chapter viii . The Question of the Seal . About five o’clock [Henry VIII]105-henry viii . awoke out of an unrefreshing nap , and muttered to [himself]105-henry viii , “ Troublous dreams , troublous dreams ! [Mine]105-henry viii end is now at hand : so say these warnings , and [my]105-henry viii failing pulses do confirm it . ”[105-henry viii] Presently a wicked light flamed up in [his]105-henry viii eye , and [he]105-henry viii muttered , “ Yet will not [I]105-henry viii die till _ [He]90-tom _ go before . ”[105-henry viii] [[His]105-henry viii attendants]680-his attendants perceiving that [he]105-henry viii was awake , [one of [them]680-his attendants]681-one of them asked [his]105-henry viii pleasure concerning [the Lord Chancellor]682-the lord chancellor , who was waiting without . “ Admit [him]90-tom , admit [him]90-tom ! ”[294-the king] exclaimed [the King]294-the king eagerly . [The Lord Chancellor]682-the lord chancellor entered , and knelt by [[the King]294-the king ’s couch]686-the king ’s couch , saying-- “ [I]682-the lord chancellor have given order , and , according to [the King]294-the king ’s command , [the peers of the realm]3344-the peers of the realm , in [their]3344-the peers of the realm robes , do now stand at the bar of [the House]292-the house , where , having confirmed [the Duke of Norfolk]122-the duke of norfolk ’s doom , [they]3344-the peers of the realm humbly wait [[his]294-the king majesty]3254-his majesty ’s further pleasure in the matter . ”[682-the lord chancellor] [The King]294-the king ’s face lit up with a fierce joy . Said he-- “ Lift [me]294-the king up ! In [[mine]294-the king own person]3347-mine own person will [I]294-the king go before [[my]294-the king Parliament]3235-my parliament , and with [mine]294-the king own hand will [I]294-the king seal the warrant that rids [me]294-the king of-- ”[294-the king] [His]294-the king voice failed ; an ashen pallor swept the flush from [his]294-the king cheeks ; and [the attendants]564-the attendants eased [him]294-the king back upon [his]294-the king pillows , and hurriedly assisted [him]294-the king with restoratives . Presently [he]294-the king said sorrowfully-- “ [Alack]106-alack , how have [I]294-the king longed for this sweet hour ! and lo , too late it cometh , and [I]294-the king am robbed of this so coveted chance . But speed [ye]106-alack , speed [ye]106-alack ! let [others]3324-others do this happy office sith ’ tis denied to [me]294-the king . [I]294-the king put [my]294-the king Great Seal in commission : choose [thou]3350-thou [the lords that shall compose it]3351-the lords that shall compose it , and get [ye]106-alack to [your]106-alack work . Speed [ye]106-alack , [man]3164-man ! Before the sun shall rise and set again , bring [me]294-the king [his]294-the king head that [I]294-the king may see it . ”[294-the king] “ According to [the King]294-the king ’s command , so shall it be . Will’t please [[your]294-the king majesty]3215-your majesty to order that the Seal be now restored to [me]294-the king , so that [I]294-the king may forth upon the business ? ”[294-the king] “ The Seal ? Who keepeth the Seal but [thou]3350-thou ? ”[294-the king] “ Please [[your]294-the king majesty]3215-your majesty , [you]294-the king did take it from [me]294-the king two days since , saying it should no more do [its]3356-its office till [[your]294-the king own royal hand]3357-your own royal hand should use it upon [the Duke of [Norfolk]22-norfolk]3358-the duke of norfolk ’s warrant . ”[294-the king] “ Why , so in sooth [I]294-the king did : [I]294-the king do remember . . . . What did [I]294-the king with [it]3356-its ? ... [I]294-the king am very feeble . . . . So oft these days doth [my]294-the king memory play [the traitor]3359-the traitor with [me]294-the king . . . . ’ tis strange , strange-- ”[294-the king] [The King]294-the king dropped into inarticulate mumblings , shaking [his]294-the king grey head weakly from time to time , and gropingly trying to recollect what [he]294-the king had done with the Seal . At last [[my]0-my Lord [Hertford]107-hertford]690-my lord hertford ventured to kneel and offer information-- “ [Sire]3212-sire , if that [I]294-the king may be so bold , here be several that do remember with [me]294-the king how that [you]3212-sire gave the Great Seal into the hands of [[his]690-my lord hertford highness [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]89-prince of wales , who lay lapped in silks and satins , unconscious of all this fuss , and not knowing that great lords and ladies were tending him and watching over him]3361-his highness the prince of wales to keep against the day that-- ”[294-the king] “ True , most true ! ”[294-the king] interrupted [the King]294-the king . “ Fetch it ! Go : time flieth ! ”[107-hertford] [Lord Hertford]107-hertford flew to [Tom]90-tom , but returned to [the King]294-the king before very long , troubled and empty - handed . [He]294-the king delivered [himself]294-the king to this effect-- “ It grieveth [me]294-the king , [[my]294-the king lord]3168-my lord [the King]294-the king , to bear so heavy and unwelcome tidings ; but it is the will of [God]87-god that [the prince]236-the prince ’s affliction abideth still , and [he]294-the king can not recall to mind that [he]294-the king received the Seal . So came [I]294-the king quickly to report , thinking it were waste of precious time , and little worth withal , that any should attempt to search the long array of [chambers]3365-chambers and saloons that belong unto [his]294-the king royal high-- ”[294-the king] A groan from [the King]294-the king interrupted [the lord]694-the lord at this point . After a little while [[his]294-the king majesty]3254-his majesty said , with a deep sadness in [his]3254-his majesty tone-- “ Trouble [him]294-the king no more , [poor child]3366-poor child . The hand of [God]87-god lieth heavy upon [him]294-the king , and [my]3254-his majesty heart goeth out in loving compassion for [him]294-the king , and sorrow that [I]3254-his majesty may not bear [his]294-the king burden on [mine]3254-his majesty old trouble - weighted shoulders , and so bring [him]294-the king peace . ”[3254-his majesty] [He]294-the king closed [his]294-the king eyes , fell to mumbling , and presently was silent . After a time [he]294-the king opened [his]294-the king eyes again , and gazed vacantly around until [his]294-the king glance rested upon [the kneeling Lord Chancellor]123-the kneeling lord chancellor . Instantly [his]123-the kneeling lord chancellor face flushed with wrath-- “ What , [thou]3367-thou here yet ! By the glory of [God]87-god , an ’ [thou]3367-thou gettest not about [that traitor]3368-that traitor ’s business , [[thy]3367-thou mitre]3369-thy mitre shall have holiday the morrow for lack of a head to grace withal ! ”[696-the trembling chancellor] [The trembling Chancellor]696-the trembling chancellor answered-- “ Good [[your]3254-his majesty Majesty]3215-your majesty , [I]696-the trembling chancellor cry [you]3254-his majesty mercy ! [I]696-the trembling chancellor but waited for the Seal . ”[696-the trembling chancellor] “ [Man]3164-man , hast lost [thy]3164-man wits ? And hark [ye]3164-man -- come no more till [thou]3164-man do bring [his]3164-man head . ”[697-the poor chancellor] [The poor Chancellor]697-the poor chancellor was not long in removing [himself]697-the poor chancellor from [this dangerous vicinity]698-this dangerous vicinity ; nor did [the commission]699-the commission waste time in giving the royal assent to the work of [the slavish Parliament]700-the slavish parliament , and appointing the morrow for the beheading of [the premier peer of [England]2-england]701-the premier peer of england , [the luckless Duke of [Norfolk]22-norfolk]702-the luckless duke of norfolk . CHAPTER IX . [The river]3104-the river pageant . At nine in the evening [the whole vast river - front of [the palace]425-the palace]704-the whole vast river - front of the palace was blazing with light . [The river itself]706-the river itself , as far as the eye could reach citywards , was so thickly covered with [watermen]707-watermen ’s boats and with [pleasure - barges]708-pleasure - barges , all fringed with coloured lanterns , and gently agitated by the waves , that [it]706-the river itself resembled [a glowing and limitless garden of flowers stirred to soft motion by summer winds]709-a glowing and limitless garden of flowers stirred to soft motion by summer winds . The grand terrace of stone steps leading down to [the water]710-the water , spacious enough to mass [the army of [a German principality upon]712-a german principality upon]711-the army of a german principality upon , was a picture to see , with [[its]706-the river itself ranks of [royal halberdiers in polished armour]714-royal halberdiers in polished armour]713-its ranks of royal halberdiers in polished armour , and [its troops of [brilliantly costumed servitors flitting up and down , and to and fro , in the hurry of preparation]716-brilliantly costumed servitors flitting up and down , and to and fro , in the hurry of preparation]715-its troops of brilliantly costumed servitors flitting up and down , and to and fro , in the hurry of preparation . Presently a command was given , and immediately [all living creatures]717-all living creatures vanished from the steps . Now the air was heavy with the hush of suspense and expectancy . As far as [one]3093-one ’s vision could carry , [he]3093-one might see the myriads of people in [the boats]719-the boats rise up , and shade [their]720-their eyes from the glare of lanterns and torches , and gaze toward [the palace]425-the palace . A file of forty or [fifty state barges]722-fifty state barges drew up to the steps . [They]722-fifty state barges were richly gilt , and [their]722-fifty state barges lofty prows and sterns were elaborately carved . Some of [them]722-fifty state barges were decorated with banners and streamers ; some with cloth - of - gold and arras embroidered with coats - of - arms ; others with silken flags that had numberless little silver bells fastened to them , which shook out tiny showers of joyous music whenever the breezes fluttered them ; [others of yet higher pretensions]723-others of yet higher pretensions , since [they]723-others of yet higher pretensions belonged to [nobles in [the prince]236-the prince ’s immediate service]724-nobles in the prince ’s immediate service , had [their]723-others of yet higher pretensions sides picturesquely fenced with shields gorgeously emblazoned with armorial bearings . [Each state barge]726-each state barge was towed by [a tender]727-a tender . Besides [the rowers]728-the rowers , [these tenders]729-these tenders carried each a number of [men - at - arms in glossy helmet and breastplate]730-men - at - arms in glossy helmet and breastplate , and [a company of [musicians]732-musicians]731-a company of musicians . [The advance - guard of the expected procession]733-the advance - guard of the expected procession now appeared in the great gateway , [a troop of [halberdiers]735-halberdiers]734-a troop of halberdiers . ‘ [They]734-a troop of halberdiers were dressed in striped hose of black and tawny , velvet caps graced at the sides with silver roses , and doublets of murrey and blue cloth , embroidered on the front and back with the three feathers , [the prince]236-the prince ’s blazon , woven in gold . [Their]734-a troop of halberdiers halberd staves were covered with crimson velvet , fastened with gilt nails , and ornamented with gold tassels . Filing off on the right and left , [they]734-a troop of halberdiers formed two long lines , extending from [the gateway of [the palace]425-the palace]737-the gateway of the palace to [the water]710-the water ’s edge . A thick rayed cloth or carpet was then unfolded , and laid down between [them]734-a troop of halberdiers by [attendants in the gold - and - crimson liveries of the prince]740-attendants in the gold - and - crimson liveries of the prince . This done , a flourish of trumpets resounded from within . A lively prelude arose from [the musicians on [the water]710-the water]741-the musicians on the water ; and [two ushers with white wands]743-two ushers with white wands marched with a slow and stately pace from the portal . [They]734-a troop of halberdiers were followed by [an officer bearing the civic mace , after whom came another carrying the city]744-an officer bearing the civic mace , after whom came another carrying the city ’s sword ; then [several sergeants of the city guard]745-several sergeants of the city guard , in [their]745-several sergeants of the city guard full accoutrements , and with badges on [their]745-several sergeants of the city guard sleeves ; then [the Garter King - at - arms]746-the garter king - at - arms , in [his]746-the garter king - at - arms tabard ; then [several Knights of the Bath]747-several knights of the bath , each with a white lace on [his]746-the garter king - at - arms sleeve ; then [[their]745-several sergeants of the city guard esquires]748-their esquires ; then [the judges]749-the judges , in [their]749-the judges robes of scarlet and coifs ; then [the Lord High Chancellor of [England]2-england , in a robe of scarlet , open before , and purfled with minever]123-the kneeling lord chancellor ; then a deputation of [aldermen]750-aldermen , in [their]750-aldermen scarlet cloaks ; and then the heads of [the different civic companies]751-the different civic companies , in [their]750-aldermen robes of state . Now came [twelve French gentlemen]752-twelve french gentlemen , in splendid habiliments , consisting of pourpoints of white damask barred with gold , short mantles of crimson velvet lined with violet taffeta , and carnation coloured hauts - de - chausses , and took [their]752-twelve french gentlemen way down [the steps]753-the steps . [They]752-twelve french gentlemen were of [the suite of [the French ambassador]755-the french ambassador]754-the suite of the french ambassador , and were followed by [twelve cavaliers of the suite of [the Spanish ambassador , clothed in black velvet , unrelieved by any ornament]757-the spanish ambassador , clothed in black velvet , unrelieved by any ornament]756-twelve cavaliers of the suite of the spanish ambassador , clothed in black velvet , unrelieved by any ornament . Following these came [several great English nobles with [[their]758-several great english nobles with their attendants attendants]759-their attendants]758-several great english nobles with their attendants . ’ There was a flourish of trumpets within ; and [[the Prince]236-the prince ’s uncle]761-the prince ’s uncle , [the future great Duke of [Somerset]25-somerset]762-the future great duke of somerset , emerged from the gateway , arrayed in a ‘ doublet of black cloth - of - gold , and a cloak of crimson satin flowered with gold , and ribanded with nets of silver . ’ [He]761-the prince ’s uncle turned , doffed [his]761-the prince ’s uncle plumed cap , bent [his]761-the prince ’s uncle body in a low reverence , and began to step backward , bowing at each step . A prolonged trumpet - blast followed , and a proclamation , “ Way for [the high and mighty the Lord Edward]3373-the high and mighty the lord edward , [Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3225-prince of wales ! ”[761-the prince ’s uncle] High aloft on [the palace]425-the palace walls a long line of red tongues of flame leapt forth with a thunder - crash ; [the massed world on [the river]3104-the river]764-the massed world on the river burst into a mighty roar of welcome ; and [Tom Canty]90-tom , [the cause and hero of it all]766-the cause and hero of it all , stepped into view and slightly bowed [his]90-tom princely head . [He]90-tom was ‘ magnificently habited in a doublet of white satin , with a front - piece of purple cloth - of - tissue , powdered with diamonds , and edged with ermine . Over this [he]90-tom wore a mantle of white cloth - of - gold , pounced with the triple - feathered crest , lined with blue satin , set with pearls and precious stones , and fastened with a clasp of brilliants . About [his]90-tom neck hung the order of the Garter , and several princely foreign orders ; ’ and wherever light fell upon [him]90-tom jewels responded with a blinding flash . [O Tom Canty]90-tom , born in a hovel , bred in [the gutters of [London]1-london]767-the gutters of london , familiar with rags and dirt and misery , what a spectacle is this ! CHAPTER X. [The Prince]236-the prince in the toils . [We]769-we left [John Canty]93-john canty dragging [the rightful prince]770-the rightful prince into [Offal Court]3091-offal court , with a noisy and delighted mob at [his]90-tom heels . There was but [one person in [it]3091-offal court who offered a pleading word for [the captive]773-the captive]772-one person in it who offered a pleading word for the captive , and [he]772-one person in it who offered a pleading word for the captive was not heeded ; [he]772-one person in it who offered a pleading word for the captive was hardly even heard , so great was the turmoil . [The Prince]236-the prince continued to struggle for freedom , and to rage against the treatment [he]236-the prince was suffering , until [John Canty]93-john canty lost what little patience was left in [him]90-tom , and raised [his]90-tom oaken cudgel in a sudden fury over [the Prince]236-the prince ’s head . [The single pleader for the lad]776-the single pleader for the lad sprang to stop [the man]495-the man ’s arm , and the blow descended upon [his]495-the man own wrist . [Canty]93-john canty roared out-- “ [Thou’lt]3375-thou’lt meddle , wilt [thou]3375-thou’lt ? Then have [thy]3375-thou’lt reward . ”[93-john canty] [His]93-john canty cudgel crashed down upon [the meddler]778-the meddler ’s head : there was a groan , a dim form sank to the ground among the feet of [the crowd]416-the crowd , and the next moment it lay there in the dark alone . [The mob]458-the mob pressed on , [their]458-the mob enjoyment nothing disturbed by this episode . Presently [the Prince]236-the prince found [himself]236-the prince in [[John Canty]93-john canty ’s abode]782-john canty ’s abode , with the door closed against [the outsiders]783-the outsiders . By the vague light of a tallow candle which was thrust into a bottle , [he]236-the prince made out the main features of [the loathsome den]784-the loathsome den , and also [the occupants of [it]784-the loathsome den]785-the occupants of it . [Two frowsy girls]786-two frowsy girls and [a middle - aged woman]787-a middle - aged woman cowered against the wall in one corner , with the aspect of animals habituated to harsh usage , and expecting and dreading it now . From another corner stole [a withered hag with streaming grey hair and malignant eyes]788-a withered hag with streaming grey hair and malignant eyes . [John Canty]93-john canty said to [this one--]789-this one-- “ [Tarry]124-tarry ! There ’s fine mummeries here . Mar [them]3376-them not till [thou’st]3377-thy enjoyed them : then let [thy]3377-thy hand be heavy as [thou]3377-thy wilt . Stand forth , [lad]3052-lad . Now say [thy]3377-thy foolery again , an thou’st not forgot it . Name [thy]3377-thy name . Who art [thou]3377-thy ? ”[93-john canty] The insulted blood mounted to [the little prince]430-the little prince ’s cheek once more , and [he]236-the prince lifted a steady and indignant gaze to [the man]495-the man ’s face and said-- “ ‘ Tis but ill - breeding in such as [thou]3377-thy to command [me]236-the prince to speak . [I]236-the prince tell [thee]3377-thy now , as [I]236-the prince told [thee]3377-thy before , [I]236-the prince am [Edward]87-god , [Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3225-prince of wales , and none other . ”[236-the prince] The stunning surprise of this reply nailed [the hag]792-the hag ’s feet to the floor where [she]792-the hag stood , and almost took [her]792-the hag breath . [She]792-the hag stared at [the Prince]236-the prince in stupid amazement , which so amused [[her]792-the hag ruffianly son]794-her ruffianly son , that [he]236-the prince burst into a roar of laughter . But the effect upon [[Tom Canty]90-tom ’s mother]795-tom canty ’s mother and [sisters]796-sisters was different . [Their]797-their dread of bodily injury gave way at once to distress of a different sort . [They]797-their ran forward with woe and dismay in [their]797-their faces , exclaiming-- “ Oh , poor [Tom]90-tom , [poor lad]3380-poor lad ! ”[797-their] [The mother]273-the mother fell on [her]273-the mother knees before [the Prince]236-the prince , put [her]273-the mother hands upon [his]236-the prince shoulders , and gazed yearningly into [his]236-the prince face through [her]273-the mother rising tears . Then [she]273-the mother said-- “ Oh , [[my]273-the mother poor boy]3381-my poor boy ! [Thy]90-tom foolish reading hath wrought its woeful work at last , and ta’en [thy]90-tom wit away . Ah ! why did’st [thou]90-tom cleave to it when [I]273-the mother so warned [thee]90-tom ‘ gainst it ? [Thou’st]90-tom broke [[thy]90-tom mother]3070-thy mother ’s heart . ”[273-the mother] [The Prince]236-the prince looked into [her]273-the mother face , and said gently-- “ [[Thy]236-the prince son]3383-thy son is well , and [hath]3383-thy son not lost [his]3383-thy son wits , [good dame]3384-good dame . Comfort [thee]273-the mother : let [me]236-the prince to [the palace where [he]3383-thy son is]3385-the palace where he is , and straightway will [the King]294-the king [[my]236-the prince father]3049-my father restore [him]3383-thy son to [thee]90-tom . ”[236-the prince] “ [The King]294-the king [[thy]90-tom father]3066-thy father ! Oh , [[my]236-the prince child]3390-my child ! unsay these words that be freighted with death for [thee]90-tom , and ruin for all that be near to [thee]90-tom . Shake of this gruesome dream . Call back [thy]90-tom poor wandering memory . Look upon [me]236-the prince . Am not [I]236-the prince [[thy]90-tom mother]3070-thy mother that bore [thee]90-tom , and loveth [thee]90-tom ? ”[236-the prince] [The Prince]236-the prince shook [his]236-the prince head and reluctantly said-- “ God knoweth [I]236-the prince am loth to grieve [thy]802-the woman heart ; but truly have [I]236-the prince never looked upon [thy]802-the woman face before . ”[236-the prince] [The woman]802-the woman sank back to a sitting posture on the floor , and , covering [her]802-the woman eyes with [her]802-the woman hands , gave way to heart - broken sobs and wailings . “ Let the show go on ! ”[90-tom] shouted [Canty]90-tom . “ What , Nan!--what , Bet ! [mannerless wenches]3392-mannerless wenches ! will [ye]3392-mannerless wenches stand in [the Prince]236-the prince ’s presence ? Upon [your]3392-mannerless wenches knees , [[ye]3392-mannerless wenches pauper scum]3394-ye pauper scum , and do [him]236-the prince reverence ! ”[90-tom] [He]236-the prince followed this with another horse - laugh . [The girls]298-the girls began to plead timidly for [[their]298-the girls brother]804-their brother ; and [Nan]92-nan said-- “ An [thou]3395-thou wilt but let [him]236-the prince to bed , [father]274-father , rest and sleep will heal [his]236-the prince madness : prithee , do . ”[92-nan] “ Do , [father]274-father , ”[110-the princess elizabeth] said [Bet]110-the princess elizabeth ; “ [he]236-the prince is more worn than is [his]236-the prince wo nt . To - morrow will [he]236-the prince be [himself]236-the prince again , and will beg with diligence , and come not empty [home]296-home again . ”[110-the princess elizabeth] This remark sobered [the father]281-the father ’s joviality , and brought [his]281-the father mind to business . [He]236-the prince turned angrily upon [the Prince]236-the prince , and said-- “ The morrow must [we]3399-we pay two pennies to [him]236-the prince that owns [this hole]3400-this hole ; two pennies , mark [ye]236-the prince -- all this money for a half - year ’s rent , else out of this [we]3399-we go . Show what [thou’st]3401-thy gathered with [thy]3401-thy lazy begging . ”[236-the prince] [The Prince]236-the prince said-- “ Offend [me]236-the prince not with [thy]3401-thy sordid matters . [I]236-the prince tell [thee]3401-thy again [I]236-the prince am [[the King]294-the king ’s son]3403-the king ’s son . ”[236-the prince] A sounding blow upon [the Prince]236-the prince ’s shoulder from [Canty]90-tom ’s broad palm sent [him]236-the prince staggering into [goodwife Canty]90-tom ’s arms , who clasped [him]236-the prince to [her]809-her breast , and sheltered [him]236-the prince from a pelting rain of cuffs and slaps by interposing [[her]809-her own person]810-her own person . [The frightened girls]811-the frightened girls retreated to [their]811-the frightened girls corner ; but [the grandmother]282-the grandmother stepped eagerly forward to assist [[her]282-the grandmother son]813-her son . [The Prince]236-the prince sprang away from [Mrs. Canty]125-mrs. canty , exclaiming-- “ [Thou]3404-thou shalt not suffer for [me]236-the prince , [madam]3287-madam . Let [these swine]3406-these swine do [their]3406-these swine will upon [me]236-the prince alone . ”[236-the prince] This speech infuriated [the swine]815-the swine to such a degree that [they]815-the swine set about [their]815-the swine work without waste of time . Between [them]815-the swine [they]815-the swine belaboured [the boy]520-the boy right soundly , and then gave [the girls]298-the girls and [[their]298-the girls mother]280-their mother a beating for showing sympathy for [the victim]819-the victim . “ Now , ”[125-mrs. canty] said [Canty]125-mrs. canty , “ to bed , all of [ye]298-the girls . The entertainment has tired [me]125-mrs. canty . ”[125-mrs. canty] The light was put out , and [the family]820-the family retired . As soon as the snorings of the head of [the house]292-the house and [[his]520-the boy mother]287-his mother showed that [they]815-the swine were asleep , [the young girls]582-the young girls crept to where [the Prince]236-the prince lay , and covered [him]236-the prince tenderly from the cold with straw and rags ; and [[their]298-the girls mother]280-their mother crept to [him]236-the prince also , and stroked [his]236-the prince hair , and cried over [him]236-the prince , whispering broken words of comfort and compassion in [his]236-the prince ear the while . [She]280-their mother had saved a morsel for [him]236-the prince to eat , also ; but [the boy]520-the boy ’s pains had swept away all appetite -- at least for black and tasteless crusts . [He]236-the prince was touched by [her]280-their mother brave and costly defence of [him]236-the prince , and by [her]280-their mother commiseration ; and [he]236-the prince thanked [her]280-their mother in very noble and princely words , and begged [her]280-their mother to go to [her]280-their mother sleep and try to forget [her]280-their mother sorrows . And [he]236-the prince added that [the King]294-the king [[his]236-the prince father]306-his father would not let [her]280-their mother loyal kindness and devotion go unrewarded . This return to [his]236-the prince ‘ madness ’ broke [her]280-their mother heart anew , and [she]280-their mother strained [him]236-the prince to [her]280-their mother breast again and again , and then went back , drowned in tears , to [her]280-their mother bed . As [she]280-their mother lay thinking and mourning , the suggestion began to creep into [her]280-their mother mind that there was an undefinable something about [this boy]829-this boy that was lacking in [Tom Canty]90-tom , mad or sane . [She]280-their mother could not describe it , [she]280-their mother could not tell just what it was , and yet [her]280-their mother sharp mother - instinct seemed to detect it and perceive it . What if [the boy]520-the boy were really not [[her]280-their mother son]813-her son , after all ? Oh , absurd ! [She]280-their mother almost smiled at the idea , spite of [her]280-their mother griefs and troubles . No matter , [she]280-their mother found that it was an idea that would not ‘ down , ’ but persisted in haunting [her]280-their mother . It pursued [her]280-their mother , it harassed [her]280-their mother , it clung to [her]280-their mother , and refused to be put away or ignored . At last [she]280-their mother perceived that there was not going to be any peace for [her]280-their mother until [she]280-their mother should devise a test that should prove , clearly and without question , whether [this lad]832-this lad was [[her]280-their mother son]813-her son or not , and so banish these wearing and worrying doubts . Ah , yes , this was plainly the right way out of the difficulty ; therefore [she]280-their mother set [her]280-their mother wits to work at once to contrive that test . But it was an easier thing to propose than to accomplish . [She]280-their mother turned over in [her]280-their mother mind one promising test after another , but was obliged to relinquish them all -- none of [them]834-them were absolutely sure , absolutely perfect ; and an imperfect one could not satisfy [her]280-their mother . Evidently [she]280-their mother was racking [her]280-their mother head in vain -- it seemed manifest that [she]280-their mother must give the matter up . While this depressing thought was passing through [her]280-their mother mind , [her]280-their mother ear caught the regular breathing of [the boy]520-the boy , and [she]280-their mother knew [he]520-the boy had fallen asleep . And while [she]280-their mother listened , the measured breathing was broken by a soft , startled cry , such as one utters in a troubled dream . This chance occurrence furnished [her]280-their mother instantly with a plan worth all [her]280-their mother laboured tests combined . [She]280-their mother at once set [herself]280-their mother feverishly , but noiselessly , to work to relight [her]280-their mother candle , muttering to [herself]280-their mother , “ Had [I]280-their mother but seen [him]520-the boy _ then _ , [I]280-their mother should have known ! Since that day , when [he]520-the boy was little , that the powder burst in [his]520-the boy face , [he]520-the boy hath never been startled of a sudden out of [his]520-the boy dreams or out of [his]520-the boy thinkings , but [he]520-the boy hath cast [his]520-the boy hand before [his]520-the boy eyes , even as [he]520-the boy did that day ; and not as [others]3324-others would do it , with the palm inward , but always with the palm turned outward -- [I]280-their mother have seen it a hundred times , and it hath never varied nor ever failed . Yes , [I]280-their mother shall soon know , now ! ”[280-their mother] By this time [she]280-their mother had crept to [the slumbering boy]836-the slumbering boy ’s side , with the candle , shaded , in [her]280-their mother hand . [She]280-their mother bent heedfully and warily over [him]836-the slumbering boy , scarcely breathing in [her]280-their mother suppressed excitement , and suddenly flashed the light in [his]836-the slumbering boy face and struck the floor by [his]836-the slumbering boy ear with [her]280-their mother knuckles . [The sleeper]837-the sleeper ’s eyes sprang wide open , and [he]836-the slumbering boy cast a startled stare about [him]836-the slumbering boy -- but [he]836-the slumbering boy made no special movement with [his]836-the slumbering boy hands . [The poor woman]838-the poor woman was smitten almost helpless with surprise and grief ; but [she]280-their mother contrived to hide [her]280-their mother emotions , and to soothe [the boy]520-the boy to sleep again ; then [she]280-their mother crept apart and communed miserably with [herself]280-their mother upon the disastrous result of [her]280-their mother experiment . [She]280-their mother tried to believe that [her]280-their mother [Tom]90-tom ’s madness had banished this habitual gesture of [his]836-the slumbering boy ; but [she]280-their mother could not do it . “ No , ”[280-their mother] [she]280-their mother said , “ [his]836-the slumbering boy _ hands _ are not mad ; they could not unlearn so old a habit in so brief a time . Oh , this is a heavy day for [me]280-their mother ! ”[280-their mother] Still , hope was as stubborn now as doubt had been before ; [she]280-their mother could not bring [herself]280-their mother to accept the verdict of the test ; [she]280-their mother must try the thing again -- the failure must have been only an accident ; so [she]280-their mother startled [the boy]520-the boy out of [his]520-the boy sleep a second and a third time , at intervals -- with the same result which had marked the first test ; then [she]280-their mother dragged [herself]280-their mother to bed , and fell sorrowfully asleep , saying , “ But [I]280-their mother can not give [him]520-the boy up -- oh no , [I]280-their mother can not , [I]280-their mother cannot -- [he]520-the boy _ must _ be [[my]280-their mother boy]3408-my boy ! ”[280-their mother] [The poor mother]841-the poor mother ’s interruptions having ceased , and [the Prince]236-the prince ’s pains having gradually lost [their]843-their power to disturb [him]236-the prince , utter weariness at last sealed [his]236-the prince eyes in a profound and restful sleep . Hour after hour slipped away , and still [he]236-the prince slept like the dead . Thus four or five hours passed . Then [his]236-the prince stupor began to lighten . Presently , while half asleep and half awake , [he]236-the prince murmured-- “ [Sir William]112-sir william herbert ! ”[236-the prince] After a moment-- “ [Ho]3409-ho , [Sir William Herbert]112-sir william herbert ! Hie [thee]112-sir william herbert hither , and list to the strangest dream that ever . . . [Sir William]112-sir william herbert ! dost hear ? [Man]3164-man , [I]236-the prince did think [me]236-the prince changed to [a pauper]3411-a pauper , and . . . Ho there ! [Guards]340-guards ! [Sir William]112-sir william herbert ! What ! is there [no groom of [the chamber]3414-the chamber]3413-no groom of the chamber in waiting ? [Alack]106-alack ! it shall go hard with-- ”[236-the prince] “ What aileth [thee]236-the prince ? ”[236-the prince] asked a whisper near [him]236-the prince . “ Who art [thou]236-the prince calling ? ”[236-the prince] “ [Sir William Herbert]112-sir william herbert . Who art [thou]236-the prince ? ”[236-the prince] “ [I]236-the prince ? Who should [I]236-the prince be , but [[thy]236-the prince sister]3415-thy sister [Nan]92-nan ? Oh , [Tom]90-tom , [I]236-the prince had forgot ! [Thou’rt]236-the prince mad yet -- [poor lad]3380-poor lad , [thou’rt]236-the prince mad yet : would [I]236-the prince had never woke to know it again ! But prithee master [thy]236-the prince tongue , lest [we]3417-we be all beaten till [we]3417-we die ! ”[236-the prince] [The startled Prince]844-the startled prince sprang partly up , but a sharp reminder from [his]236-the prince stiffened bruises brought [him]236-the prince to [himself]236-the prince , and [he]236-the prince sank back among [his]236-the prince foul straw with a moan and the ejaculation-- “ Alas ! it was no dream , then ! ”[236-the prince] In a moment all the heavy sorrow and misery which sleep had banished were upon [him]236-the prince again , and [he]236-the prince realised that [he]236-the prince was no longer [a petted prince in [a palace]846-a palace , with the adoring eyes of a nation upon [him]236-the prince]845-a petted prince in a palace , with the adoring eyes of a nation upon him , but [a pauper]3411-a pauper , [an outcast]848-an outcast , clothed in rags , prisoner in a den fit only for beasts , and consorting with [beggars]849-beggars and [thieves]291-thieves . In the midst of [his]236-the prince grief [he]236-the prince began to be conscious of hilarious noises and shoutings , apparently but a block or two away . The next moment there were several sharp raps at the door ; [John Canty]93-john canty ceased from snoring and said-- “ Who knocketh ? What wilt [thou]3418-thou ? ”[93-john canty] A voice answered-- “ Know’st [thou]3418-thou who it was [thou]3418-thou laid [thy]3418-thou cudgel on ? ”[93-john canty] “ No . Neither know [I]93-john canty , nor care . ”[93-john canty] “ Belike thou’lt change [thy]3418-thou note eftsoons . [The man]495-the man is this moment delivering up the ghost . ’ Tis [the priest]320-the priest , [Father Andrew]94-father andrew ! ”[93-john canty] “ God - a - mercy ! ”[93-john canty] exclaimed [Canty]93-john canty . [He]93-john canty roused [[his]93-john canty family]851-his family , and hoarsely commanded , “ Up with [ye]851-his family all and fly -- or bide where [ye]851-his family are and perish ! ”[93-john canty] Scarcely five minutes later [the Canty household]852-the canty household were in [the street]853-the street and flying for [their]852-the canty household lives . [John Canty]93-john canty held [the Prince]236-the prince by the wrist , and hurried [him]236-the prince along the dark way , giving [him]236-the prince this caution in a low voice-- “ Mind [thy]236-the prince tongue , [thou mad fool]3421-thou mad fool , and speak not [our]236-the prince name . [I]93-john canty will choose [me]93-john canty a new name , speedily , to throw [the law]3422-the law ’s dogs off the scent . Mind [thy]236-the prince tongue , [I]93-john canty tell [thee]236-the prince ! ”[93-john canty] [He]93-john canty growled these words to [the rest of [the family--]856-the family--]855-the rest of the family-- “ If it so chance that [we]236-the prince be separated , let each make for [London Bridge]4-london bridge ; whoso findeth [himself]236-the prince as far as [the last linen - draper ’s shop on [the bridge]3424-the bridge]3423-the last linen - draper ’s shop on the bridge , let [him]236-the prince tarry there till [the others]3425-the others be come , then will [we]236-the prince flee into [Southwark]27-southwark together . ”[93-john canty] At this moment [the party]857-the party burst suddenly out of darkness into light ; and not only into light , but into the midst of [a multitude of singing , dancing , and shouting people]858-a multitude of singing , dancing , and shouting people , massed together on [the river frontage]859-the river frontage . There was a line of bonfires stretching as far as [one]3093-one could see , up and down [the Thames]7-the thames ; [[London]1-london Bridge]861-london bridge was illuminated ; [Southwark Bridge]28-southwark bridge likewise ; [the entire river]862-the entire river was aglow with the flash and sheen of coloured lights ; and constant explosions of fireworks filled the skies with an intricate commingling of shooting splendours and a thick rain of dazzling sparks that almost turned night into day ; everywhere were [crowds of revellers]863-crowds of revellers ; all [London]1-london seemed to be at large . [John Canty]93-john canty delivered [himself]93-john canty of a furious curse and commanded a retreat ; but it was too late . [He]93-john canty and [[his]93-john canty tribe]864-his tribe were swallowed up in [that swarming hive of humanity]865-that swarming hive of humanity , and hopelessly separated from [each other]246-each other in an instant . [We]867-we are not considering that [the Prince]236-the prince was [one of [[his]93-john canty tribe]864-his tribe]869-one of his tribe ; [Canty]93-john canty still kept [his]93-john canty grip upon [him]236-the prince . [The Prince]89-prince of wales , who lay lapped in silks and satins , unconscious of all this fuss , and not knowing that great lords and ladies were tending him and watching over him ’s heart was beating high with hopes of escape , now . [A burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor]871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor , found [himself]871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor rudely shoved by [Canty]93-john canty in [his]871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor efforts to plough through [the crowd]416-the crowd ; [he]871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor laid [his]871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor great hand on [Canty]93-john canty ’s shoulder and said-- “ Nay , whither so fast , [friend]3426-friend ? Dost canker [thy]93-john canty soul with sordid business when all that be [leal men]3427-leal men and true make holiday ? ”[871-a burly waterman , considerably exalted with liquor] “ [Mine]93-john canty affairs are [mine]93-john canty own , [they]3428-they concern [thee]93-john canty not , ”[93-john canty] answered [Canty]93-john canty , roughly ; “ take away [thy]93-john canty hand and let [me]93-john canty pass . ”[93-john canty] “ Sith that is [thy]93-john canty humour , [thou’lt]93-john canty _ not _ pass , till [thou’st]93-john canty drunk to [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales , [I]873-the waterman tell [thee]93-john canty that , ”[873-the waterman] said [the waterman]873-the waterman , barring the way resolutely . “ Give [me]873-the waterman the cup , then , and make speed , make speed ! ”[873-the waterman] [Other revellers]874-other revellers were interested by this time . [They]874-other revellers cried out-- “ The loving - cup , the loving - cup ! make [the sour knave]3430-the sour knave drink the loving - cup , else will [we]874-other revellers feed [him]3430-the sour knave to the fishes . ”[874-other revellers] So a huge loving - cup was brought ; [the waterman]873-the waterman , grasping it by one of its handles , and with the other hand bearing up the end of an imaginary napkin , presented it in due and ancient form to [Canty]93-john canty , who had to grasp the opposite handle with one of [his]93-john canty hands and take off the lid with the other , according to ancient custom . This left [the Prince]236-the prince hand - free for a second , of course . [He]236-the prince wasted no time , but dived among the forest of legs about [him]236-the prince and disappeared . In another moment [he]236-the prince could not have been harder to find , under that tossing sea of life , if its billows had been [the Atlantic]29-the atlantic ’s and [he]236-the prince a lost sixpence . [He]236-the prince very soon realised this fact , and straightway busied [himself]236-the prince about [his]236-the prince own affairs without further thought of [John Canty]93-john canty . [He]236-the prince quickly realised another thing , too . To wit , that [a spurious Prince of [Wales]3-wales]877-a spurious prince of wales was being feasted by [the city]370-the city in [his]877-a spurious prince of wales stead . [He]236-the prince easily concluded that [the pauper lad]879-the pauper lad , [Tom Canty]90-tom , had deliberately taken advantage of [his]90-tom stupendous opportunity and become [a usurper]880-a usurper . Therefore there was but one course to pursue -- find [his]236-the prince way to [the Guildhall]881-the guildhall , make [himself]236-the prince known , and denounce [the impostor]882-the impostor . [He]236-the prince also made up [his]236-the prince mind that [Tom]90-tom should be allowed a reasonable time for spiritual preparation , and then be hanged , drawn and quartered , according to the law and usage of the day in cases of high treason . CHAPTER XI . At [Guildhall]30-guildhall . [The royal barge]883-the royal barge , attended by [[its]883-the royal barge gorgeous fleet]884-its gorgeous fleet , took [its]883-the royal barge stately way down [the Thames]7-the thames through the wilderness of [illuminated boats]885-illuminated boats . The air was laden with music ; [the river banks]886-the river banks were beruffled with joy - flames ; [the distant city]887-the distant city lay in a soft luminous glow from [its]887-the distant city countless invisible bonfires ; above [it]887-the distant city rose many a slender spire into the sky , incrusted with sparkling lights , wherefore in their remoteness they seemed like jewelled lances thrust aloft ; as [the fleet]888-the fleet swept along , it was greeted from [the banks]889-the banks with a continuous hoarse roar of cheers and the ceaseless flash and boom of artillery . To [Tom Canty]90-tom , half buried in [his]90-tom silken cushions , these sounds and this spectacle were a wonder unspeakably sublime and astonishing . To [[his]90-tom little friends at [his]90-tom side]890-his little friends at his side , [the Princess Elizabeth]110-the princess elizabeth and [the Lady Jane Grey]97-the lady jane grey , [they]890-his little friends at his side were nothing . Arrived at [the Dowgate]31-the dowgate , [the fleet]888-the fleet was towed up [the limpid Walbrook]32-the limpid walbrook ( whose channel has now been for two centuries buried out of sight under [acres of buildings]892-acres of buildings ) to [Bucklersbury]33-bucklersbury , past [houses]893-houses and under bridges populous with [merry - makers]894-merry - makers and brilliantly lighted , and at last came to a halt in a basin where now is [Barge Yard]34-barge yard , in [the centre of [the ancient city of]238-the ancient city of [London]1-london]895-the centre of the ancient city of london . [Tom]90-tom disembarked , and [he]90-tom and [his]90-tom gallant procession crossed [Cheapside]8-cheapside and made a short march through [the Old Jewry]897-the old jewry and [Basinghall Street]35-basinghall street to [the Guildhall]881-the guildhall . [Tom]90-tom and [[his]90-tom little ladies]899-his little ladies were received with due ceremony by [the Lord Mayor]597-the lord mayor and [the Fathers of [the City]370-the city]901-the fathers of the city , in [their]903-their gold chains and scarlet robes of state , and conducted to a rich canopy of state at the head of [the great hall]904-the great hall , preceded by [heralds making proclamation]905-heralds making proclamation , and by the Mace and the City Sword . [The lords]557-the lords and ladies who were to attend upon [Tom]90-tom and [[his]90-tom two small friends]907-his two small friends took [their]557-the lords places behind [their]557-the lords chairs . At a lower table [the Court grandees]908-the court grandees and [other guests of noble degree]909-other guests of noble degree were seated , with [the magnates of [the city]370-the city]910-the magnates of the city ; [the commoners]912-the commoners took places at a multitude of tables on [the main floor of [the hall]914-the hall]913-the main floor of the hall . From [their]915-their lofty vantage - ground [the giants Gog]916-the giants gog and [Magog]126-magog , [the ancient guardians of [the city]370-the city]917-the ancient guardians of the city , contemplated the spectacle below [them]915-their with eyes grown familiar to it in forgotten generations . There was a bugle - blast and a proclamation , and [a fat butler]919-a fat butler appeared in a high perch in the leftward wall , followed by [his]919-a fat butler servitors bearing with impressive solemnity [a royal baron of beef]920-a royal baron of beef , smoking hot and ready for the knife . After grace , [Tom]90-tom ( being instructed ) rose -- and [the whole house]921-the whole house with [him]90-tom -- and drank from a portly golden loving - cup with [the Princess Elizabeth]585-the princess elizabeth ; from [her]585-the princess elizabeth it passed to the Lady Jane , and then traversed [the general assemblage]923-the general assemblage . So the banquet began . By midnight [the revelry]924-the revelry was at its height . Now came one of those picturesque spectacles so admired in that old day . A description of it is still extant in the quaint wording of [a chronicler who witnessed it]925-a chronicler who witnessed it : ‘ Space being made , presently entered [a baron]926-a baron and [an earl appareled after the Turkish fashion]927-an earl appareled after the turkish fashion in long robes of bawdkin powdered with gold ; hats on [their]915-their heads of crimson velvet , with great rolls of gold , girded with two swords , called scimitars , hanging by great bawdricks of gold . Next came yet [another baron]928-another baron and [another earl , in two long gowns of yellow satin , traversed with white satin , and in every bend of white was a bend of crimson satin]929-another earl , in two long gowns of yellow satin , traversed with white satin , and in every bend of white was a bend of crimson satin , after the fashion of [Russia]36-russia , with furred hats of gray on [their]915-their heads ; either of [them]915-their having an hatchet in [their]915-their hands , and boots with pykes ’ ( points a foot long ) , ’ turned up . And after [them]915-their came [a knight]930-a knight , then [the Lord High Admiral]931-the lord high admiral , and with [him]931-the lord high admiral [five nobles , in doublets of crimson velvet , voyded low on the back and before to the cannell - bone]932-five nobles , in doublets of crimson velvet , voyded low on the back and before to the cannell - bone , laced on the breasts with chains of silver ; and over that , short cloaks of crimson satin , and on [their]915-their heads hats after [the dancers]933-the dancers ’ fashion , with pheasants ’ feathers in them . These were appareled after the fashion of [Prussia]37-prussia . [The torchbearers , which were about an hundred]934-the torchbearers , which were about an hundred , were appareled in crimson satin and green , like [Moors]127-moors , [their]934-the torchbearers , which were about an hundred faces black . Next came in a mommarye . Then [the minstrels]935-the minstrels , which were disguised , danced ; and [the lords]557-the lords and [ladies]254-ladies did wildly dance also , that it was a pleasure to behold . ’ And while [Tom]90-tom , in [his]90-tom high seat , was gazing upon this ‘ wild ’ dancing , lost in admiration of the dazzling commingling of kaleidoscopic colours which the whirling turmoil of gaudy figures below [him]90-tom presented , [the ragged but real little Prince of [Wales]3-wales]938-the ragged but real little prince of wales was proclaiming [his]938-the ragged but real little prince of wales rights and [his]938-the ragged but real little prince of wales wrongs , denouncing [the impostor]882-the impostor , and clamouring for admission at the gates of [Guildhall]30-guildhall ! [The crowd]416-the crowd enjoyed this episode prodigiously , and pressed forward and craned [their]416-the crowd necks to see [the small rioter]941-the small rioter . Presently [they]416-the crowd began to taunt [him]941-the small rioter and mock at [him]941-the small rioter , purposely to goad [him]941-the small rioter into a higher and still more entertaining fury . Tears of mortification sprang to [his]941-the small rioter eyes , but [he]941-the small rioter stood [his]941-the small rioter ground and defied [the mob]458-the mob right royally . Other taunts followed , added mockings stung [him]941-the small rioter , and [he]941-the small rioter exclaimed-- “ [I]941-the small rioter tell [ye]416-the crowd again , [[you]416-the crowd pack of [unmannerly curs]3432-unmannerly curs]3431-you pack of unmannerly curs , [I]941-the small rioter am [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales ! And all forlorn and friendless as [I]941-the small rioter be , with none to give [me]941-the small rioter word of grace or help [me]941-the small rioter in [my]941-the small rioter need , yet will not [I]941-the small rioter be driven from [my]941-the small rioter ground , but will maintain it ! ”[941-the small rioter] “ Though [thou]3434-thou be [prince]3334-prince or [no prince]3436-no prince , ’ tis [all one]3437-all one , [thou]3434-thou be’st [a gallant lad]3438-a gallant lad , and [not friendless neither]3439-not friendless neither ! Here stand [I]622-the speaker by [thy]3434-thou side to prove it ; and mind [I]622-the speaker tell [thee]3434-thou [thou]3434-thou might’st have [a worser friend than [Miles Hendon]128-hendon]3440-a worser friend than miles hendon and yet not tire [thy]3434-thou legs with seeking . Rest [thy]3434-thou small jaw , [[my]622-the speaker child]3390-my child ; [I]622-the speaker talk the language of these base kennel - rats like to [a very native]3442-a very native . ”[622-the speaker] [The speaker]622-the speaker was a sort of [Don Caesar de Bazan]129-don caesar de bazan in dress , aspect , and bearing . [He]622-the speaker was tall , trim - built , muscular . [His]622-the speaker doublet and trunks were of rich material , but faded and threadbare , and their gold - lace adornments were sadly tarnished ; [his]622-the speaker ruff was rumpled and damaged ; the plume in [his]622-the speaker slouched hat was broken and had a bedraggled and disreputable look ; at [his]622-the speaker side [he]622-the speaker wore a long rapier in a rusty iron sheath ; [[his]622-the speaker swaggering carriage]944-his swaggering carriage marked [him]622-the speaker at once as a ruffler of [the camp]945-the camp . The speech of [this fantastic figure]946-this fantastic figure was received with an explosion of jeers and laughter . [Some]372-some cried , “ ‘ Tis [another prince in disguise]3443-another prince in disguise ! ”[372-some] “ ‘ Ware [thy]949-the stranger tongue , [friend]3426-friend : belike [he]3443-another prince in disguise is dangerous ! ”[372-some] “ [Marry]99-marry , [he]3443-another prince in disguise looketh it -- mark [his]3443-another prince in disguise eye ! ”[372-some] “ Pluck [the lad]496-the lad from [him]3443-another prince in disguise -- to the horse - pond wi ’ [the cub]3446-the cub ! ”[372-some] Instantly a hand was laid upon [the Prince]236-the prince , under the impulse of this happy thought ; as instantly [the stranger]949-the stranger ’s long sword was out and [the meddler]778-the meddler went to the earth under a sounding thump with the flat of it . The next moment a score of voices shouted , “ Kill the dog ! Kill [him]3443-another prince in disguise !
