Explain -- speak out . ”[146-tom] “ But , good [[your]3243-my liege Majesty]3215-your majesty , there ’s nought that needeth simplifying.--None may visit [the sacred person of [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales]3705-the sacred person of the prince of wales with blows ; wherefore , when [he]3699-the master faulteth , ’ tis [I]146-tom that take [them]3707-them ; and meet it is and right , for that it is [mine]146-tom office and [my]146-tom livelihood . ”[146-tom] { 1 } [Tom]146-tom stared at [the tranquil boy]1253-the tranquil boy , observing to [himself]146-tom , “ [Lo]133-lo , it is a wonderful thing,--a most strange and curious trade ; [I]146-tom marvel [they]3691-my poor master have not hired [a boy]239-a boy to take [my]146-tom combings and [my]146-tom dressings for [me]146-tom -- would heaven [they]3691-my poor master would!--an ’ [they]3691-my poor master will do this thing , [I]146-tom will take [my]146-tom lashings in [[mine]146-tom own person]3347-mine own person , giving [God]87-god thanks for the change . ”[146-tom] Then [he]146-tom said aloud-- “ And hast [thou]1253-the tranquil boy been beaten , [poor friend]3710-poor friend , according to the promise ? ”[146-tom] “ No , good [[your]3710-poor friend Majesty]3215-your majesty , [my]146-tom punishment was appointed for this day , and peradventure it may be annulled , as unbefitting the season of mourning that is come upon [us]3712-us ; [I]146-tom know not , and so have made bold to come hither and remind [[your]3710-poor friend Grace]3566-your grace about [your]3710-poor friend gracious promise to intercede in [my]146-tom behalf-- ”[146-tom] “ With [the master]3699-the master ? To save [thee]1253-the tranquil boy [thy]1253-the tranquil boy whipping ? ”[146-tom] “ Ah , [thou]1253-the tranquil boy dost remember ! ”[146-tom] “ [My]146-tom memory mendeth , [thou]1253-the tranquil boy seest . Set [thy]1253-the tranquil boy mind at ease -- [thy]1253-the tranquil boy back shall go unscathed -- [I]146-tom will see to it . ”[146-tom] “ Oh , thanks , [[my]520-the boy good lord]3715-my good lord ! ”[520-the boy] cried [the boy]520-the boy , dropping upon [his]520-the boy knee again . “ Mayhap [I]520-the boy have ventured far enow ; and yet-- ”[520-the boy] Seeing [Master Humphrey]148-master humphrey hesitate , [Tom]146-tom encouraged [him]520-the boy to go on , saying [he]520-the boy was “ in the granting mood . ”[146-tom] “ Then will [I]146-tom speak it out , for it lieth near [my]146-tom heart . Sith [thou]1253-the tranquil boy art no more [Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3225-prince of wales but [King]3155-king , [thou]1253-the tranquil boy canst order matters as [thou]1253-the tranquil boy wilt , with none to say [thee]1253-the tranquil boy nay ; wherefore it is not in reason that [thou]1253-the tranquil boy wilt longer vex [thyself]1253-the tranquil boy with dreary studies , but wilt burn [thy]1253-the tranquil boy books and turn [thy]1253-the tranquil boy mind to things less irksome . Then am [I]146-tom ruined , and [[mine]146-tom orphan sisters]3718-mine orphan sisters with [me]146-tom ! ”[146-tom] “ Ruined ? [Prithee]100-prithee how ? ”[146-tom] “ [My]146-tom back is [my]146-tom bread , [[O]1253-the tranquil boy [my]146-tom gracious liege]3719-o my gracious liege ! if it go idle , [I]146-tom starve . An ’ [thou]1253-the tranquil boy cease from study [[mine]146-tom office]3720-mine office is gone [thou’lt]1253-the tranquil boy need [no whipping - boy]3721-no whipping - boy . Do not turn [me]146-tom away ! ”[146-tom] [Tom]146-tom was touched with this pathetic distress . [He]146-tom said , with a right royal burst of generosity-- “ Discomfort thyself no further , [lad]3052-lad . [Thine]3723-thine office shall be permanent in [thee]3052-lad and [thy]3052-lad line for ever . ”[146-tom] Then [he]146-tom struck [the boy]520-the boy a light blow on the shoulder with the flat of [his]146-tom sword , exclaiming , “ Rise , [Humphrey Marlow]147-humphrey , [Hereditary Grand Whipping - Boy]3724-hereditary grand whipping - boy to [the Royal House of [England]2-england]3725-the royal house of england ! Banish sorrow -- [I]146-tom will betake [me]146-tom to [my]146-tom books again , and study so ill that [they]3726-they must in justice treble [thy]3052-lad wage , so mightily shall the business of [thine office]3727-thine office be augmented . ”[146-tom] [The grateful Humphrey]147-humphrey responded fervidly-- “ Thanks , [O most noble master]3728-o most noble master , this princely lavishness doth far surpass [my]146-tom most distempered dreams of fortune . Now shall [I]146-tom be happy all [my]146-tom days , and all [the house of [Marlow]51-marlow]3729-the house of marlow after [me]146-tom . ”[146-tom] [Tom]146-tom had wit enough to perceive that here was [a lad who could be useful to [him]146-tom]1256-a lad who could be useful to him . [He]146-tom encouraged [Humphrey]147-humphrey to talk , and [he]147-humphrey was nothing loath . [He]146-tom was delighted to believe that [he]146-tom was helping in [Tom]146-tom ’s ‘ cure ’ ; for always , as soon as [he]146-tom had finished calling back to [Tom]146-tom ’s diseased mind the various particulars of [his]146-tom experiences and adventures in [the royal school - room]1257-the royal school - room and elsewhere about [the palace]425-the palace , [he]146-tom noticed that [Tom]146-tom was then able to ‘ recall ’ the circumstances quite clearly . At the end of an hour [Tom]146-tom found [himself]146-tom well freighted with very valuable information concerning personages and matters pertaining to [the Court]3339-the court ; so [he]146-tom resolved to draw instruction from this source daily ; and to this end [he]146-tom would give order to admit [Humphrey]147-humphrey to the royal closet whenever [he]147-humphrey might come , provided [the Majesty of [England]2-england]551-the majesty of england was not engaged with [other people]1261-other people . [Humphrey]147-humphrey had hardly been dismissed when [[my]0-my Lord Hertford]690-my lord hertford arrived with more trouble for [Tom]146-tom . [He]146-tom said that [the Lords of the Council]1263-the lords of the council , fearing that some overwrought report of [the King]294-the king ’s damaged health might have leaked out and got abroad , [they]1263-the lords of the council deemed it wise and best that [[his]294-the king Majesty]3254-his majesty should begin to dine in public after a day or two -- [his]294-the king wholesome complexion and vigorous step , assisted by a carefully guarded repose of manner and ease and grace of demeanour , would more surely quiet the general pulse -- in case any evil rumours _ had _ gone about -- than any other scheme that could be devised . Then [the Earl]1266-the earl proceeded , very delicately , to instruct [Tom]146-tom as to the observances proper to the stately occasion , under the rather thin disguise of ‘ reminding ’ [him]146-tom concerning things already known to [him]146-tom ; but to [his]146-tom vast gratification it turned out that [Tom]146-tom needed very little help in this line -- [he]146-tom had been making use of [Humphrey]147-humphrey in that direction , for [Humphrey]147-humphrey had mentioned that within a few days [he]147-humphrey was to begin to dine in public ; having gathered it from the swift - winged gossip of [the Court]3339-the court . [Tom]146-tom kept these facts to [himself]146-tom , however . Seeing the royal memory so improved , [the Earl]1266-the earl ventured to apply a few tests to it , in an apparently casual way , to find out how far its amendment had progressed . The results were happy , here and there , in spots -- spots where [Humphrey]147-humphrey ’s tracks remained -- and on the whole [[my]0-my lord]3168-my lord was greatly pleased and encouraged . So encouraged was [he]3168-my lord , indeed , that [he]3168-my lord spoke up and said in a quite hopeful voice-- “ Now am [I]3168-my lord persuaded that if [[your]0-my Majesty]3215-your majesty will but tax [your]0-my memory yet a little further , it will resolve the puzzle of [the Great Seal]149-the great seal -- a loss which was of moment yesterday , although of none to - day , since its term of service ended with [[our]3731-our late lord]3732-our late lord ’s life . May it please [your]0-my Grace to make the trial ? ”[3168-my lord] [Tom]146-tom was at sea -- a Great Seal was something which [he]146-tom was totally unacquainted with . After a moment ’s hesitation [he]146-tom looked up innocently and asked-- “ What was it like , [[my]146-tom lord]3168-my lord ? ”[146-tom] [The Earl]1266-the earl started , almost imperceptibly , muttering to [himself]1266-the earl , “ [Alack]106-alack , [his]1266-the earl wits are flown again!--it was ill wisdom to lead [him]1266-the earl on to strain them”--then[1266-the earl] [he]1266-the earl deftly turned the talk to other matters , with the purpose of sweeping the unlucky seal out of [Tom]146-tom ’s thoughts -- a purpose which easily succeeded . CHAPTER XV . [Tom]146-tom as [King]3155-king . The next day [the foreign ambassadors]1205-the foreign ambassadors came , with [their]1205-the foreign ambassadors gorgeous trains ; and [Tom]146-tom , throned in awful state , received [them]1205-the foreign ambassadors . The splendours of the scene delighted [his]146-tom eye and fired [his]146-tom imagination at first , but [the audience]1273-the audience was long and dreary , and so were most of [the addresses]1274-the addresses -- wherefore , what began as a pleasure grew into weariness and [home]296-home - sickness by - and - by . [Tom]146-tom said the words which [Hertford]107-hertford put into [his]146-tom mouth from time to time , and tried hard to acquit [himself]146-tom satisfactorily , but [he]146-tom was too new to such things , and too ill at ease to accomplish more than a tolerable success . [He]146-tom looked sufficiently like [a king]390-a king , but [he]146-tom was ill able to feel like [one]3093-one . [He]146-tom was cordially glad when the ceremony was ended . The larger part of [his]146-tom day was ‘ wasted’--as [he]146-tom termed it , in [his]146-tom own mind -- in labours pertaining to [[his]146-tom royal office]1278-his royal office . Even the two hours devoted to certain princely pastimes and recreations were rather a burden to [him]146-tom than otherwise , they were so fettered by restrictions and ceremonious observances . However , [he]146-tom had a private hour with [[his]146-tom whipping - boy]1279-his whipping - boy which [he]146-tom counted clear gain , since [he]146-tom got both entertainment and needful information out of it . The third day of [Tom Canty]90-tom ’s kingship came and went much as [the others]3425-the others had done , but there was a lifting of [his]146-tom cloud in one way -- [he]146-tom felt less uncomfortable than at first ; [he]146-tom was getting a little used to [his]146-tom circumstances and surroundings ; [his]146-tom chains still galled , but not all the time ; [he]146-tom found that the presence and homage of [the great afflicted]1281-the great afflicted and embarrassed [him]146-tom less and less sharply with every hour that drifted over [his]146-tom head . But for one single dread , [he]146-tom could have seen the fourth day approach without serious distress -- the dining in public ; it was to begin that day . There were greater matters in the programme -- for on that day [he]146-tom would have to preside at a council which would take [his]146-tom views and commands concerning the policy to be pursued toward [various foreign nations]1282-various foreign nations scattered far and near over [the great globe]1283-the great globe ; on that day , too , [Hertford]107-hertford would be formally chosen to the grand office of [Lord Protector]1284-lord protector ; other things of note were appointed for that fourth day , also ; but to [Tom]90-tom they were all insignificant compared with the ordeal of dining all by [himself]146-tom with a multitude of curious eyes fastened upon [him]146-tom and a multitude of mouths whispering comments upon [his]146-tom performance,--and upon [his]146-tom mistakes , if [he]146-tom should be so unlucky as to make any . Still , nothing could stop that fourth day , and so it came . [It]1285-it found poor [Tom]90-tom low - spirited and absent - minded , and this mood continued ; [he]146-tom could not shake it off . The ordinary duties of the morning dragged upon [his]146-tom hands , and wearied [him]146-tom . Once more [he]146-tom felt the sense of captivity heavy upon [him]146-tom . Late in the forenoon [he]146-tom was in [a large audience - chamber]1286-a large audience - chamber , conversing with [the Earl of [Hertford]107-hertford]3253-the earl of hertford and dully awaiting the striking of the hour appointed for a visit of ceremony from [a considerable number of [great officials]1289-great officials and [courtiers]1134-courtiers]1288-a considerable number of great officials and courtiers . After a little while , [Tom]90-tom , who had wandered to a window and become interested in the life and movement of [the great highway beyond [the palace]425-the palace gates]1291-the great highway beyond the palace gates -- and not idly interested , but longing with all [his]90-tom heart to take part in person in [its]1293-its stir and freedom -- saw the van of [a hooting and shouting mob of disorderly men]1294-a hooting and shouting mob of disorderly men , [women]1295-women , and [children of the lowest and poorest degree]1296-children of the lowest and poorest degree approaching from up [the road]454-the road . “ [I]90-tom would [I]90-tom knew what ’ tis about ! ”[90-tom] [he]90-tom exclaimed , with all [a boy]239-a boy ’s curiosity in such happenings . “ [Thou]3734-thou art [the King]294-the king ! ”[1266-the earl] solemnly responded [the Earl]1266-the earl , with a reverence . “ Have [I]1266-the earl [[your]90-tom Grace]3566-your grace ’s leave to act ? ”[1266-the earl] “ O blithely , yes ! O gladly , yes ! ”[90-tom] exclaimed [Tom]90-tom excitedly , adding to [himself]90-tom with a lively sense of satisfaction , “ In truth , being [a king]390-a king is not all dreariness -- it hath its compensations and conveniences . ”[90-tom] [The Earl]108-the earl of hertford called [a page]610-a page , and sent [him]610-a page to [the captain of the guard]1301-the captain of the guard with the order-- “ Let [the mob]458-the mob be halted , and inquiry made concerning the occasion of its movement . By [the King]294-the king ’s command ! ”[1302-a long rank of the royal guards , cased in flashing steel] A few seconds later [a long rank of the royal guards , cased in flashing steel]1302-a long rank of the royal guards , cased in flashing steel , filed out at the gates and formed across [the highway]1303-the highway in front of [the multitude]960-the multitude . [A messenger]1305-a messenger returned , to report that [the crowd]416-the crowd were following [a man]3486-a man , [a woman]1101-a woman , and [a young girl]1309-a young girl to execution for crimes committed against the peace and dignity of [the realm]3233-the realm . Death -- and a violent death -- for [these poor unfortunates]1311-these poor unfortunates ! The thought wrung [Tom]90-tom ’s heart - strings . The spirit of compassion took control of [him]90-tom , to the exclusion of all other considerations ; [he]90-tom never thought of the offended laws , or of the grief or loss which [these three criminals]1312-these three criminals had inflicted upon [[their]1312-these three criminals victims]1313-their victims ; [he]90-tom could think of nothing but the scaffold and the grisly fate hanging over the heads of [the condemned]1314-the condemned . [His]90-tom concern made [him]90-tom even forget , for the moment , that [he]90-tom was but the false shadow of [a king]390-a king , not the substance ; and before [he]90-tom knew it [he]90-tom had blurted out the command-- “ Bring [them]1314-the condemned here ! ”[90-tom] Then [he]90-tom blushed scarlet , and a sort of apology sprung to [his]90-tom lips ; but observing that [his]90-tom order had wrought no sort of surprise in [the Earl]1266-the earl or [the waiting page]1317-the waiting page , [he]90-tom suppressed the words [he]90-tom was about to utter . [The page]1318-the page , in the most matter - of - course way , made a profound obeisance and retired backwards out of [the room]507-the room to deliver the command . [Tom]90-tom experienced a glow of pride and a renewed sense of the compensating advantages of [the kingly office]1320-the kingly office . [He]90-tom said to [himself]90-tom , “ Truly it is like what [I]90-tom was used to feel when [I]90-tom read [the old priest]3740-the old priest ’s tales , and did imagine [mine]90-tom own self [a prince]392-a prince , giving law and command to [all]654-all , saying ‘ Do this , do that , ’ whilst [none durst]3743-none durst offer let or hindrance to [my]90-tom will . ”[90-tom] Now the doors swung open ; one high - sounding title after another was announced , [the personages owning [them]1322-them]1321-the personages owning them followed , and [the place]3615-the place was quickly half - filled with [noble folk]1324-noble folk and finery . But [Tom]90-tom was hardly conscious of the presence of [these people]1325-these people , so wrought up was [he]90-tom and so intensely absorbed in that other and more interesting matter . [He]90-tom seated [himself]90-tom absently in [his]90-tom chair of state , and turned [his]90-tom eyes upon the door with manifestations of impatient expectancy ; seeing which , the company forbore to trouble [him]90-tom , and fell to chatting a mixture of public business and court gossip one with another . In a little while the measured tread of [military men]1326-military men was heard approaching , and [the culprits]1327-the culprits entered [the presence in charge of [an under - sheriff]1329-an under - sheriff and escorted by [a detail of [the king]294-the king ’s guard]1330-a detail of the king ’s guard]1328-the presence in charge of an under - sheriff and escorted by a detail of the king ’s guard . [The civil officer]1332-the civil officer knelt before [Tom]90-tom , then stood aside ; [the three doomed persons]1333-the three doomed persons knelt , also , and remained so ; [the guard]1334-the guard took position behind [Tom]90-tom ’s chair . [Tom]90-tom scanned [the prisoners]1335-the prisoners curiously . Something about the dress or appearance of [the man]495-the man had stirred a vague memory in [him]90-tom . “ Methinks [I]90-tom have seen [this man]546-this man ere now . . . but the when or the where fail [me]90-tom . ”--Such[90-tom] was [Tom]90-tom ’s thought . Just then [the man]495-the man glanced quickly up and quickly dropped [his]495-the man face again , not being able to endure the awful port of sovereignty ; but the one full glimpse of the face which [Tom]90-tom got was sufficient . [He]90-tom said to [himself]90-tom : “ Now is the matter clear ; this is [the stranger that plucked [Giles Witt]150-giles witt out of [the Thames]7-the thames]3745-the stranger that plucked giles witt out of the thames , and saved [his]150-giles witt life , that windy , bitter , first day of the New Year -- a brave good deed -- pity [he]150-giles witt hath been doing baser ones and got [himself]150-giles witt in this sad case . . . [I]90-tom have not forgot the day , neither the hour ; by reason that an hour after , upon the stroke of eleven , [I]90-tom did get a hiding by the hand of [Gammer Canty which was of so goodly and admired severity that all that went before or followed after it]3746-gammer canty which was of so goodly and admired severity that all that went before or followed after it were but fondlings and caresses by comparison . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom now ordered that [the woman]802-the woman and [the girl]3544-the girl be removed from the presence for a little time ; then addressed [himself]90-tom to [the under - sheriff]1340-the under - sheriff , saying-- “ [Good sir]3747-good sir , what is [this man]546-this man ’s offence ? ”[90-tom] [The officer]1341-the officer knelt , and answered-- “ So please [[your]1341-the officer Majesty]3215-your majesty , [he]546-this man hath taken the life of [a subject]3564-a subject by poison . ”[1341-the officer] [Tom]90-tom ’s compassion for [the prisoner]1342-the prisoner , and admiration of [him]1342-the prisoner as [the daring rescuer of [a drowning boy]1344-a drowning boy]1343-the daring rescuer of a drowning boy , experienced a most damaging shock . “ The thing was proven upon [him]546-this man ? ”[90-tom] [he]90-tom asked . “ Most clearly , [sire]3212-sire . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom sighed , and said-- “ Take [him]546-this man away -- [he]546-this man hath earned [his]546-this man death . ‘ Tis a pity , for [he]546-this man was [a brave heart]3752-a brave heart -- na -- na , [I]90-tom mean [he]546-this man hath the _ look _ of it ! ”[90-tom] [The prisoner]1342-the prisoner clasped [his]1342-the prisoner hands together with sudden energy , and wrung them despairingly , at the same time appealing imploringly to [the ‘ King]1346-the ‘ king ’ in broken and terrified phrases-- “ O [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord [the King]294-the king , an ’ [thou]3755-thou canst pity the lost , have pity upon [me]90-tom ! [I]90-tom am innocent -- neither hath that wherewith [I]90-tom am charged been more than but lamely proved -- yet [I]90-tom speak not of that ; the judgment is gone forth against [me]90-tom and may not suffer alteration ; yet in [mine]90-tom extremity [I]90-tom beg a boon , for [my]90-tom doom is more than [I]90-tom can bear . A grace , a grace , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord [the King]294-the king ! in [thy]294-the king royal compassion grant [my]90-tom prayer -- give commandment that [I]90-tom be hanged ! ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom was amazed . This was not the outcome [he]90-tom had looked for . “ Odds [my]90-tom life , a strange _ boon _ ! Was it not the fate intended [thee]90-tom ? ”[90-tom] “ O good [[my]90-tom liege]3243-my liege , not so ! It is ordered that [I]90-tom be _ boiled alive _ ! ”[90-tom] The hideous surprise of these words almost made [Tom]90-tom spring from [his]90-tom chair . As soon as [he]90-tom could recover [his]90-tom wits [he]90-tom cried out-- “ Have [thy]294-the king wish , [poor soul]3692-poor soul ! an ’ [thou]294-the king had poisoned [a hundred men]3760-a hundred men [thou]294-the king shouldst not suffer so miserable a death . ”[1342-the prisoner] [The prisoner]1342-the prisoner bowed [his]1342-the prisoner face to the ground and burst into passionate expressions of gratitude -- ending with-- “ If ever [thou]294-the king shouldst know misfortune -- which [God]87-god forefend!--may [thy]294-the king goodness to [me]90-tom this day be remembered and requited ! ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom turned to [the Earl of [Hertford]107-hertford]3253-the earl of hertford , and said-- “ [[My]90-tom lord]3168-my lord , is it believable that there was warrant for [this man]546-this man ’s ferocious doom ? ”[90-tom] “ It is the law , [[your]3253-the earl of hertford Grace]3566-your grace -- for [poisoners]3764-poisoners . In [Germany]53-germany coiners be boiled to death in _ oil_--not cast in of a sudden , but by a rope let down into the oil by degrees , and slowly ; first the feet , then the legs , then-- ”[90-tom] “ O prithee no more , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord , [I]90-tom can not bear it ! ”[90-tom] cried [Tom]90-tom , covering [his]90-tom eyes with [his]90-tom hands to shut out the picture . “ [I]90-tom beseech [[your]1266-the earl good lordship]3766-your good lordship that order be taken to change this law -- oh , let [no more poor creatures]3767-no more poor creatures be visited with its tortures . ”[90-tom] [The Earl]1266-the earl ’s face showed profound gratification , for [he]1266-the earl was [a man of merciful and generous impulses]1350-a man of merciful and generous impulses -- a thing not very common with [his]1266-the earl class in that fierce age . [He]1266-the earl said-- “ These [your]1266-the earl Grace ’s noble words have sealed its doom . History will remember it to the honour of [[your]1266-the earl royal house]3768-your royal house . ”[1266-the earl] [The under - sheriff]1340-the under - sheriff was about to remove [[his]1340-the under - sheriff prisoner]1352-his prisoner ; [Tom]90-tom gave [him]1340-the under - sheriff a sign to wait ; then [he]90-tom said-- “ Good sir , [I]90-tom would look into this matter further . [The man]495-the man has said [his]495-the man deed was but lamely proved . Tell [me]90-tom what [thou]3770-thou knowest . ”[90-tom] “ If [the King]294-the king ’s grace please , it did appear upon the trial that [this man]546-this man entered into [a house in [the hamlet of [Islington]54-islington]3774-the hamlet of islington where [one lay sick]3775-one lay sick]3773-a house in the hamlet of islington where one lay sick -- [three witnesses]3776-three witnesses say it was at ten of the clock in the morning , and two say it was some minutes later -- [the sick man]3777-the sick man being alone at the time , and sleeping -- and presently [the man]495-the man came forth again and went [his]495-the man way . [The sick man]3777-the sick man died within the hour , being torn with spasms and retchings . ”[1266-the earl] “ Did any see the poison given ? Was poison found ? ”[90-tom] “ Marry , no , [[my]90-tom liege]3243-my liege . ”[90-tom] “ Then how doth [one]3093-one know there was poison given at all ? ”[90-tom] “ Please [[your]294-the king Majesty]3215-your majesty , [the doctors]3783-the doctors testified that [none]3179-none die with such symptoms but by poison . ”[90-tom] Weighty evidence , this , in that simple age . [Tom]90-tom recognised its formidable nature , and said-- “ [The doctor]1234-the doctor knoweth [his]495-the man trade -- belike [they]3783-the doctors were right . The matter hath an ill - look for [this poor man]3786-this poor man . ”[90-tom] “ Yet was not this all , [[your]294-the king Majesty]3215-your majesty ; there is more and worse . [Many]3788-many testified that [a witch]3789-a witch , since gone from [the village]3790-the village , [none]3179-none know whither , did foretell , and speak it privately in [their]3788-many ears , that [the sick man]3777-the sick man _ would die by poison_--and more , that [a stranger]3623-a stranger would give it -- [a stranger with brown hair and clothed in a worn and common garb]3794-a stranger with brown hair and clothed in a worn and common garb ; and surely [this prisoner]3795-this prisoner doth answer woundily to the bill . Please [[your]294-the king Majesty]3215-your majesty to give the circumstance that solemn weight which is its due , seeing it was _ foretold _ . ”[90-tom] This was an argument of tremendous force in that superstitious day . [Tom]90-tom felt that the thing was settled ; if evidence was worth anything , [this poor fellow]1353-this poor fellow ’s guilt was proved . Still [he]90-tom offered [the prisoner]1342-the prisoner a chance , saying-- “ If [thou]3797-thou canst say aught in [thy]3797-thou behalf , speak . ”[90-tom] “ Nought that will avail , [[my]90-tom King]3798-my king . [I]90-tom am innocent , yet can not [I]90-tom make it appear . [I]90-tom have [no friends]3799-no friends , else might [I]90-tom show that [I]90-tom was not in [Islington]54-islington that day ; so also might [I]90-tom show that at that hour [they]3800-they name [I]90-tom was above a league away , seeing [I]90-tom was at Wapping [Old Stairs]3801-old stairs ; yea more , [[my]90-tom King]3798-my king , for [I]90-tom could show , that whilst [they]3800-they say [I]90-tom was _ taking _ life , [I]90-tom was _ saving _ it . [A drowning boy--]3803-a drowning boy-- ”[90-tom] “ Peace ! [Sheriff]3804-sheriff , name the day the deed was done ! ”[90-tom] “ At ten in the morning , or some minutes later , the first day of the New Year , most illustrious-- ”[90-tom] “ Let [the prisoner]1342-the prisoner go free -- it is [the King]294-the king ’s will ! ”[90-tom] Another blush followed this unregal outburst , and [he]1355-he covered [his]1355-he indecorum as well as [he]1355-he could by adding-- “ It enrageth [me]1355-he that [a man]3486-a man should be hanged upon such idle , hare - brained evidence ! ”[1355-he] A low buzz of admiration swept through the assemblage . It was not admiration of the decree that had been delivered by [Tom]90-tom , for the propriety or expediency of pardoning [a convicted poisoner]1356-a convicted poisoner was a thing which [few there]1357-few there would have felt justified in either admitting or admiring -- no , the admiration was for the intelligence and spirit which [Tom]90-tom had displayed . Some of the low - voiced remarks were to this effect-- “ This is [no mad king]3808-no mad king -- [he]294-the king hath [his]294-the king wits sound . ”[90-tom] “ How sanely [he]294-the king put [his]294-the king questions -- how like [his]294-the king former natural self was this abrupt imperious disposal of the matter ! ”[90-tom] “ [God]87-god be thanked , [his]294-the king infirmity is spent ! This is [no weakling]3809-no weakling , but [a king]390-a king . [He]294-the king hath borne [himself]294-the king like to [[his]294-the king own father]3811-his own father . ”[90-tom] The air being filled with applause , [Tom]90-tom ’s ear necessarily caught a little of it . The effect which this had upon [him]90-tom was to put [him]90-tom greatly at [his]90-tom ease , and also to charge [his]90-tom system with very gratifying sensations . However , [his]90-tom juvenile curiosity soon rose superior to these pleasant thoughts and feelings ; [he]90-tom was eager to know what sort of deadly mischief [the woman]802-the woman and [the little girl]1359-the little girl could have been about ; so , by [his]90-tom command , [the two terrified and sobbing creatures]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures were brought before [him]90-tom . “ What is it that these have done ? ”[90-tom] [he]90-tom inquired of [the sheriff]1361-the sheriff . “ Please [[your]1361-the sheriff Majesty]3215-your majesty , a black crime is charged upon [them]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures , and clearly proven ; wherefore [the judges]749-the judges have decreed , according to the law , that [they]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures be hanged . [They]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures sold [themselves]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures to [the devil]3814-the devil -- such is [their]1360-the two terrified and sobbing creatures crime . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom shuddered . [He]90-tom had been taught to abhor [people who did this wicked thing]1362-people who did this wicked thing . Still , [he]90-tom was not going to deny [himself]90-tom the pleasure of feeding [his]90-tom curiosity for all that ; so [he]90-tom asked-- “ Where was this done?--and when ? ”[90-tom] “ On a midnight in December , in [a ruined church]3815-a ruined church , [[your]1361-the sheriff Majesty]3215-your majesty . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom shuddered again . “ Who was there present ? ”[90-tom] “ Only [these two]3817-these two , [[your]1361-the sheriff grace]3566-your grace -- and _ [that other _]3819-that other _ . ”[90-tom] “ Have these confessed ? ”[90-tom] “ Nay , not so , [sire]3212-sire -- [they]3817-these two do deny it . ”[90-tom] “ Then prithee , how was it known ? ”[90-tom] “ [Certain witness]3821-certain witness did see [them]3817-these two wending thither , good [[your]1361-the sheriff Majesty]3215-your majesty ; this bred the suspicion , and dire effects have since confirmed and justified it . In particular , it is in evidence that through the wicked power so obtained , [they]3817-these two did invoke and bring about a storm that wasted all the region round about . [Above forty witnesses]3823-above forty witnesses have proved the storm ; and sooth one might have had a thousand , for all had reason to remember it , sith all had suffered by it . ”[90-tom] “ [Certes]151-certes this is a serious matter . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom turned this dark piece of scoundrelism over in [his]90-tom mind a while , then asked-- “ Suffered [the woman]802-the woman also by the storm ? ”[90-tom] [Several old heads among the assemblage]1363-several old heads among the assemblage nodded [their]1363-several old heads among the assemblage recognition of the wisdom of this question . [The sheriff]1361-the sheriff , however , saw nothing consequential in the inquiry ; [he]1361-the sheriff answered , with simple directness-- “ Indeed did [she]802-the woman , [[your]1361-the sheriff Majesty]3215-your majesty , and most righteously , as all aver . [Her]802-the woman habitation was swept away , and [herself]802-the woman and [child]3189-child left shelterless . ”[1361-the sheriff] “ Methinks the power to do [herself]802-the woman so ill a turn was dearly bought . [She]802-the woman had been cheated , had [she]802-the woman paid but a farthing for it ; that [she]802-the woman paid [her]802-the woman soul , and [[her]802-the woman child]3827-her child ’s , argueth that [she]802-the woman is mad ; if [she]802-the woman is mad [she]802-the woman knoweth not what [she]802-the woman doth , therefore sinneth not . ”[1365-the elderly heads] [The elderly heads]1365-the elderly heads nodded recognition of [Tom]90-tom ’s wisdom once more , and [one individual]1366-one individual murmured , “ An ’ [the King]294-the king be mad [himself]294-the king , according to report , then is it a madness of a sort that would improve the sanity of some [I]1366-one individual wot of , if by the gentle providence of [God]87-god [they]1365-the elderly heads could but catch it . ”[1366-one individual] “ What age hath [the child]3829-the child ? ”[90-tom] asked [Tom]90-tom . “ Nine years , please [[your]1367-a learned judge Majesty]3215-your majesty . ”[90-tom] “ By the law of [England]2-england may [a child]3831-a child enter into covenant and sell [itself]3831-a child , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord ? ”[90-tom] asked [Tom]90-tom , turning to [a learned judge]1367-a learned judge . “ The law doth not permit [a child]3831-a child to make or meddle in any weighty matter , good [[my]1367-a learned judge liege]3243-my liege , holding that [its]3831-a child callow wit unfitteth it to cope with the riper wit and evil schemings of [them]3835-them that are [its elders]3836-its elders . [The _ Devil]3837-the _ devil _ may buy [a child]3831-a child , if [he]3837-the _ devil so choose , and [the child]3829-the child agree thereto , but not [an Englishman]3840-an englishman -- in this latter case the contract would be null and void . ”[1367-a learned judge] “ It seemeth a rude unchristian thing , and ill contrived , that English law denieth privileges to [Englishmen]3841-englishmen to waste [them]3842-them on [the devil]3814-the devil ! ”[90-tom] cried [Tom]90-tom , with honest heat . This novel view of the matter excited many smiles , and was stored away in many heads to be repeated about [the Court]3339-the court as evidence of [Tom]90-tom ’s originality as well as progress toward mental health . [The elder culprit]1369-the elder culprit had ceased from sobbing , and was hanging upon [Tom]90-tom ’s words with an excited interest and a growing hope . [Tom]90-tom noticed this , and it strongly inclined [his]90-tom sympathies toward [her]1369-the elder culprit in [her]1369-the elder culprit perilous and unfriended situation . Presently [he]90-tom asked-- “ How wrought [they]3844-they to bring the storm ? ”[90-tom] “ _ By pulling off [their]3844-they stockings _ , [sire]3212-sire . ”[90-tom] This astonished [Tom]90-tom , and also fired [his]90-tom curiosity to fever heat . [He]90-tom said , eagerly-- “ It is wonderful ! Hath it always this dread effect ? ”[90-tom] “ Always , [[my]90-tom liege]3243-my liege -- at least if [the woman]802-the woman desire it , and utter the needful words , either in [her]802-the woman mind or with [her]802-the woman tongue . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom turned to [the woman]802-the woman , and said with impetuous zeal-- “ Exert [thy]802-the woman power -- [I]90-tom would see a storm ! ”[90-tom] There was a sudden paling of cheeks in the superstitious assemblage , and a general , though unexpressed , desire to get out of [the place]3615-the place -- all of which was lost upon [Tom]90-tom , who was dead to everything but the proposed cataclysm . Seeing a puzzled and astonished look in [the woman]802-the woman ’s face , [he]90-tom added , excitedly-- “ Never fear -- [thou]802-the woman shalt be blameless . More -- [thou]802-the woman shalt go free -- none shall touch [thee]802-the woman . Exert [thy]802-the woman power . ”[90-tom] “ Oh , [[my]90-tom lord]3168-my lord [the King]294-the king , [I]90-tom have it not -- [I]90-tom have been falsely accused . ”[90-tom] “ [Thy]802-the woman fears stay [thee]802-the woman . Be of good heart , [thou]802-the woman shalt suffer no harm . Make a storm -- it mattereth not how small a one -- [I]802-the woman require nought great or harmful , but indeed prefer the opposite -- do this and [thy]802-the woman life is spared -- [thou]802-the woman shalt go out free , with [[thy]802-the woman child]3850-thy child , bearing [the King]294-the king ’s pardon , and safe from hurt or malice from any in [the realm]3233-the realm . ”[802-the woman] [The woman]802-the woman prostrated [herself]802-the woman , and protested , with tears , that [she]802-the woman had no power to do the miracle , else [she]802-the woman would gladly win [[her]802-the woman child]3827-her child ’s life alone , and be content to lose [her]802-the woman own , if by obedience to [the King]294-the king ’s command so precious a grace might be acquired . [Tom]90-tom urged -- [the woman]802-the woman still adhered to [her]802-the woman declarations . Finally [he]90-tom said-- “ [I]90-tom think [the woman]802-the woman hath said true . An ’ _ [[my]90-tom _ mother]3854-my _ mother were in [her]802-the woman place and gifted with the devil ’s functions , [she]802-the woman had not stayed a moment to call [her]802-the woman storms and lay [the whole land]3855-the whole land in ruins , if the saving of [my]90-tom forfeit life were the price [she]802-the woman got ! It is argument that [other mothers]3856-other mothers are made in like mould . [Thou]3857-thou art free , [goodwife]3858-goodwife -- [thou]3857-thou and [[thy]3857-thou child]3850-thy child -- for [I]90-tom do think [thee]3857-thou innocent . _ Now _ [thou’st]3857-thou nought to fear , being pardoned -- pull off [thy]3857-thou stockings!--an ’ [thou]3857-thou canst make [me]90-tom a storm , [thou]3857-thou shalt be rich ! ”[90-tom] [The redeemed creature]1377-the redeemed creature was loud in [her]1377-the redeemed creature gratitude , and proceeded to obey , whilst [Tom]90-tom looked on with eager expectancy , a little marred by apprehension ; [the courtiers]1378-the courtiers at the same time manifesting decided discomfort and uneasiness . [The woman]802-the woman stripped [her]802-the woman own feet and [[her]802-the woman little girl]1380-her little girl ’s also , and plainly did [her]802-the woman best to reward [the King]294-the king ’s generosity with an earthquake , but it was all a failure and a disappointment . [Tom]90-tom sighed , and said-- “ There , [good soul]3860-good soul , trouble [thyself]3860-good soul no further , [thy]90-tom power is departed out of [thee]3860-good soul . Go [thy]90-tom way in peace ; and if it return to [thee]3860-good soul at any time , forget [me]90-tom not , but fetch [me]90-tom a storm . ”[90-tom] { 13 } CHAPTER XVI . The State Dinner . The dinner hour drew near -- yet strangely enough , the thought brought but slight discomfort to [Tom]90-tom , and hardly any terror . The morning ’s experiences had wonderfully built up [his]90-tom confidence ; the poor little ash - cat was already more wonted to [his]90-tom strange garret , after four days ’ habit , than [a mature person]1382-a mature person could have become in a full month . [A child]3831-a child ’s facility in accommodating itself to circumstances was never more strikingly illustrated . Let [us]1384-us [privileged ones]1385-privileged ones hurry to [the great banqueting - room]1386-the great banqueting - room and have a glance at matters there whilst [Tom]90-tom is being made ready for the imposing occasion . [It]1386-the great banqueting - room is [a spacious apartment]1387-a spacious apartment , with gilded pillars and pilasters , and pictured walls and ceilings . At the door stand [tall guards , as rigid as statues , dressed in rich and picturesque costumes , and bearing halberds]1388-tall guards , as rigid as statues , dressed in rich and picturesque costumes , and bearing halberds . In a high gallery which runs all around [the place]3615-the place is a band of [musicians]732-musicians and a packed company of [citizens of both sexes , in brilliant attire]1391-citizens of both sexes , in brilliant attire . In the centre of [the room]507-the room , upon a raised platform , is [Tom]90-tom ’s table . Now let [the ancient chronicler]1393-the ancient chronicler speak : “ [A gentleman]3861-a gentleman enters [the room]507-the room bearing a rod , and along with [him]3861-a gentleman another bearing a tablecloth , which , after [they]3863-they have both kneeled three times with the utmost veneration , [he]3861-a gentleman spreads upon the table , and after kneeling again [they]3863-they both retire ; then come two others , [one with the rod]3864-one with the rod again , the other with a salt - cellar , a plate , and bread ; when [they]3863-they have kneeled as [the others]3425-the others had done , and placed what was brought upon the table , [they]3863-they too retire with the same ceremonies performed by [the first]3866-the first ; at last come [two nobles]3867-two nobles , richly clothed , one bearing a tasting - knife , who , after prostrating [themselves]3867-two nobles three times in the most graceful manner , approach and rub the table with bread and salt , with as much awe as if [the King]294-the king had been present . ”[1393-the ancient chronicler] { 6 } So end the solemn preliminaries . Now , far down [the echoing corridors]1394-the echoing corridors [we]1395-we hear a bugle - blast , and the indistinct cry , “ Place for [the King]294-the king ! Way for [the King]294-the king ’s most excellent majesty ! ”[1393-the ancient chronicler] These sounds are momently repeated -- they grow nearer and nearer -- and presently , almost in [our]1395-we faces , the martial note peals and the cry rings out , “ Way for [the King]294-the king ! ”[1393-the ancient chronicler] At this instant the shining pageant appears , and files in at the door , with a measured march . Let [the chronicler]1396-the chronicler speak again:-- “ First come [Gentlemen]3872-gentlemen , [Barons]3873-barons , [Earls]3874-earls , [Knights of the Garter]3875-knights of the garter , all richly dressed and bareheaded ; next comes [the Chancellor]3876-the chancellor , between two , one of which carries the royal sceptre , the other the Sword of State in a red scabbard , studded with golden fleurs - de - lis , the point upwards ; next comes [the King]294-the king [himself]294-the king -- whom , upon [his]294-the king appearing , twelve trumpets and many drums salute with a great burst of welcome , whilst all in [the galleries]3878-the galleries rise in [their]3867-two nobles places , crying ‘ God save [the King]294-the king ! ’ After [him]294-the king come [nobles attached to [his]294-the king person]3880-nobles attached to his person , and on [his]294-the king right and left march [his]294-the king guard of honour , [[his]294-the king fifty Gentlemen Pensioners]3881-his fifty gentlemen pensioners , with gilt battle - axes . ”[1396-the chronicler] This was all fine and pleasant . [Tom]90-tom ’s pulse beat high , and a glad light was in [his]90-tom eye . [He]90-tom bore [himself]90-tom right gracefully , and all the more so because [he]90-tom was not thinking of how [he]90-tom was doing it , [his]90-tom mind being charmed and occupied with the blithe sights and sounds about [him]90-tom -- and besides , [nobody]650-nobody can be very ungraceful in nicely - fitting beautiful clothes after [he]90-tom has grown a little used to [them]1398-them -- especially if [he]90-tom is for the moment unconscious of [them]1398-them . [Tom]90-tom remembered [his]90-tom instructions , and acknowledged [his]90-tom greeting with a slight inclination of [his]90-tom plumed head , and a courteous “ [I]90-tom thank [ye]1401-the yeomen of the guard , [[my]90-tom good people]3882-my good people . ”[90-tom] [He]90-tom seated [himself]90-tom at table , without removing [his]90-tom cap ; and did it without the least embarrassment ; for to eat with one ’s cap on was the one solitary royal custom upon which [the kings]1399-the kings and [the Cantys]152-the cantys met upon common ground , [neither party]1400-neither party having any advantage over the other in the matter of old familiarity with it . The pageant broke up and grouped itself picturesquely , and remained bareheaded . Now to the sound of gay music [the Yeomen of the Guard]1401-the yeomen of the guard entered,--“the [tallest and mightiest men in [England]2-england]3883-tallest and mightiest men in england , [they]1401-the yeomen of the guard being carefully selected in this regard”--but[1401-the yeomen of the guard] [we]1402-we will let [the chronicler]1396-the chronicler tell about it:-- “ [The Yeomen of the Guard]1401-the yeomen of the guard entered , bareheaded , clothed in scarlet , with golden roses upon [their]1401-the yeomen of the guard backs ; and these went and came , bringing in each turn a course of dishes , served in plate . These dishes were received by [a gentleman in the same order]3885-a gentleman in the same order [they]1401-the yeomen of the guard were brought , and placed upon the table , while [the taster]3886-the taster gave to [each guard]3887-each guard a mouthful to eat of the particular dish [he]3886-the taster had brought , for fear of any poison . ”[90-tom] [Tom]90-tom made a good dinner , notwithstanding [he]90-tom was conscious that hundreds of eyes followed each morsel to [his]90-tom mouth and watched [him]90-tom eat it with an interest which could not have been more intense if it had been a deadly explosive and was expected to blow [him]90-tom up and scatter [him]90-tom all about [the place]3615-the place . [He]90-tom was careful not to hurry , and equally careful not to do anything whatever for [himself]90-tom , but wait till [the proper official]1173-the proper official knelt down and did it for [him]90-tom . [He]90-tom got through without a mistake -- flawless and precious triumph . When the meal was over at last and [he]90-tom marched away in the midst of [his]90-tom bright pageant , with the happy noises in [his]90-tom ears of blaring bugles , rolling drums , and thundering acclamations , [he]90-tom felt that if [he]90-tom had seen the worst of dining in public it was an ordeal which [he]90-tom would be glad to endure several times a day if by that means [he]90-tom could but buy [himself]90-tom free from some of the more formidable requirements of [[his]90-tom royal office]1278-his royal office . CHAPTER XVII . Foo - foo the First . [Miles Hendon]128-hendon hurried along toward [the [Southwark]27-southwark end of [the bridge]3424-the bridge]1407-the southwark end of the bridge , keeping a sharp look - out for [the persons [he]128-hendon sought]1409-the persons he sought , and hoping and expecting to overtake [them]1409-the persons he sought presently . [He]128-hendon was disappointed in this , however . By asking questions , [he]128-hendon was enabled to track [them]1409-the persons he sought part of the way through [Southwark]27-southwark ; then all traces ceased , and [he]128-hendon was perplexed as to how to proceed . Still , [he]128-hendon continued [his]128-hendon efforts as best [he]128-hendon could during the rest of the day . [Nightfall]153-nightfall found [him]128-hendon leg - weary , half - famished , and [his]128-hendon desire as far from accomplishment as ever ; so [he]128-hendon supped at [the Tabard Inn]1410-the tabard inn and went to bed , resolved to make an early start in the morning , and give [the town]1411-the town an exhaustive search . As [he]128-hendon lay thinking and planning , [he]128-hendon presently began to reason thus : [The boy]520-the boy would escape from [the ruffian]1413-the ruffian , [[his]520-the boy reputed father]1414-his reputed father , if possible ; would [he]128-hendon go back to [London]1-london and seek [[his]128-hendon former haunts]1415-his former haunts ? No , [he]128-hendon would not do that , [he]128-hendon would avoid recapture . What , then , would [he]128-hendon do ? Never having had [a friend]1416-a friend in [the world]1021-the world , or [a protector]1418-a protector , until [he]128-hendon met [Miles Hendon]128-hendon , [he]128-hendon would naturally try to find [that friend]1419-that friend again , provided the effort did not require [him]128-hendon to go toward [London]1-london and danger . [He]128-hendon would strike for [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall , that is what [he]128-hendon would do , for [he]128-hendon knew [Hendon]128-hendon was homeward bound and [there]3216-there [he]128-hendon might expect to find [him]128-hendon . Yes , the case was plain to [Hendon]128-hendon -- [he]128-hendon must lose no more time in [Southwark]27-southwark , but move at once through [Kent]40-kent , toward [[Monk]135-monk ’s Holm]55-monk ’s holm , searching [the wood]1421-the wood and inquiring as [he]128-hendon went . Let [us]1422-us return to [the vanished little King]1423-the vanished little king now . [The ruffian whom the waiter at [the inn on [the bridge]3424-the bridge]1425-the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ [the youth]3622-the youth and [the King]294-the king]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king did not exactly join [them]1429-them , but fell in close behind [them]1429-them and followed [their]1429-them steps . [He]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king said nothing . [His]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king left arm was in a sling , and [he]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king wore a large green patch over [his]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king left eye ; [he]1424-the ruffian whom the waiter at the inn on the bridge saw ‘ about to join ’ the youth and the king limped slightly , and used an oaken staff as a support . [The youth]3622-the youth led [the King]294-the king a crooked course through [Southwark]27-southwark , and by - and - by struck into [the high road beyond]1432-the high road beyond . [The King]294-the king was irritated , now , and said [he]294-the king would stop here -- it was [[Hendon]128-hendon ’s place]1434-hendon ’s place to come to [him]294-the king , not [his]294-the king to go to [Hendon]128-hendon . [He]294-the king would not endure such insolence ; [he]294-the king would stop where [he]294-the king was . [The youth]3622-the youth said-- “ Thou’lt tarry here , and [[thy]294-the king friend]3888-thy friend lying wounded in [the wood yonder]3889-the wood yonder ? So be it , then . ”[3622-the youth] [The King]294-the king ’s manner changed at once . [He]294-the king cried out-- “ Wounded ? And who hath dared to do it ? But that is apart ; lead on , lead on ! Faster , [sirrah]3890-sirrah ! Art shod with lead ? Wounded , is [he]3888-thy friend ? Now though [the doer of it]3891-the doer of it be [[a duke]3892-a duke ’s son]3893-a duke ’s son [he]3893-a duke ’s son shall rue it ! ”[294-the king] It was some distance to the wood , but the space was speedily traversed . [The youth]3622-the youth looked about [him]3622-the youth , discovered a bough sticking in the ground , with a small bit of rag tied to it , then led the way into [the forest]1438-the forest , watching for similar boughs and finding them at intervals ; they were evidently guides to the point [he]3622-the youth was aiming at . By - and - by an open place was reached , where were the charred remains of [a farm - house]1439-a farm - house , and near them [a barn which was falling to ruin and decay]1440-a barn which was falling to ruin and decay . There was no sign of life anywhere , and utter silence prevailed . [The youth]3622-the youth entered [the barn]1442-the barn , [the King]294-the king following eagerly upon [his]3622-the youth heels . [No one]554-no one there ! [The King]294-the king shot a surprised and suspicious glance at [the youth]3622-the youth , and asked-- “ Where is [he]3622-the youth ? ”[294-the king] A mocking laugh was [his]294-the king answer . [The King]294-the king was in a rage in a moment ; [he]294-the king seized a billet of wood and was in the act of charging upon [the youth]3622-the youth when another mocking laugh fell upon [his]294-the king ear . It was from [the lame ruffian who had been following at a distance]1449-the lame ruffian who had been following at a distance . [The King]294-the king turned and said angrily-- “ Who art [thou]3622-the youth ? What is [thy]3622-the youth business here ? ”[294-the king] “ Leave [thy]3622-the youth foolery , ”[495-the man] said [the man]495-the man , “ and quiet [thyself]3622-the youth . [My]495-the man disguise is none so good that [thou]3622-the youth canst pretend [thou]3622-the youth knowest not [[thy]3622-the youth father]3066-thy father through it . ”[495-the man] “ [Thou]3622-the youth art not [[my]93-john canty father]3049-my father . [I]93-john canty know [thee]3622-the youth not . [I]93-john canty am [the King]294-the king . If [thou]3622-the youth hast hid [[my]93-john canty servant]3897-my servant , find [him]3897-my servant for [me]93-john canty , or [thou]3622-the youth shalt sup sorrow for what [thou]3622-the youth hast done . ”[93-john canty] [John Canty]93-john canty replied , in a stern and measured voice-- “ It is plain [thou]3622-the youth art mad , and [I]294-the king am loath to punish [thee]3622-the youth ; but if [thou]3622-the youth provoke [me]294-the king , [I]294-the king must . [Thy]3622-the youth prating doth no harm here , where there are no ears that need to mind [thy]3622-the youth follies ; yet it is well to practise [thy]3622-the youth tongue to wary speech , that it may do no hurt when [our]3898-our quarters change . [I]294-the king have done a murder , and may not tarry at [home]296-home -- neither shalt [thou]3622-the youth , seeing [I]294-the king need [thy]3622-the youth service . [My]294-the king name is changed , for wise reasons ; it is [Hobbs]154-hobbs -- [John Hobbs]154-hobbs ; thine is [Jack]155-jack -- charge [thy]3622-the youth memory accordingly . Now , then , speak . Where is [[thy]3622-the youth mother]3070-thy mother ? Where are [[thy]3622-the youth sisters]3076-thy sisters ? [They]3076-thy sisters came not to [the place]3615-the place appointed -- knowest [thou]3622-the youth whither [they]3076-thy sisters went ? ”[294-the king] [The King]294-the king answered sullenly-- “ Trouble [me]1453-the youth near by not with these riddles . [[My]1453-the youth near by mother]3205-my mother is dead ; [[my]1453-the youth near by sisters]3206-my sisters are in [the palace]425-the palace . ”[1453-the youth near by] [The youth near by]1453-the youth near by burst into a derisive laugh , and [the King]294-the king would have assaulted [him]1453-the youth near by , but [Canty]93-john canty -- or [Hobbs]154-hobbs , as [he]1453-the youth near by now called [himself]1453-the youth near by -- prevented [him]1453-the youth near by , and said-- “ Peace , [Hugo]156-hugo , vex [him]1453-the youth near by not ; [his]1453-the youth near by mind is astray , and [thy]156-hugo ways fret [him]1453-the youth near by . Sit [thee]156-hugo down , [Jack]155-jack , and quiet [thyself]156-hugo ; [thou]156-hugo shalt have a morsel to eat , [anon]3906-anon . ”[154-hobbs] [Hobbs]154-hobbs and [Hugo]156-hugo fell to talking together , in low voices , and [the King]294-the king removed [himself]294-the king as far as [he]294-the king could from [their]1456-their disagreeable company . [He]294-the king withdrew into the twilight of [the farther end of [the barn]1442-the barn]1457-the farther end of the barn , where [he]294-the king found the earthen floor bedded a foot deep with straw . [He]294-the king lay down here , drew straw over [himself]294-the king in lieu of blankets , and was soon absorbed in thinking . [He]294-the king had many griefs , but [the minor ones]1459-the minor ones were swept almost into forgetfulness by the supreme one , the loss of [[his]294-the king father]306-his father . To [the rest of [the world]1021-the world]1461-the rest of the world the name of [Henry VIII]105-henry viii . brought a shiver , and suggested [an ogre whose nostrils breathed destruction and whose hand dealt scourgings and death]1463-an ogre whose nostrils breathed destruction and whose hand dealt scourgings and death ; but to [this boy]829-this boy the name brought only sensations of pleasure ; [the figure it invoked]1465-the figure it invoked wore a countenance that was all gentleness and affection . [He]294-the king called to mind a long succession of loving passages between [[his]294-the king father]306-his father and [himself]294-the king , and dwelt fondly upon [them]1467-them , [his]294-the king unstinted tears attesting how deep and real was the grief that possessed [his]294-the king heart . As the afternoon wasted away , [the lad]496-the lad , wearied with [his]294-the king troubles , sank gradually into a tranquil and healing slumber . After a considerable time -- [he]294-the king could not tell how long -- [his]294-the king senses struggled to a half - consciousness , and as [he]294-the king lay with closed eyes vaguely wondering where [he]294-the king was and what had been happening , [he]294-the king noted a murmurous sound , the sullen beating of rain upon the roof . A snug sense of comfort stole over [him]294-the king , which was rudely broken , the next moment , by a chorus of piping cackles and coarse laughter . It startled [him]294-the king disagreeably , and [he]294-the king unmuffled [his]294-the king head to see whence this interruption proceeded . A grim and unsightly picture met [his]294-the king eye . A bright fire was burning in the middle of the floor , at the other end of [the barn]1442-the barn ; and around [it]1470-it , and lit weirdly up by the red glare , lolled and sprawled [the motliest company of tattered gutter - scum and [ruffians , of both sexes]1472-ruffians , of both sexes , [he]294-the king had ever read or dreamed of]1471-the motliest company of tattered gutter - scum and ruffians , of both sexes , he had ever read or dreamed of . There were [huge stalwart men , brown with exposure]1473-huge stalwart men , brown with exposure , long - haired , and clothed in fantastic rags ; there were [middle - sized youths , of truculent countenance , and similarly clad]1474-middle - sized youths , of truculent countenance , and similarly clad ; there were [blind mendicants , with patched or bandaged eyes]1475-blind mendicants , with patched or bandaged eyes ; [crippled ones , with wooden legs and crutches]1476-crippled ones , with wooden legs and crutches ; [diseased ones , with running sores peeping from ineffectual wrappings]1477-diseased ones , with running sores peeping from ineffectual wrappings ; there was [a villain - looking pedlar with [his]1478-a villain - looking pedlar with his pack pack]1478-a villain - looking pedlar with his pack ; [a knife - grinder]1479-a knife - grinder , [a tinker]1480-a tinker , and [a barber - surgeon]1481-a barber - surgeon , with the implements of [their]1482-their trades ; [some of [the females]1484-the females]1483-some of the females were [hardly - grown girls]1485-hardly - grown girls , [some were at prime]1486-some were at prime , [some were old and wrinkled hags]1487-some were old and wrinkled hags , and all were loud , brazen , foul - mouthed ; and [all soiled and slatternly]1488-all soiled and slatternly ; there were [three sore - faced babies]1489-three sore - faced babies ; there were [a couple of starveling curs , with strings about [their]1490-a couple of starveling curs , with strings about their necks , whose office was to lead the blind necks , whose office was to lead the blind]1490-a couple of starveling curs , with strings about their necks , whose office was to lead the blind . The night was come , [the gang]1491-the gang had just finished feasting , an orgy was beginning ; the can of liquor was passing from mouth to mouth . [A general]1492-a general cry broke forth-- “ A song ! a song from [the Bat and Dick]157-the bat and dick and [Dot - and - go - One]3907-dot - and - go - one ! ”[1492-a general] [One of [the blind men]1494-the blind men]1493-one of the blind men got up , and made ready by casting aside the patches that sheltered [his]1493-one of the blind men excellent eyes , and the pathetic placard which recited the cause of [his]1493-one of the blind men calamity . [Dot - and - go - One]3907-dot - and - go - one disencumbered [himself]1493-one of the blind men of [his]1493-one of the blind men timber leg and took [his]1493-one of the blind men place , upon sound and healthy limbs , beside [[his]1493-one of the blind men fellow - rascal]1496-his fellow - rascal ; then [they]1497-they roared out a rollicking ditty , and were reinforced by [the whole crew , at the end of each stanza , in a rousing chorus]1498-the whole crew , at the end of each stanza , in a rousing chorus . By the time the last stanza was reached , the half - drunken enthusiasm had risen to such a pitch , that [everybody]247-everybody joined in and sang it clear through from the beginning , producing a volume of villainous sound that made the rafters quake . These were the inspiring words:-- ‘ [Bien Darkman]1500-bien darkman ’s then , [Bouse Mort]158-bouse mort and [Ken]159-ken , [The bien Coves bings awast]1501-the bien coves bings awast , On [Chates]57-chates to trine by [Rome]58-rome Coves dine For [his]1493-one of the blind men long lib at last . Bing’d out bien Morts and toure , and toure , [Bing]160-bing out of the [Rome]58-rome vile bine , And toure the Cove that cloy’d [your]1502-your duds , Upon the Chates to trine . ’ ( From’The English Rogue . ’ [London]1-london , 1665 . ) Conversation followed ; not in [the thieves]1503-the thieves ’ dialect of the song , for that was only used in talk when unfriendly ears might be listening . In the course of it , it appeared that ‘ [John Hobbs]154-hobbs ’ was not altogether [a new recruit]1504-a new recruit , but had trained in [the gang]1491-the gang at some former time . [His]154-hobbs later history was called for , and when [he]154-hobbs said [he]154-hobbs had ‘ accidentally ’ killed [a man]3486-a man , considerable satisfaction was expressed ; when [he]154-hobbs added that [the man]495-the man was [a priest]1508-a priest , [he]154-hobbs was roundly applauded , and had to take a drink with [everybody]247-everybody . [Old acquaintances]1510-old acquaintances welcomed [him]154-hobbs joyously , and [new ones]1511-new ones were proud to shake [him]154-hobbs by the hand . [He]154-hobbs was asked why [he]154-hobbs had ’ tarried away so many months . ’ [He]154-hobbs answered-- “ [London]1-london is better than [the country]1030-the country , and safer , these late years , the laws be so bitter and so diligently enforced . An ’ [I]154-hobbs had not had that accident , [I]154-hobbs had stayed [there]3216-there . [I]154-hobbs had resolved to stay , and never more venture country - wards -- but the accident has ended that . ”[154-hobbs] [He]154-hobbs inquired how many persons [the gang]1491-the gang numbered now . [The ‘ ruffler , ’ or chief]1513-the ‘ ruffler , ’ or chief , answered-- “ [Five and twenty sturdy budges]3910-five and twenty sturdy budges , bulks , files , [clapperdogeons and maunders]3911-clapperdogeons and maunders , counting the dells and [doxies and other morts]3912-doxies and other morts . { 7 } [Most]3913-most are here , [the rest]3914-the rest are wandering eastward , along [the winter lay]3915-the winter lay . [We]3916-we follow at dawn . ”[1513-the ‘ ruffler , ’ or chief] “ [I]154-hobbs do not see [the Wen]3917-the wen among [the honest folk]3918-the honest folk about [me]154-hobbs . Where may [he]3917-the wen be ? ”[154-hobbs] “ [Poor lad]3380-poor lad , [his]3917-the wen diet is brimstone , now , and over hot for a delicate taste . [He]3917-the wen was killed in a brawl , somewhere about midsummer . ”[154-hobbs] “ [I]1513-the ‘ ruffler , ’ or chief sorrow to hear that ; [the Wen]3917-the wen was [a capable man]3921-a capable man , and brave . ”[1513-the ‘ ruffler , ’ or chief] “ That was [he]3917-the wen , truly . [Black Bess]161-black bess , [[his]3917-the wen dell]3922-his dell , is of [us]3916-we yet , but absent on the eastward tramp ; [a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct , none ever seeing [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct drunk above four days in the seven . ”[154-hobbs] “ [She]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct was ever strict -- [I]154-hobbs remember it well -- [a goodly wench]3924-a goodly wench and worthy all commendation . [[Her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct mother]3925-her mother was more free and less particular ; [a troublesome and ugly - tempered beldame]3926-a troublesome and ugly - tempered beldame , but furnished with a wit above the common . ”[154-hobbs] “ [We]3916-we lost [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct through it . [Her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct gift of palmistry and other sorts of fortune - telling begot for [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct at last a witch ’s name and fame . [The law]3422-the law roasted [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct to death at a slow fire . It did touch [me]1514-the ruffler to a sort of tenderness to see the gallant way [she]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct met [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct lot -- cursing and reviling [all the crowd that gaped and gazed around [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct]3928-all the crowd that gaped and gazed around her , whilst the flames licked upward toward [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct face and catched [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct thin locks and crackled about [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct old gray head -- cursing [them]3928-all the crowd that gaped and gazed around her ! why an ’ [thou]3929-thou should’st live a thousand years thoud’st never hear so masterful a cursing . [Alack]106-alack , [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct art died with [her]3923-a fine lass , of nice ways and orderly conduct . There be base and weakling imitations left , but no true blasphemy . ”[1514-the ruffler] [The Ruffler]1514-the ruffler sighed ; [the listeners]1515-the listeners sighed in sympathy ; a general depression fell upon [the company]565-the company for a moment , for [even hardened outcasts like these]1517-even hardened outcasts like these are not wholly dead to sentiment , but are able to feel a fleeting sense of loss and affliction at wide intervals and under peculiarly favouring circumstances -- as in cases like to this , for instance , when genius and culture depart and leave [no heir]1518-no heir . However , a deep drink all round soon restored the spirits of [the mourners]1519-the mourners . “ Have [any others of [[our]3931-our friends]987-our friends]3930-any others of our friends fared hardly ? ”[154-hobbs] asked [Hobbs]154-hobbs . “ [Some]372-some -- yes . [Particularly new comers]3934-particularly new comers -- such as [small husbandmen]3935-small husbandmen turned shiftless and hungry upon [the world]1021-the world because [[their]3935-small husbandmen farms]3937-their farms were taken from [them]3935-small husbandmen to be changed to [sheep ranges]3938-sheep ranges . [They]3934-particularly new comers begged , and were whipped at [the cart]3939-the cart ’s tail , naked from the girdle up , till the blood ran ; then set in the stocks to be pelted ; [they]3934-particularly new comers begged again , were whipped again , and deprived of an ear ; [they]3934-particularly new comers begged a third time -- [poor devils]3940-poor devils , what else could [they]3934-particularly new comers do?--and were branded on the cheek with a red - hot iron , then sold for [slaves]3145-slaves ; [they]3934-particularly new comers ran away , were hunted down , and hanged . ‘ Tis a brief tale , and quickly told . [Others of [us]3943-us]3942-others of us have fared less hardly . Stand forth , [Yokel]162-yokel , Burns , and [Hodge]163-hodge -- show [your]3942-others of us adornments ! ”[154-hobbs] [These]1520-these stood up and stripped away some of [their]1520-these rags , exposing [their]1520-these backs , criss - crossed with ropy old welts left by the lash ; one turned up [his]1521-his hair and showed the place where a left ear had once been ; another showed a brand upon [his]1521-his shoulder -- the letter V -- and a mutilated ear ; [the third]1522-the third said-- “ [I]1522-the third am [Yokel]162-yokel , once [a farmer and prosperous]3944-a farmer and prosperous , with [loving wife]3945-loving wife and [kids]3946-kids -- now am [I]1522-the third somewhat different in estate and calling ; and [the wife]3947-the wife and [kids]3946-kids are gone ; mayhap [they]3934-particularly new comers are in [heaven]3949-heaven , mayhap in -- in [the other place]3950-the other place -- but [the kindly God]3951-the kindly god be thanked , [they]3934-particularly new comers bide no more in _ [England]2-england _ ! [[My]1522-the third good old blameless mother]3952-my good old blameless mother strove to earn bread by nursing [the sick]3953-the sick ; one of these died , [the doctors]3783-the doctors knew not how , so [[my]1522-the third mother]3205-my mother was burnt for [a witch]3789-a witch , whilst [[my]1522-the third babes]3957-my babes looked on and wailed . English law!--up , all , with [your]3958-ye cups!--now all together and with a cheer!--drink to the merciful English law that delivered _ [her]3952-my good old blameless mother _ from [the English hell]3959-the english hell ! Thank [you]3958-ye , [mates]3960-mates , [one and all]3961-one and all . [I]1522-the third begged , from [house]295-house to [house]295-house -- [I]1522-the third and [the wife]3947-the wife -- bearing with [us]3965-us [the hungry kids]3966-the hungry kids -- but it was crime to be hungry in [England]2-england -- so [they]3783-the doctors stripped [us]3965-us and lashed [us]3965-us through [three towns]3967-three towns . Drink [ye]3958-ye all again to the merciful English law!--for its lash drank deep of [my]1522-the third [Mary]114-mary magdalene ’s blood and its blessed deliverance came quick . [She]114-mary magdalene lies there , in [the potter ’s field]3968-the potter ’s field , safe from all harms . And [the kids]3969-the kids -- well , whilst the law lashed [me]1522-the third from [town]3970-town to [town]3970-town , [they]3969-the kids starved . Drink , [lads]3972-lads -- only a drop -- a drop to [the poor kids]3973-the poor kids , that never did any creature harm . [I]1522-the third begged again -- begged , for a crust , and got the stocks and lost an ear -- see , here bides the stump ; [I]1522-the third begged again , and here is the stump of the other to keep [me]1522-the third minded of it . And still [I]1522-the third begged again , and was sold for a slave -- here on [my]1522-the third cheek under this stain , if [I]1522-the third washed it off , [ye]3958-ye might see the red S the branding - iron left there ! [A _ slave]3974-a _ slave _ ! Do [you]3958-ye understand that word ? An English _ slave_!--that is [he]1042-the little king that stands before [ye]3958-ye . [I]1522-the third have run from [[my]1522-the third master]3639-my master , and when [I]1522-the third am found -- the heavy curse of heaven fall on the law of [the land]3332-the land that hath commanded it!--I shall hang ! ”[1522-the third] { 1 } A ringing voice came through the murky air-- “ [Thou]3977-thou shalt _ not_!--and this day the end of that law is come ! ”[654-all] [All]654-all turned , and saw the fantastic figure of [the little King]1042-the little king approaching hurriedly ; as it emerged into the light and was clearly revealed , a general explosion of inquiries broke out-- “ Who is it ? _ What _ is it ? Who art [thou]3977-thou , [manikin]3978-manikin ? ”[520-the boy] [The boy]520-the boy stood unconfused in the midst of all those surprised and questioning eyes , and answered with princely dignity-- “ [I]520-the boy am [Edward]87-god , [King of [England]2-england]3460-king of england . ”[520-the boy] A wild burst of laughter followed , partly of derision and partly of delight in the excellence of the joke . [The King]294-the king was stung . [He]294-the king said sharply-- “ [[Ye]3978-manikin mannerless vagrants]3980-ye mannerless vagrants , is this [your]3978-manikin recognition of the royal boon [I]294-the king have promised ? ”[294-the king] [He]294-the king said more , with angry voice and excited gesture , but it was lost in a whirlwind of laughter and mocking exclamations . ‘ [John Hobbs]154-hobbs ’ made several attempts to make [himself]154-hobbs heard above the din , and at last succeeded -- saying-- “ [Mates]3960-mates , [he]520-the boy is [[my]294-the king son]3220-my son , [a dreamer]3983-a dreamer , [a fool]3984-a fool , and stark mad -- mind [him]520-the boy not -- [he]520-the boy thinketh [he]520-the boy _ is _ [the King]294-the king . ”[294-the king] “ [I]87-god _ am _ [the King]294-the king , ”[87-god] said [Edward]87-god , turning toward [him]87-god , “ as [thou]3987-thou shalt know to [thy]3987-thou cost , in good time . [Thou]3987-thou hast confessed a murder -- [thou]3987-thou shalt swing for it . ”[87-god] “ _ [Thou’lt]3987-thou _ betray [me?--_thou]87-god _ ? An ’ [I]294-the king get [my]294-the king hands upon [thee--]154-hobbs ”[294-the king] “ Tut - tut ! ”[1527-the burley ruffler] said [the burley Ruffler]1527-the burley ruffler , interposing in time to save [the King]294-the king , and emphasising this service by knocking [Hobbs]154-hobbs down with [his]1527-the burley ruffler fist , “ hast respect for neither [Kings _ nor _ Rufflers]3988-kings _ nor _ rufflers ? An ’ [thou]3987-thou insult [my]1527-the burley ruffler presence so again , [I]1527-the burley ruffler ’ll hang [thee]3987-thou up [myself]1527-the burley ruffler . ”[1527-the burley ruffler] Then [he]1527-the burley ruffler said to [[his]1527-the burley ruffler Majesty]3254-his majesty , “ [Thou]3987-thou must make no threats against [[thy]3987-thou mates]3989-thy mates , [lad]3052-lad ; and [thou]3987-thou must guard [thy]3987-thou tongue from saying evil of [them]3989-thy mates elsewhere . _ Be [king]3155-king _ , if it please [thy]3987-thou mad humour , but be not harmful in it . Sink the title [thou]3987-thou hast uttered--‘tis treason ; [we]3992-we be [bad men]3993-bad men in some few trifling ways , but none among [us]3992-we is so base as to be traitor to [[his]1527-the burley ruffler King]3994-his king ; [we]3992-we be loving and loyal hearts , in that regard . Note if [I]1527-the burley ruffler speak truth . Now -- all together : ‘ Long live [Edward]87-god , [King of [England]2-england]3460-king of england ! ’ ”[1527-the burley ruffler] “ LONG LIVE [EDWARD]87-god , [KING OF [ENGLAND]2-england]3460-king of england ! ”[1527-the burley ruffler] The response came with such a thundergust from [the motley crew]1530-the motley crew that [the crazy building]1531-the crazy building vibrated to the sound . [The little King]87-god ’s face lighted with pleasure for an instant , and [he]87-god slightly inclined [his]87-god head , and said with grave simplicity-- “ [I]87-god thank [you]565-the company , [[my]87-god good people]3882-my good people . ”[87-god] This unexpected result threw [the company]565-the company into convulsions of merriment . When something like quiet was presently come again , [the Ruffler]1514-the ruffler said , firmly , but with an accent of good nature-- “ Drop it , [boy]1095-boy , ’ tis not wise , nor well . Humour [thy]1480-a tinker fancy , if [thou]1480-a tinker must , but choose some other title . ”[1514-the ruffler] [A tinker]1480-a tinker shrieked out a suggestion-- “ Foo - foo the First , [King of [the Mooncalves]59-the mooncalves]3999-king of the mooncalves ! ”[1480-a tinker] The title ’ took , ’ at once , every throat responded , and a roaring shout went up , of-- “ [Long live Foo - foo the First]4000-long live foo - foo the first , [King of [the Mooncalves]59-the mooncalves]3999-king of the mooncalves ! ”[1514-the ruffler] followed by hootings , cat - calls , and peals of laughter . “ Hale [him]1535-the poor little victim forth , and crown [him]1535-the poor little victim ! ”[1514-the ruffler] “ Robe [him]1535-the poor little victim ! ”[1514-the ruffler] “ Sceptre [him]1535-the poor little victim ! ”[1514-the ruffler] “ Throne [him]1535-the poor little victim ! ”[1514-the ruffler] These and twenty other cries broke out at once ! and almost before [the poor little victim]1535-the poor little victim could draw a breath [he]1535-the poor little victim was crowned with a tin basin , robed in a tattered blanket , throned upon a barrel , and sceptred with the tinker ’s soldering - iron . Then all flung [themselves]1536-us upon [their]1536-us knees about [him]1535-the poor little victim and sent up a chorus of ironical wailings , and mocking supplications , whilst [they]1536-us swabbed [their]1536-us eyes with [their]1536-us soiled and ragged sleeves and aprons-- “ Be gracious to [us]1536-us , [O sweet King]4002-o sweet king ! ”[1536-us] “ Trample not upon [thy]4002-o sweet king beseeching worms , [O noble Majesty]4003-o noble majesty ! ”[1536-us] “ Pity [[thy]4002-o sweet king slaves]4004-thy slaves , and comfort [them]4004-thy slaves with a royal kick ! ”[1536-us] “ Cheer [us]1536-us and warm [us]1536-us with [thy]4002-o sweet king gracious rays , O flaming sun of sovereignty ! ”[1536-us] “ Sanctify the ground with the touch of [thy]4002-o sweet king foot , that [we]1536-us may eat the dirt and be ennobled ! ”[1536-us] “ Deign to spit upon [us]1536-us , [O Sire]4005-o sire , that [[our]1536-us children ’s children]4006-our children ’s children may tell of [thy]4002-o sweet king princely condescension , and be proud and happy for ever ! ”[1536-us] But [the humorous tinker]1537-the humorous tinker made the ‘ hit ’ of the evening and carried off the honours .
