Thus several days went by ; and the miseries of this tramping life , and the weariness and sordidness and meanness and vulgarity of it , became gradually and steadily so intolerable to [the captive]773-the captive that [he]294-the king began at last to feel that [his]294-the king release from [the hermit]1722-the hermit ’s knife must prove only a temporary respite from death , at best . But at night , in [his]294-the king dreams , these things were forgotten , and [he]294-the king was on [his]294-the king throne , and [master]1868-master again . This , of course , intensified the sufferings of the awakening -- so the mortifications of each succeeding morning of the few that passed between [his]294-the king return to bondage and the combat with [Hugo]156-hugo , grew bitterer and bitterer , and harder and harder to bear . The morning after that combat , [Hugo]156-hugo got up with a heart filled with vengeful purposes against [the King]294-the king . [He]156-hugo had two plans , in particular . One was to inflict upon [the lad]496-the lad what would be , to [his]496-the lad proud spirit and ‘ imagined ’ royalty , a peculiar humiliation ; and if [he]156-hugo failed to accomplish this , [his]156-hugo other plan was to put a crime of some kind upon [the King]294-the king , and then betray [him]294-the king into the implacable clutches of the law . In pursuance of the first plan , [he]156-hugo purposed to put a ‘ clime ’ upon [the King]294-the king ’s leg ; rightly judging that that would mortify [him]294-the king to the last and perfect degree ; and as soon as the clime should operate , [he]156-hugo meant to get [Canty]93-john canty ’s help , and _ force _ [the King]294-the king to expose [his]294-the king leg in [the highway]1303-the highway and beg for alms . ‘ Clime ’ was the ca nt term for a sore , artificially created . To make a clime , [the operator]1875-the operator made a paste or poultice of unslaked lime , soap , and the rust of old iron , and spread it upon a piece of leather , which was then bound tightly upon the leg . This would presently fret off the skin , and make the flesh raw and angry - looking ; blood was then rubbed upon the limb , which , being fully dried , took on a dark and repulsive colour . Then a bandage of soiled rags was put on in a cleverly careless way which would allow the hideous ulcer to be seen , and move the compassion of [the passer - by]1876-the passer - by . { 8 } [Hugo]156-hugo got the help of [the tinker whom [the King had cowed with the soldering - iron]1878-the king had cowed with the soldering - iron]1877-the tinker whom the king had cowed with the soldering - iron ; [they]1879-they took [the boy]520-the boy out on a tinkering tramp , and as soon as [they]1879-they were out of sight of [the camp]945-the camp [they]1879-they threw [him]520-the boy down and [the tinker]1859-the tinker held [him]520-the boy while [Hugo]156-hugo bound the poultice tight and fast upon [his]520-the boy leg . [The King]294-the king raged and stormed , and promised to hang [the two]437-the two the moment the sceptre was in [his]294-the king hand again ; but [they]1879-they kept a firm grip upon [him]294-the king and enjoyed [his]294-the king impotent struggling and jeered at [his]294-the king threats . This continued until the poultice began to bite ; and in no long time its work would have been perfected , if there had been no interruption . But there was ; for about this time [the ‘ slave ’ who had made the speech denouncing [England]2-england ’s laws]1885-the ‘ slave ’ who had made the speech denouncing england ’s laws , appeared on the scene , and put an end to the enterprise , and stripped off the poultice and bandage . [The King]294-the king wanted to borrow [[his]294-the king deliverer]973-his deliverer ’s cudgel and warm the jackets of [the two rascals]1888-the two rascals on the spot ; but [the man]495-the man said no , it would bring trouble -- leave the matter till night ; [the whole tribe]1890-the whole tribe being together , then , [the outside world]1891-the outside world would not venture to interfere or interrupt . [He]294-the king marched [the party]857-the party back to [camp]1893-camp and reported the affair to [the Ruffler]1514-the ruffler , who listened , pondered , and then decided that [the King]294-the king should not be again detailed to beg , since it was plain [he]294-the king was worthy of something higher and better -- wherefore , on the spot [he]294-the king promoted [him]294-the king from the mendicant rank and appointed [him]294-the king to steal ! [Hugo]156-hugo was overjoyed . [He]156-hugo had already tried to make [the King]294-the king steal , and failed ; but there would be no more trouble of that sort , now , for of course [the King]294-the king would not dream of defying a distinct command delivered directly from head - quarters . So [he]294-the king planned a raid for that very afternoon , purposing to get [the King in the law]1898-the king in the law ’s grip in the course of it ; and to do it , too , with such ingenious strategy , that it should seem to be accidental and unintentional ; for [the King of the Game - Cocks]1899-the king of the game - cocks was popular now , and [the gang]1491-the gang might not deal over - gently with [an unpopular member who played so serious a treachery upon [him]294-the king as the delivering [him]294-the king over to [the common enemy]1902-the common enemy]1901-an unpopular member who played so serious a treachery upon him as the delivering him over to the common enemy , the law . Very well . All in good time [Hugo]156-hugo strolled off to [a neighbouring village]1903-a neighbouring village with [[his]156-hugo prey]1904-his prey ; and [the two]437-the two drifted slowly up and down [one street]1906-one street after another , [the one]1907-the one watching sharply for a sure chance to achieve [his]1907-the one evil purpose , and [the other]1645-the other watching as sharply for a chance to dart away and get free of [his]1907-the one infamous captivity for ever . [Both]1909-both threw away some tolerably fair - looking opportunities ; for both , in [their]437-the two secret hearts , were resolved to make absolutely sure work this time , and neither meant to allow [his]156-hugo fevered desires to seduce [him]156-hugo into any venture that had much uncertainty about it . [Hugo]156-hugo ’s chance came first . For at last [a woman]1101-a woman approached who carried a fat package of some sort in a basket . [Hugo]156-hugo ’s eyes sparkled with sinful pleasure as [he]156-hugo said to [himself]156-hugo , “ Breath o ’ [my]156-hugo life , an ’ [I]156-hugo can but put _ that _ upon [him]1912-the prey , ’ tis good - den and [God]87-god keep [thee]802-the woman , [King of [the Game - Cocks]176-the game - cocks]1852-king of the game - cocks ! ”[156-hugo] [He]156-hugo waited and watched -- outwardly patient , but inwardly consuming with excitement -- till [the woman]802-the woman had passed by , and the time was ripe ; then said , in a low voice-- “ Tarry here till [I]1912-the prey come again , ”[1912-the prey] and darted stealthily after [the prey]1912-the prey . [The King]294-the king ’s heart was filled with joy -- [he]294-the king could make [his]294-the king escape , now , if [Hugo]156-hugo ’s quest only carried [him]294-the king far enough away . But [he]156-hugo was to have no such luck . [Hugo]156-hugo crept behind [the woman]802-the woman , snatched the package , and came running back , wrapping it in an old piece of blanket which [he]156-hugo carried on [his]156-hugo arm . The hue and cry was raised in a moment , by [the woman]802-the woman , who knew [her]802-the woman loss by the lightening of [her]802-the woman burden , although [she]802-the woman had not seen the pilfering done . [Hugo]156-hugo thrust the bundle into [the King]294-the king ’s hands without halting , saying-- “ Now speed [ye]294-the king after [me]156-hugo with the rest , and cry ‘ Stop [thief]4148-thief ! ’ but mind [ye]294-the king lead [them]4148-thief astray ! ”[156-hugo] The next moment [Hugo]156-hugo turned a corner and darted down [a crooked alley --]1917-a crooked alley -- and in another moment or two [he]156-hugo lounged into view again , looking innocent and indifferent , and took up a position behind a post to watch results . [The insulted King]1918-the insulted king threw the bundle on the ground ; and the blanket fell away from it just as [the woman]802-the woman arrived , with [an augmenting crowd at [her]802-the woman heels]1920-an augmenting crowd at her heels ; [she]802-the woman seized [the King]294-the king ’s wrist with one hand , snatched up [her]802-the woman bundle with the other , and began to pour out a tirade of abuse upon [the boy]520-the boy while [he]520-the boy struggled , without success , to free [himself]520-the boy from [her]802-the woman grip . [Hugo]156-hugo had seen enough -- [[his]156-hugo enemy]1923-his enemy was captured and the law would get [him]520-the boy , now -- so [he]156-hugo slipped away , jubilant and chuckling , and wended campwards , framing a judicious version of the matter to give to [[the Ruffler]1514-the ruffler ’s crew]1925-the ruffler ’s crew as [he]156-hugo strode along . [The King]294-the king continued to struggle in [the woman]802-the woman ’s strong grasp , and now and then cried out in vexation-- “ Unhand [me]416-the crowd , [[thou]802-the woman foolish creature]4149-thou foolish creature ; it was not [I]416-the crowd that bereaved [thee]802-the woman of [thy]802-the woman paltry goods . ”[416-the crowd] [The crowd]416-the crowd closed around , threatening [the King]294-the king and calling [him]294-the king names ; [a brawny blacksmith in leather apron]1930-a brawny blacksmith in leather apron , and sleeves rolled to [his]1930-a brawny blacksmith in leather apron elbows , made a reach for [him]294-the king , saying [he]1930-a brawny blacksmith in leather apron would trounce [him]294-the king well , for a lesson ; but just then a long sword flashed in the air and fell with convincing force upon [the man]495-the man ’s arm , flat side down , the fantastic owner of it remarking pleasantly , at the same time-- “ Marry , [good souls]4150-good souls , let [us]4151-us proceed gently , not with ill blood and uncharitable words . This is matter for the law ’s consideration , not private and unofficial handling . Loose [thy]802-the woman hold from [the boy]520-the boy , [goodwife]3858-goodwife . ”[1932-the blacksmith] [The blacksmith]1932-the blacksmith averaged [the stalwart soldier]1933-the stalwart soldier with a glance , then went muttering away , rubbing [his]495-the man arm ; [the woman]802-the woman released [the boy]520-the boy ’s wrist reluctantly ; [the crowd]416-the crowd eyed [the stranger]949-the stranger unlovingly , but prudently closed [their]416-the crowd mouths . [The King]294-the king sprang to [[his]294-the king deliverer]973-his deliverer ’s side , with flushed cheeks and sparkling eyes , exclaiming-- “ [Thou]802-the woman hast lagged sorely , but [thou]802-the woman comest in good season , now , [Sir Miles]128-hendon ; carve [me]294-the king this rabble to rags ! ”[294-the king] CHAPTER XXIII . [The Prince]236-the prince [a prisoner]1941-a prisoner . [Hendon]128-hendon forced back a smile , and bent down and whispered in [the King]294-the king ’s ear-- “ Softly , softly , [[my]128-hendon prince]3184-my prince , wag [thy]3184-my prince tongue warily -- nay , suffer it not to wag at all . Trust in [me]128-hendon -- all shall go well in the end . ”[128-hendon] Then [he]128-hendon added to [himself]128-hendon : “ _ Sir _ [Miles]128-hendon ! Bless [me]128-hendon , [I]128-hendon had totally forgot [I]128-hendon was [a knight]930-a knight ! [Lord]4156-lord , how marvellous a thing it is , the grip [his]128-hendon memory doth take upon [his]128-hendon quaint and crazy fancies ! . . . An empty and foolish title is [mine]128-hendon , and yet it is something to have deserved it ; for [I]128-hendon think it is more honour to be held worthy to be [a spectre - knight in [[his]128-hendon Kingdom of Dreams]4158-his kingdom of dreams and Shadows]4157-a spectre - knight in his kingdom of dreams and shadows , than to be held base enough to be [an earl]3538-an earl in some of [the _ real _ kingdoms of [this world]1024-this world]4160-the _ real _ kingdoms of this world . ”[128-hendon] [The crowd]416-the crowd fell apart to admit [a constable]1944-a constable , who approached and was about to lay [his]1944-a constable hand upon [the King]294-the king ’s shoulder , when [Hendon]128-hendon said-- “ Gently , [good friend]4162-good friend , withhold [your]4162-good friend hand -- [he]294-the king shall go peaceably ; [I]128-hendon am responsible for that . Lead on , [we]1950-we will follow . ”[128-hendon] [The officer]1341-the officer led , with [the woman]802-the woman and [her]802-the woman bundle ; [Miles]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king followed after , with [the crowd]416-the crowd at [their]1950-we heels . [The King]294-the king was inclined to rebel ; but [Hendon]128-hendon said to [him]294-the king in a low voice-- “ Reflect , [Sire]3212-sire -- [your]294-the king laws are the wholesome breath of [[your]294-the king own royalty]4164-your own royalty ; shall [their]4164-your own royalty source resist [them]4164-your own royalty , yet require the branches to respect [them]4164-your own royalty ? Apparently one of these laws has been broken ; when [the King]294-the king is on [his]294-the king throne again , can it ever grieve [him]294-the king to remember that when [he]294-the king was seemingly [a private person]4166-a private person [he]294-the king loyally sank [the king]294-the king in [the citizen]4168-the citizen and submitted to [its]294-the king authority ? ”[128-hendon] “ [Thou]802-the woman art right ; say no more ; [thou]802-the woman shalt see that whatsoever [the King of [England]2-england]4051-the king of england requires [a subject to suffer]4170-a subject to suffer , under the law , [he]294-the king will [himself]294-the king suffer while [he]294-the king holdeth the station of [a subject]3564-a subject . ”[128-hendon] When [the woman]802-the woman was called upon to testify before [the justice of the peace]1953-the justice of the peace , [she]802-the woman swore that [the small prisoner at the bar]1954-the small prisoner at the bar was [the person who had committed the theft]1955-the person who had committed the theft ; there was [none able to show the contrary]1956-none able to show the contrary , so [the King]294-the king stood convicted . The bundle was now unrolled , and when the contents proved to be [a plump little dressed pig]1958-a plump little dressed pig , [the judge]1959-the judge looked troubled , whilst [Hendon]128-hendon turned pale , and [his]128-hendon body was thrilled with an electric shiver of dismay ; but [the King]294-the king remained unmoved , protected by [his]294-the king ignorance . [The judge]1959-the judge meditated , during an ominous pause , then turned to [the woman]802-the woman , with the question-- “ What dost [thou]4172-thou hold this property to be worth ? ”[802-the woman] [The woman]802-the woman courtesied and replied-- “ Three shillings and eightpence , [your]294-the king worship -- [I]1964-the justice could not abate a penny and set forth the value honestly . ”[1964-the justice] [The justice]1964-the justice glanced around uncomfortably upon [the crowd]416-the crowd , then nodded to [the constable]1966-the constable , and said-- “ Clear [the court]3339-the court and close the doors . ”[1964-the justice] It was done . [None]3179-none remained but [the two officials]1968-the two officials , [the accused]1969-the accused , [the accuser]1970-the accuser , and [Miles Hendon]128-hendon . [This latter]1112-this latter was rigid and colourless , and on [his]1112-this latter forehead big drops of cold sweat gathered , broke and blended together , and trickled down [his]1112-this latter face . [The judge]1959-the judge turned to [the woman]802-the woman again , and said , in a compassionate voice-- “ ‘ Tis [a poor ignorant lad]4174-a poor ignorant lad , and mayhap was driven hard by hunger , for these be grievous times for [the unfortunate]1663-the unfortunate ; mark [you]802-the woman , [he]1042-the little king hath not an evil face -- but when hunger driveth -- [Good woman]4176-good woman ! dost know that when one steals a thing above the value of thirteenpence ha’penny the law saith [he]1042-the little king shall _ hang _ for it ? ”[1959-the judge] [The little King]1042-the little king started , wide - eyed with consternation , but controlled [himself]1042-the little king and held [his]1042-the little king peace ; but not so [the woman]802-the woman . [She]802-the woman sprang to [her]802-the woman feet , shaking with fright , and cried out-- “ Oh , good lack , what have [I]802-the woman done ! God - a - mercy , [I]802-the woman would not hang the poor thing for [the whole world]4177-the whole world ! Ah , save [me]802-the woman from this , [your]802-the woman worship -- what shall [I]802-the woman do , what _ can _ [I]802-the woman do ? ”[802-the woman] [The justice]1964-the justice maintained [his]1964-the justice judicial composure , and simply said-- “ Doubtless it is allowable to revise the value , since it is not yet writ upon the record . ”[1964-the justice] “ Then in [God]87-god ’s name call the pig eightpence , and heaven bless the day that freed [my]128-hendon conscience of this awesome thing ! ”[128-hendon] [Miles Hendon]128-hendon forgot all decorum in [his]128-hendon delight ; and surprised [the King]294-the king and wounded [his]1042-the little king dignity , by throwing [his]128-hendon arms around [him]1042-the little king and hugging [him]1042-the little king . [The woman]802-the woman made [her]802-the woman grateful adieux and started away with [her]802-the woman pig ; and when [the constable]1966-the constable opened the door for [her]802-the woman , [he]1966-the constable followed [her]802-the woman out into [the narrow hall]1980-the narrow hall . [The justice]1964-the justice proceeded to write in [his]1964-the justice record book . [Hendon]128-hendon , always alert , thought [he]128-hendon would like to know why [the officer]1341-the officer followed [the woman]802-the woman out ; so [he]128-hendon slipped softly into [the dusky hall]1984-the dusky hall and listened . [He]128-hendon heard a conversation to this effect-- “ It is a fat pig , and promises good eating ; [I]128-hendon will buy it of [thee]802-the woman ; here is the eightpence . ”[128-hendon] “ Eightpence , indeed ! [Thou’lt]4178-thou do no such thing . It cost [me]128-hendon three shillings and eightpence , good honest coin of the last reign , [that old Harry that ’s just dead ne’er]4179-that old harry that ’s just dead ne’er touched or tampered with . A fig for [thy]802-the woman eightpence ! ”[128-hendon] “ Stands the wind in [that quarter]4180-that quarter ? [Thou]4178-thou wast under oath , and so swore falsely when [thou]4178-thou saidst the value was but eightpence . Come straightway back with [me]128-hendon before [his]802-the woman worship , and answer for the crime!--and then [the lad]496-the lad will hang . ”[128-hendon] “ There , there , [dear heart]3598-dear heart , say no more , [I]802-the woman am content . Give [me]802-the woman the eightpence , and hold [thy]802-the woman peace about the matter . ”[802-the woman] [The woman]802-the woman went off crying : [Hendon]128-hendon slipped back into [the court room]1986-the court room , and [the constable]1966-the constable presently followed , after hiding [his]1966-the constable prize in some convenient place . [The justice]1964-the justice wrote a while longer , then read [the King]294-the king a wise and kindly lecture , and sentenced [him]294-the king to a short imprisonment in [the common jail]1990-the common jail , to be followed by a public flogging . [The astounded King]1991-the astounded king opened [his]1991-the astounded king mouth , and was probably going to order [the good judge]1992-the good judge to be beheaded on the spot ; but [he]1991-the astounded king caught a warning sign from [Hendon]128-hendon , and succeeded in closing [his]1991-the astounded king mouth again before [he]1991-the astounded king lost anything out of it . [Hendon]128-hendon took [him]294-the king by the hand , now , made reverence to [the justice]1964-the justice , and [the two]437-the two departed in the wake of [the constable]1966-the constable toward [the jail]1996-the jail . The moment [the street]853-the street was reached , [the inflamed monarch]1998-the inflamed monarch halted , snatched away [his]1998-the inflamed monarch hand , and exclaimed-- “ [Idiot]3643-idiot , dost imagine [I]128-hendon will enter [a common jail]4184-a common jail _ alive _ ? ”[128-hendon] [Hendon]128-hendon bent down and said , somewhat sharply-- “ _ Will _ [you]1998-the inflamed monarch trust in [me]128-hendon ? Peace ! and forbear to worsen [our]437-the two chances with dangerous speech . What [God]87-god wills , will happen ; [thou]4185-thou canst not hurry it , [thou]4185-thou canst not alter it ; therefore wait , and be patient--‘twill be time enow to rail or rejoice when what is to happen has happened . ”[128-hendon] { 1 } CHAPTER XXIV . The Escape . The short winter day was nearly ended . [The streets]261-the streets were deserted , save for [a few random stragglers]2000-a few random stragglers , and [these]1520-these hurried straight along , with the intent look of people who were only anxious to accomplish [their]1520-these errands as quickly as possible , and then snugly house [themselves]1520-these from the rising wind and the gathering twilight . [They]1520-these looked neither to the right nor to the left ; [they]1520-these paid no attention to [[our]2002-our party]2003-our party , [they]1520-these did not even seem to see [them]1520-these . [Edward the Sixth]87-god wondered if the spectacle of [a king on [his]87-god way to [jail]2005-jail]2004-a king on his way to jail had ever encountered such marvellous indifference before . By - and - by [the constable]1966-the constable arrived at [a deserted market - square]2007-a deserted market - square , and proceeded to cross [it]2007-a deserted market - square . When [he]1966-the constable had reached the middle of [it]2007-a deserted market - square , [Hendon]128-hendon laid [his]128-hendon hand upon [his]1966-the constable arm , and said in a low voice-- “ Bide a moment , good sir , there is none in hearing , and [I]128-hendon would say a word to [thee]1966-the constable . ”[128-hendon] “ [My]128-hendon duty forbids it , [sir]3053-sir ; prithee hinder [me]128-hendon not , the night comes on . ”[128-hendon] “ Stay , nevertheless , for the matter concerns [thee]1966-the constable nearly . Turn [thy]1966-the constable back a moment and seem not to see : _ let [this poor lad]4187-this poor lad escape _ . ”[128-hendon] “ This to [me]128-hendon , [sir]3053-sir ! [I]128-hendon arrest [thee]1966-the constable in-- ”[128-hendon] “ Nay , be not too hasty . See [thou]1966-the constable be careful and commit no foolish error,”--then[128-hendon] [he]128-hendon shut [his]128-hendon voice down to a whisper , and said in [the man]495-the man ’s ear--“the pig [thou]1966-the constable hast purchased for eightpence may cost [thee]495-the man [thy]1966-the constable neck , [man]3164-man ! ”[128-hendon] [The poor constable]2009-the poor constable , taken by surprise , was speechless , at first , then found [his]2009-the poor constable tongue and fell to blustering and threatening ; but [Hendon]128-hendon was tranquil , and waited with patience till [his]128-hendon breath was spent ; then said-- “ [I]128-hendon have a liking to [thee]495-the man , [friend]3426-friend , and would not willingly see [thee]495-the man come to harm . Observe , [I]128-hendon heard it all -- every word . [I]128-hendon will prove it to [thee]495-the man . ”[128-hendon] Then [he]128-hendon repeated the conversation which [the officer]1341-the officer and [the woman]802-the woman had had together in [the hall]914-the hall , word for word , and ended with-- “ There -- have [I]128-hendon set it forth correctly ? Should not [I]128-hendon be able to set it forth correctly before [the judge]1959-the judge , if occasion required ? ”[128-hendon] [The man]495-the man was dumb with fear and distress , for a moment ; then [he]495-the man rallied , and said with forced lightness-- “ ‘ Tis making a mighty matter , indeed , out of a jest ; [I]495-the man but plagued [the woman]802-the woman for [mine]495-the man amusement . ”[495-the man] “ Kept [you]495-the man [the woman]802-the woman ’s pig for amusement ? ”[495-the man] [The man]495-the man answered sharply-- “ Nought else , [good sir]3747-good sir -- [I]495-the man tell [thee]495-the man ’ twas but a jest . ”[495-the man] “ [I]128-hendon do begin to believe [thee]495-the man , ”[128-hendon] said [Hendon]128-hendon , with a perplexing mixture of mockery and half - conviction in [his]128-hendon tone ; “ but tarry [thou]495-the man here a moment whilst [I]128-hendon run and ask [his]128-hendon worship -- for nathless , [he]128-hendon being [a man experienced in law]4195-a man experienced in law , in jests , in-- ”[128-hendon] [He]128-hendon was moving away , still talking ; [the constable]1966-the constable hesitated , fidgeted , spat out an oath or two , then cried out-- “ Hold , hold , [good sir]3747-good sir -- prithee wait a little -- [the judge]1959-the judge ! Why , [man]3164-man , [he]128-hendon hath no more sympathy with a jest than [hath]4199-hath a dead corpse!--come , and [we]4200-we will speak further . Ods body ! [I]1966-the constable seem to be in evil case -- and all for an innocent and thoughtless pleasantry . [I]1966-the constable am [a man of family]4201-a man of family ; and [[my]1966-the constable wife]4202-my wife and [little ones]4203-little ones -- List to reason , good [your]4204-your worship : what wouldst [thou]4205-thou of [me]1966-the constable ? ”[1966-the constable] “ Only that [thou]4205-thou be blind and dumb and paralytic whilst [one]3093-one may count a hundred thousand -- counting slowly , ”[128-hendon] said [Hendon]128-hendon , with the expression of [a man who asks but a reasonable favour , and that a very little one]2016-a man who asks but a reasonable favour , and that a very little one . “ It is [my]1966-the constable destruction ! ”[1966-the constable] said [the constable]1966-the constable despairingly . “ Ah , be reasonable , [good sir]3747-good sir ; only look at this matter , on all its sides , and see how mere a jest it is -- how manifestly and how plainly it is so . And even if [one]3093-one granted it were not a jest , it is a fault so small that e’en the grimmest penalty [it]3093-one could call forth would be but a rebuke and warning from [the judge]1959-the judge ’s lips . ”[128-hendon] [Hendon]128-hendon replied with a solemnity which chilled the air about [him--]128-hendon “ This jest of thine hath a name , in law,--wot [you]128-hendon what it is ? ”[128-hendon] “ [I]128-hendon knew it not ! Peradventure [I]128-hendon have been unwise . [I]128-hendon never dreamed it had a name -- ah , sweet heaven , [I]128-hendon thought it was original . ”[128-hendon] “ Yes , it hath a name . In the law this crime is called Non compos mentis lex talionis sic transit gloria mundi . ”[128-hendon] “ Ah , [[my]128-hendon God]4210-my god ! ”[128-hendon] “ And the penalty is death ! ”[128-hendon] “ God be merciful to [me]128-hendon [a sinner]4211-a sinner ! ”[128-hendon] “ By advantage taken of one in fault , in dire peril , and at [thy]128-hendon mercy , [thou]128-hendon hast seized goods worth above thirteenpence ha’penny , paying but a trifle for the same ; and this , in the eye of the law , is constructive barratry , misprision of treason , malfeasance in office , ad hominem expurgatis in statu quo -- and the penalty is death by [the halter]4212-the halter , without ransom , commutation , or benefit of [clergy]4213-clergy . ”[128-hendon] “ Bear [me]128-hendon up , bear [me]128-hendon up , [sweet sir]3112-sweet sir , [my]128-hendon legs do fail [me]128-hendon ! Be [thou]128-hendon merciful -- spare [me]128-hendon this doom , and [I]128-hendon will turn [my]128-hendon back and see nought that shall happen . ”[128-hendon] “ Good ! now [thou’rt]128-hendon wise and reasonable . And [thou’lt]128-hendon restore the pig ? ”[128-hendon] “ [I]128-hendon will , [I]128-hendon will indeed -- nor ever touch another , though heaven send it and [an archangel]4075-an archangel fetch it . Go -- [I]128-hendon am blind for [thy]128-hendon sake -- [I]128-hendon see nothing . [I]128-hendon will say [thou]128-hendon didst break in and wrest [the prisoner]1342-the prisoner from [my]128-hendon hands by force . It is but a crazy , ancient door -- [I]128-hendon will batter it down [myself]128-hendon betwixt midnight and the morning . ”[128-hendon] “ Do it , [good soul]3860-good soul , no harm will come of it ; [the judge]1959-the judge hath a loving charity for [this poor lad]4187-this poor lad , and will shed no tears and break [no jailer]4220-no jailer ’s bones for [his]4187-this poor lad escape . ”[128-hendon] CHAPTER XXV . [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall . As soon as [Hendon]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king were out of sight of [the constable]1966-the constable , [[his]128-hendon Majesty]3254-his majesty was instructed to hurry to [a certain place outside [the town]1411-the town]2021-a certain place outside the town , and wait there , whilst [Hendon]128-hendon should go to [the inn]3605-the inn and settle [his]128-hendon account . Half an hour later [the two friends]2024-the two friends were blithely jogging eastward on [[Hendon]128-hendon ’s sorry steeds]2025-hendon ’s sorry steeds . [The King]294-the king was warm and comfortable , now , for [he]294-the king had cast [his]294-the king rags and clothed [himself]294-the king in the second - hand suit which [Hendon]128-hendon had bought on [London Bridge]4-london bridge . [Hendon]128-hendon wished to guard against over - fatiguing [the boy]520-the boy ; [he]128-hendon judged that hard journeys , irregular meals , and illiberal measures of sleep would be bad for [his]128-hendon crazed mind ; whilst rest , regularity , and moderate exercise would be pretty sure to hasten its cure ; [he]128-hendon longed to see the stricken intellect made well again and its diseased visions driven out of the tormented little head ; therefore [he]128-hendon resolved to move by easy stages toward [the home]2028-the home whence [he]128-hendon had so long been banished , instead of obeying the impulse of [his]128-hendon impatience and hurrying along night and day . When [he]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king had journeyed about ten miles , [they]2024-the two friends reached [a considerable village]1574-a considerable village , and halted [there]3216-there for the night , at [a good inn]2032-a good inn . The former relations were resumed ; [Hendon]128-hendon stood behind [the King]294-the king ’s chair , while [he]128-hendon dined , and waited upon [him]294-the king ; undressed [him]294-the king when [he]294-the king was ready for bed ; then took the floor for [[his]128-hendon own quarters]2034-his own quarters , and slept athwart the door , rolled up in a blanket . The next day , and the day after , [they]2024-the two friends jogged lazily along talking over the adventures [they]2024-the two friends had met since [their]2024-the two friends separation , and mightily enjoying [each other]246-each other ’s narratives . [Hendon]128-hendon detailed all [his]128-hendon wide wanderings in search of [the King]294-the king , and described how [the archangel]1761-the archangel had led [him]128-hendon a fool ’s journey all over [the forest]1438-the forest , and taken [him]128-hendon back to [the hut]1734-the hut , finally , when [he]128-hendon found [he]128-hendon could not get rid of [him]128-hendon . Then -- [he]128-hendon said -- [the old man]1756-the old man went into the bedchamber and came staggering back looking broken - hearted , and saying [he]1756-the old man had expected to find that [the boy]520-the boy had returned and laid down in there to rest , but it was not so . [Hendon]128-hendon had waited at [the hut]1734-the hut all day ; hope of [the King]294-the king ’s return died out , then , and [he]128-hendon departed upon the quest again . “ And [old Sanctum Sanctorum _]4221-old sanctum sanctorum _ was _ truly sorry [[your]294-the king highness]3271-your highness came not back , ”[128-hendon] said [Hendon]128-hendon ; “ [I]128-hendon saw it in [his]3271-your highness face . ”[128-hendon] “ Marry [I]294-the king will never doubt _ that _ ! ”[294-the king] said [the King]294-the king -- and then told [his]294-the king own story ; after which , [Hendon]128-hendon was sorry [he]128-hendon had not destroyed [the archangel]1761-the archangel . During the last day of the trip , [Hendon]128-hendon ’s spirits were soaring . [His]128-hendon tongue ran constantly . [He]128-hendon talked about [[his]128-hendon old father]2046-his old father , and [[his]128-hendon brother]1215-his brother [Arthur]131-arthur , and told of many things which illustrated [their]2048-their high and generous characters ; [he]128-hendon went into loving frenzies over [[his]128-hendon Edith]2049-his edith , and was so glad - hearted that [he]128-hendon was even able to say some gentle and brotherly things about [Hugh]132-hugh . [He]128-hendon dwelt a deal on the coming meeting at [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall ; what a surprise it would be to [everybody]247-everybody , and what an outburst of thanksgiving and delight there would be . It was [a fair region]2051-a fair region , dotted with [cottages and orchards]2052-cottages and orchards , and [the road]454-the road led through [broad pasture lands whose receding expanses , marked with gentle elevations and depressions]2054-broad pasture lands whose receding expanses , marked with gentle elevations and depressions , suggested the swelling and subsiding undulations of [the sea]2055-the sea . In the afternoon [the returning prodigal]2056-the returning prodigal made constant deflections from [his]2056-the returning prodigal course to see if by ascending [some hillock]2057-some hillock [he]2056-the returning prodigal might not pierce the distance and catch a glimpse of [[his]2056-the returning prodigal home]2058-his home . At last [he]2056-the returning prodigal was successful , and cried out excitedly-- “ There is [the village]3790-the village , [[my]2056-the returning prodigal Prince]3184-my prince , and there is [the Hall close by]4225-the hall close by ! [You]3184-my prince may see the towers from here ; and that wood there -- that is [[[my]2056-the returning prodigal father]3049-my father ’s park]4227-my father ’s park . Ah , _ now _ [thou’lt]4228-thou’lt know what state and grandeur be ! [A house with [seventy rooms]4230-seventy rooms]4229-a house with seventy rooms -- think of [that!--and seven and twenty servants]4231-that!--and seven and twenty servants ! [A brave lodging for such as [we]4233-we]4232-a brave lodging for such as we , is it not so ? Come , let [us]4233-we speed -- [my]2056-the returning prodigal impatience will not brook further delay . ”[2056-the returning prodigal] All possible hurry was made ; still , it was after three o’clock before [the village]3790-the village was reached . [The travellers]2060-the travellers scampered through [it]3790-the village , [Hendon]128-hendon ’s tongue going all the time . “ [Here]451-here is [the church]4114-the church -- covered with the same ivy -- none gone , none added . ”[2060-the travellers] “ [Yonder]62-yonder is [the inn]3605-the inn , [the old Red Lion,--and yonder]4237-the old red lion,--and yonder is [the market - place]4238-the market - place . ”[2060-the travellers] “ Here is the Maypole , and here the pump -- nothing is altered ; nothing but [the people]244-the people , at any rate ; ten years make a change in [people]321-people ; some of these [I]2060-the travellers seem to know , but none know [me]2060-the travellers . ”[2060-the travellers] So [his]128-hendon chat ran on . [The end of [the village]3790-the village]2061-the end of the village was soon reached ; then [the travellers]2060-the travellers struck into [a crooked , narrow road]2064-a crooked , narrow road , walled in with tall hedges , and hurried briskly along [it]2064-a crooked , narrow road for half a mile , then passed into [a vast flower garden]2065-a vast flower garden through an imposing gateway , whose huge stone pillars bore sculptured armorial devices . [A noble mansion]2066-a noble mansion was before [them]2060-the travellers . “ Welcome to [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall , [[my]128-hendon King]3798-my king ! ”[128-hendon] exclaimed [Miles]128-hendon . “ Ah , ’ tis a great day ! [[My]128-hendon father]3049-my father and [[my]128-hendon brother]3303-my brother , and [the Lady Edith]137-the lady edith will be so mad with joy that [they]2060-the travellers will have eyes and tongue for none but [me]128-hendon in the first transports of the meeting , and so [thou’lt]4244-thou’lt seem but coldly welcomed -- but mind it not ; ’ twill soon seem otherwise ; for when [I]128-hendon say [thou]4245-thee art [[my]128-hendon ward]4246-my ward , and tell [them]2060-the travellers how costly is [my]128-hendon love for [thee]4245-thee , [thou’lt]4244-thou’lt see [them]2060-the travellers take [thee]4245-thee to [their]2060-the travellers breasts for [Miles Hendon]128-hendon ’s sake , and make [[their]2060-the travellers house]4247-their house and hearts [thy]4245-thee home for ever after ! ”[128-hendon] The next moment [Hendon]128-hendon sprang to the ground before the great door , helped [the King]294-the king down , then took [him]294-the king by the hand and rushed within . A few steps brought [him]128-hendon to [a spacious apartment]1387-a spacious apartment ; [he]128-hendon entered , seated [the King with more hurry than ceremony]2069-the king with more hurry than ceremony , then ran toward [a young man who sat at a writing - table in front of a generous fire of logs]2070-a young man who sat at a writing - table in front of a generous fire of logs . “ Embrace [me]128-hendon , [Hugh]132-hugh , ”[128-hendon] [he]128-hendon cried , “ and say [thou’rt]4248-thou’rt glad [I]128-hendon am come again ! and call [[our]4249-our father]4250-our father , for [home]296-home is not [home]296-home till [I]128-hendon shall touch [his]4250-our father hand , and see [his]4250-our father face , and hear [his]4250-our father voice once more ! ”[128-hendon] But [Hugh]132-hugh only drew back , after betraying a momentary surprise , and bent a grave stare upon [the intruder]2071-the intruder -- a stare which indicated somewhat of offended dignity , at first , then changed , in response to some inward thought or purpose , to an expression of marvelling curiosity , mixed with a real or assumed compassion . Presently [he]132-hugh said , in a mild voice-- “ [Thy]2071-the intruder wits seem touched , [poor stranger]4253-poor stranger ; doubtless [thou]2071-the intruder hast suffered privations and rude buffetings at [the world]1021-the world ’s hands ; [thy]2071-the intruder looks and dress betoken it . Whom dost [thou]2071-the intruder take [me]132-hugh to be ? ”[132-hugh] “ Take [thee]2071-the intruder ? Prithee for whom else than whom [thou]2071-the intruder art ? [I]128-hendon take [thee]2071-the intruder to be [Hugh Hendon]177-hugh , ”[128-hendon] said [Miles]128-hendon , sharply . [The other]1645-the other continued , in the same soft tone-- “ And whom dost [thou]2071-the intruder imagine [thyself]4255-thyself to be ? ”[1645-the other] “ Imagination hath nought to do with it ! Dost [thou]2071-the intruder pretend [thou]2071-the intruder knowest [me]1645-the other not for [[thy]2071-the intruder brother]4041-thy brother [Miles Hendon]128-hendon ? ”[1645-the other] An expression of pleased surprise flitted across [Hugh]177-hugh ’s face , and [he]177-hugh exclaimed-- “ What ! [thou]2071-the intruder art not jesting ? can [the dead]4257-the dead come to life ? [God]4258-god be praised if it be so ! [[Our]4259-our poor lost boy]4260-our poor lost boy restored to [our]4259-our arms after all these cruel years ! Ah , it seems too good to be true , it _ is _ too good to be true -- [I]177-hugh charge [thee]128-hendon , have pity , do not trifle with [me]177-hugh ! Quick -- come to the light -- let [me]177-hugh scan [thee]128-hendon well ! ”[177-hugh] [He]177-hugh seized [Miles]128-hendon by the arm , dragged [him]128-hendon to the window , and began to devour [him]128-hendon from head to foot with [his]177-hugh eyes , turning [him]128-hendon this way and that , and stepping briskly around [him]128-hendon and about [him]128-hendon to prove [him]128-hendon from all points of view ; whilst [the returned prodigal , all aglow with gladness]2073-the returned prodigal , all aglow with gladness , smiled , laughed , and kept nodding [his]177-hugh head and saying-- “ Go on , [brother]4261-brother , go on , and fear not ; [thou’lt]4262-thou’lt find nor limb nor feature that can not bide the test . Scour and scan [me]177-hugh to [thy]128-hendon content , [[my]177-hugh good old [Hugh]177-hugh]177-hugh -- [I]177-hugh am indeed [[thy]128-hendon old [Miles]128-hendon]4263-thy old miles , [[thy]128-hendon same old [Miles]128-hendon]4264-thy same old miles , [[thy]128-hendon lost brother]4265-thy lost brother , is’t not so ? Ah , ’ tis a great day -- [I]177-hugh _ said _ ’ twas a great day ! Give [me]177-hugh [thy]128-hendon hand , give [me]177-hugh [thy]128-hendon cheek -- lord , [I]177-hugh am like to die of very joy ! ”[177-hugh] [He]2074-he was about to throw [himself]2074-he upon [[his]2074-he brother]1215-his brother ; but [Hugh]177-hugh put up [his]177-hugh hand in dissent , then dropped [his]177-hugh chin mournfully upon [his]177-hugh breast , saying with emotion-- “ Ah , [[God]87-god of [his]1215-his brother mercy]4266-god of his mercy give [me]128-hendon strength to bear this grievous disappointment ! ”[128-hendon] [Miles]128-hendon , amazed , could not speak for a moment ; then [he]128-hendon found [his]128-hendon tongue , and cried out-- “ _ What _ disappointment ? Am [I]177-hugh not [[thy]128-hendon brother]4041-thy brother ? ”[177-hugh] [Hugh]177-hugh shook [his]177-hugh head sadly , and said-- “ [I]177-hugh pray heaven it may prove so , and that other eyes may find the resemblances that are hid from [mine]177-hugh . [Alack]106-alack , [I]177-hugh fear [me]177-hugh the letter spoke but too truly . ”[177-hugh] “ What letter ? ”[177-hugh] “ One that came from [over sea]4268-over sea , some six or seven years ago . [It]4269-it said [[my]177-hugh brother]3303-my brother died in battle . ”[177-hugh] “ It was a lie ! Call [[thy]128-hendon father]3066-thy father -- [he]3066-thy father will know [me]177-hugh . ”[177-hugh] “ [One]3093-one may not call the dead . ”[177-hugh] “ Dead ? ”[128-hendon] [Miles]128-hendon ’s voice was subdued , and [his]128-hendon lips trembled . “ [[My]128-hendon father]3049-my father dead!--oh , this is heavy news . Half [my]128-hendon new joy is withered now . [Prithee]100-prithee let [me]128-hendon see [[my]128-hendon brother]3303-my brother [Arthur]131-arthur -- [he]131-arthur will know [me]128-hendon ; [he]131-arthur will know [me]128-hendon and console [me]128-hendon . ”[128-hendon] “ [He]131-arthur , also , is dead . ”[177-hugh] “ [God]87-god be merciful to [me]177-hugh , [a stricken man]4275-a stricken man ! [Gone,--both]178-gone,--both gone -- [the worthy taken]4276-the worthy taken and [the worthless spared]4277-the worthless spared , in [me]177-hugh ! Ah ! [I]177-hugh crave [your]177-hugh mercy!--do not say [the Lady Edith--]4278-the lady edith-- ”[177-hugh] “ Is dead ? No , [she]4278-the lady edith-- lives . ”[128-hendon] “ Then , [God]87-god be praised , [my]177-hugh joy is whole again ! Speed [thee]177-hugh , [brother]4261-brother -- let [her]4278-the lady edith-- come to [me]177-hugh ! An ’ _ [she]4278-the lady edith-- _ say [I]177-hugh am not [myself]177-hugh -- but [she]4278-the lady edith-- will not ; no , no , _ [she]4278-the lady edith-- _ will know [me]177-hugh , [I]177-hugh were [a fool]3984-a fool to doubt it . Bring [her]4278-the lady edith-- -- bring [the old servants]4281-the old servants ; [they]4281-the old servants , too , will know [me]177-hugh . ”[177-hugh] “ [All]654-all are gone but five -- [Peter]179-peter , [Halsey]180-halsey , [David]181-david , [Bernard]182-bernard , and [Margaret]183-margaret . ”[177-hugh] So saying , [Hugh]177-hugh left [the room]507-the room . [Miles]128-hendon stood musing a while , then began to walk the floor , muttering-- “ [The five arch - villains]4283-the five arch - villains have survived the two - and - twenty leal and honest--‘tis an odd thing . ”[128-hendon] [He]128-hendon continued walking back and forth , muttering to [himself]128-hendon ; [he]128-hendon had forgotten [the King]294-the king entirely . By - and - by [[his]294-the king Majesty]3254-his majesty said gravely , and with a touch of genuine compassion , though the words themselves were capable of being interpreted ironically-- “ Mind not [thy]3254-his majesty mischance , [good man]4284-good man ; there be others in [the world]1021-the world [whose identity is denied , and whose claims are derided]4286-whose identity is denied , and whose claims are derided . [Thou]3254-his majesty hast company . ”[3254-his majesty] “ Ah , [[my]128-hendon King]3798-my king , ”[128-hendon] cried [Hendon]128-hendon , colouring slightly , “ do not [thou]3254-his majesty condemn [me]128-hendon -- wait , and [thou]3254-his majesty shalt see . [I]128-hendon am [no impostor]4288-no impostor -- [she]4289-she will say it ; [you]3798-my king shall hear it from the sweetest lips in [England]2-england . [I]128-hendon [an impostor]3336-an impostor ? Why , [I]128-hendon know [this old hall]4291-this old hall , these pictures of [[my]128-hendon ancestors]4292-my ancestors , and all these things that are about [us]4293-us , as [a child]3831-a child knoweth [[its]3831-a child own nursery]4295-its own nursery . Here was [I]128-hendon born and bred , [[my]128-hendon lord]3168-my lord ; [I]128-hendon speak the truth ; [I]128-hendon would not deceive [thee]3798-my king ; and should [none else]4297-none else believe , [I]128-hendon pray [thee]3798-my king do not _ [thou]3798-my king _ doubt [me]128-hendon -- [I]128-hendon could not bear it . ”[128-hendon] “ [I]294-the king do not doubt [thee]3798-my king , ”[294-the king] said [the King]294-the king , with a childlike simplicity and faith . “ [I]128-hendon thank [thee]3798-my king out of [my]128-hendon heart ! ”[128-hendon] exclaimed [Hendon]128-hendon with a fervency which showed that [he]128-hendon was touched . [The King]87-god added , with the same gentle simplicity-- “ Dost [thou]3798-my king doubt _ [me]87-god _ ? ”[87-god] A guilty confusion seized upon [Hendon]128-hendon , and [he]128-hendon was grateful that the door opened to admit [Hugh]177-hugh , at that moment , and saved [him]128-hendon the necessity of replying . [A beautiful lady , richly clothed]2080-a beautiful lady , richly clothed , followed [Hugh]177-hugh , and after [her]2080-a beautiful lady , richly clothed came [several liveried servants]2081-several liveried servants . [The lady]2082-the lady walked slowly , with [her]2082-the lady head bowed and [her]2082-the lady eyes fixed upon the floor . The face was unspeakably sad . [Miles Hendon]128-hendon sprang forward , crying out-- “ Oh , [[my]128-hendon [Edith]137-the lady edith]1078-my edith , [my]128-hendon darling-- ”[128-hendon] But [Hugh]177-hugh waved [him]128-hendon back , gravely , and said to the lady-- “ Look upon [him]128-hendon . Do [you]802-the woman know [him]128-hendon ? ”[177-hugh] At the sound of [Miles]128-hendon ’s voice [the woman]802-the woman had started slightly , and [her]802-the woman cheeks had flushed ; [she]802-the woman was trembling now . [She]802-the woman stood still , during an impressive pause of several moments ; then slowly lifted up [her]802-the woman head and looked into [Hendon]128-hendon ’s eyes with a stony and frightened gaze ; the blood sank out of [her]802-the woman face , drop by drop , till nothing remained but the grey pallor of death ; then [she]802-the woman said , in a voice as dead as the face , “ [I]802-the woman know [him]128-hendon not ! ”[802-the woman] and turned , with a moan and a stifled sob , and tottered out of [the room]507-the room . [Miles Hendon]128-hendon sank into a chair and covered [his]128-hendon face with [his]128-hendon hands . After a pause , [[his]128-hendon brother]1215-his brother said to [the servants--]2086-the servants-- “ [You]2086-the servants-- have observed [him]128-hendon . Do [you]2086-the servants-- know [him]128-hendon ? ”[2086-the servants--] [They]2086-the servants-- shook [their]2086-the servants-- heads ; then [the master]3699-the master said-- “ [The servants]428-the servants know [you]128-hendon not , [sir]3053-sir . [I]3699-the master fear there is some mistake . [You]2086-the servants-- have seen that [[my]3699-the master wife]4202-my wife knew [you]128-hendon not . ”[3699-the master] “ [[Thy]3699-the master _ wife]4302-thy _ wife _ ! ”[3699-the master] In an instant [Hugh]177-hugh was pinned to the wall , with an iron grip about [his]177-hugh throat . “ Oh , [[thou]3699-the master fox - hearted slave]4303-thou fox - hearted slave , [I]177-hugh see it all ! [Thou’st]3699-the master writ the lying letter [thyself]3699-the master , and [[my]177-hugh stolen bride]4304-my stolen bride and goods are its fruit . There -- now get [thee]3699-the master gone , lest [I]177-hugh shame [mine]177-hugh honourable soldiership with the slaying of [so pitiful a mannikin]4305-so pitiful a mannikin ! ”[177-hugh] [Hugh]177-hugh , red - faced , and almost suffocated , reeled to the nearest chair , and commanded [the servants]428-the servants to seize and bind [the murderous stranger]2089-the murderous stranger . [They]428-the servants hesitated , and [one of [them]428-the servants]681-one of them said-- “ [He]2089-the murderous stranger is armed , [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , and [we]428-the servants are weaponless . ”[681-one of them] “ Armed ! What of it , and [ye]428-the servants so many ? Upon [him]2089-the murderous stranger , [I]681-one of them say ! ”[681-one of them] But [Miles]128-hendon warned [them]428-the servants to be careful what [they]428-the servants did , and added-- “ [Ye]428-the servants know [me]128-hendon of old -- [I]128-hendon have not changed ; come on , an ’ it like [you]428-the servants . ”[128-hendon] This reminder did not hearten [the servants]428-the servants much ; [they]428-the servants still held back . “ Then go , [ye paltry cowards]4306-ye paltry cowards , and arm [yourselves]4306-ye paltry cowards and guard the doors , whilst [I]132-hugh send one to fetch the watch ! ”[132-hugh] said [Hugh]132-hugh . [He]132-hugh turned at the threshold , and said to [Miles]128-hendon , “ [You]128-hendon ’ll find it to [your]128-hendon advantage to offend not with useless endeavours at escape . ”[132-hugh] “ Escape ? Spare [thyself]2089-the murderous stranger discomfort , an ’ that is all that troubles [thee]128-hendon . For [Miles Hendon]128-hendon is [master of [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall]4307-master of hendon hall and all [its]41-hendon hall belongings . [He]128-hendon will remain -- doubt it not . ”[132-hugh] CHAPTER XXVI . Disowned . [The King]294-the king sat musing a few moments , then looked up and said-- “ ‘ Tis strange -- most strange . [I]294-the king can not account for it . ”[294-the king] “ No , it is not strange , [[my]132-hugh liege]3243-my liege . [I]132-hugh know [him]128-hendon , and this conduct is but natural . [He]128-hendon was [a rascal]4309-a rascal from [his]128-hendon birth . ”[132-hugh] “ Oh , [I]132-hugh spake not of _ [him]128-hendon _ , [Sir Miles]128-hendon . ”[132-hugh] “ Not of [him]128-hendon ? Then of what ? What is it that is strange ? ”[294-the king] “ That [the King]294-the king is not missed . ”[132-hugh] “ How ? Which ? [I]132-hugh doubt [I]132-hugh do not understand . ”[132-hugh] “ Indeed ? Doth it not strike [you]128-hendon as being passing strange that [the land]3332-the land is not filled with couriers and proclamations describing [[my]294-the king person]4312-my person and making search for [me]294-the king ? Is it no matter for commotion and distress that [the Head of the State]4313-the head of the state is gone ; that [I]294-the king am vanished away and lost ? ”[294-the king] “ Most true , [[my]132-hugh King]3798-my king , [I]132-hugh had forgot . ”[132-hugh] Then [Hendon]128-hendon sighed , and muttered to [himself]128-hendon , “ Poor ruined mind -- still busy with its pathetic dream . ”[128-hendon] “ But [I]294-the king have a plan that shall right [us]4315-us both -- [I]294-the king will write a paper , in three tongues -- Latin , Greek and English -- and [thou]4316-thou shalt haste away with it to [London]1-london in the morning . Give it to none but [[my]294-the king uncle]4317-my uncle , [the Lord Hertford]3259-the lord hertford ; when [he]4317-my uncle shall see it , [he]4317-my uncle will know and say [I]294-the king wrote it . Then [he]4317-my uncle will send for [me]294-the king . ”[294-the king] “ Might it not be best , [[my]294-the king Prince]3184-my prince , that [we]4315-us wait here until [I]294-the king prove [myself]294-the king and make [my]294-the king rights secure to [[my]294-the king domains]4320-my domains ? [I]294-the king should be so much the better able then to-- ”[294-the king] [The King]294-the king interrupted [him]294-the king imperiously-- “ Peace ! What are [[thy]294-the king paltry domains]4321-thy paltry domains , [thy]294-the king trivial interests , contrasted with matters which concern the weal of [a nation]4322-a nation and the integrity of a throne ? ”[294-the king] Then , [he]294-the king added , in a gentle voice , as if [he]294-the king were sorry for [his]294-the king severity , “ Obey , and have no fear ; [I]294-the king will right [thee]294-the king , [I]294-the king will make [thee]294-the king whole -- yes , more than whole . [I]294-the king shall remember , and requite . ”[294-the king] So saying , [he]294-the king took the pen , and set [himself]294-the king to work . [Hendon]128-hendon contemplated [him]294-the king lovingly a while , then said to [himself--]128-hendon “ An ’ it were dark , [I]128-hendon should think it _ was _ [a king that spoke]4323-a king that spoke ; there ’s no denying it , when the humour ’s upon on [him]4323-a king that spoke [he]4323-a king that spoke doth thunder and lighten like [[your]128-hendon true King]4324-your true king ; now where got [he]4323-a king that spoke that trick ? See [him]4323-a king that spoke scribble and scratch away contentedly at [his]4323-a king that spoke meaningless pot - hooks , fancying them to be Latin and Greek -- and except [my]128-hendon wit shall serve [me]128-hendon with a lucky device for diverting [him]4323-a king that spoke from [his]4323-a king that spoke purpose , [I]128-hendon shall be forced to pretend to post away to - morrow on this wild errand [he]4323-a king that spoke hath invented for [me]128-hendon . ”[128-hendon] The next moment [Sir Miles]128-hendon ’s thoughts had gone back to the recent episode . So absorbed was [he]128-hendon in [his]128-hendon musings , that when [the King]294-the king presently handed [him]128-hendon the paper which [he]128-hendon had been writing , [he]128-hendon received it and pocketed it without being conscious of the act . “ How marvellous strange [she]4325-she acted , ”[128-hendon] [he]128-hendon muttered . “ [I]128-hendon think [she]4325-she knew [me]128-hendon -- and [I]128-hendon think [she]4325-she did _ not _ know [me]128-hendon . These opinions do conflict , [I]128-hendon perceive it plainly ; [I]128-hendon can not reconcile them , neither can [I]128-hendon , by argument , dismiss either of the two , or even persuade one to outweigh the other . The matter standeth simply thus : [she]4325-she _ must _ have known [my]128-hendon face , [my]128-hendon figure , [my]128-hendon voice , for how could it be otherwise ? Yet [she]4325-she _ _ said _ _ [she]4325-she knew [me]128-hendon not , and that is proof perfect , for [she]4325-she can not lie . But stop -- [I]128-hendon think [I]128-hendon begin to see . Peradventure [he]128-hendon hath influenced [her]4325-she , commanded [her]4325-she , compelled [her]4325-she to lie . That is the solution . The riddle is unriddled . [She]4325-she seemed dead with fear -- yes , [she]4325-she was under [his]128-hendon compulsion . [I]128-hendon will seek [her]4325-she ; [I]128-hendon will find [her]4325-she ; now that [he]128-hendon is away , [she]4325-she will speak [her]4325-she true mind . [She]4325-she will remember the old times when [we]4326-we were [little playfellows]4327-little playfellows together , and this will soften [her]4325-she heart , and [she]4325-she will no more betray [me]128-hendon , but will confess [me]128-hendon . There is no treacherous blood in [her]4325-she -- no , [she]4325-she was always honest and true . [She]4325-she has loved [me]128-hendon , in those old days -- this is [my]128-hendon security ; for whom [one has loved]4328-one has loved , [one]3093-one can not betray . ”[128-hendon] [He]2095-he stepped eagerly toward the door ; at that moment it opened , and [the Lady Edith]137-the lady edith entered . [She]137-the lady edith was very pale , but [she]137-the lady edith walked with a firm step , and [her]137-the lady edith carriage was full of grace and gentle dignity . [Her]137-the lady edith face was as sad as before . [Miles]128-hendon sprang forward , with a happy confidence , to meet [her]137-the lady edith , but [she]137-the lady edith checked [him]128-hendon with a hardly perceptible gesture , and [he]128-hendon stopped where [he]128-hendon was . [She]137-the lady edith seated [herself]137-the lady edith , and asked [him]128-hendon to do likewise . Thus simply did [she]137-the lady edith take the sense of old comradeship out of [him]128-hendon , and transform [him]128-hendon into [a stranger]3623-a stranger and [a guest]2097-a guest . The surprise of it , the bewildering unexpectedness of it , made [him]128-hendon begin to question , for a moment , if [he]128-hendon _ was _ [the person [he]128-hendon was pretending to be]2098-the person he was pretending to be , after all . [The Lady Edith]137-the lady edith said-- “ [Sir]3053-sir , [I]137-the lady edith have come to warn [you]3053-sir . [The mad]4331-the mad can not be persuaded out of [their]4331-the mad delusions , perchance ; but doubtless [they]4331-the mad may be persuaded to avoid perils . [I]137-the lady edith think this dream of [yours]3053-sir hath the seeming of honest truth to [you]3053-sir , and therefore is not criminal -- but do not tarry here with it ; for here it is dangerous . ”[137-the lady edith] [She]137-the lady edith looked steadily into [Miles]128-hendon ’s face a moment , then added , impressively , “ It is the more dangerous for that [you]128-hendon _ are _ much like what [[our]4332-our lost lad]4333-our lost lad must have grown to be if [he]4333-our lost lad had lived . ”[137-the lady edith] “ Heavens , [madam]3287-madam , but [I]2099-i _ am _ [he]2099-i ! ”[2099-i] “ [I]2099-i truly think [you]3053-sir think it , [sir]3053-sir . [I]2099-i question not [your]3053-sir honesty in that ; [I]2099-i but warn [you]3053-sir , that is all . [[My]2099-i husband]4336-my husband is master in [this region]4337-this region ; [his]4336-my husband power hath hardly any limit ; [the people]244-the people prosper or starve , as [he]4336-my husband wills . If [you]3053-sir resembled not [the man whom [you]3053-sir profess to be]4339-the man whom you profess to be , [[my]2099-i husband]4336-my husband might bid [you]3053-sir pleasure [yourself]3053-sir with [your]3053-sir dream in peace ; but trust [me]2099-i , [I]2099-i know [him]4336-my husband well ; [I]2099-i know what [he]4336-my husband will do ; [he]4336-my husband will say to all that [you]3053-sir are but [a mad impostor]4341-a mad impostor , and straightway all will echo [him]4336-my husband . ”[2099-i] [She]2099-i bent upon [Miles]128-hendon that same steady look once more , and added : “ If [you]128-hendon _ were _ [Miles Hendon]128-hendon , and [he]4336-my husband knew it and [all the region]4342-all the region knew it -- consider what [I]2099-i am saying , weigh it well -- [you]128-hendon would stand in the same peril , [your]128-hendon punishment would be no less sure ; [he]4336-my husband would deny [you]128-hendon and denounce [you]128-hendon , and [none]3179-none would be bold enough to give [you]128-hendon countenance . ”[2099-i] “ Most truly [I]128-hendon believe it , ”[128-hendon] said [Miles]128-hendon , bitterly . “ The power that can command [one life - long friend]4344-one life - long friend to betray and disown another , and be obeyed , may well look to be obeyed in quarters where bread and life are on the stake and no cobweb ties of loyalty and honour are concerned . ”[128-hendon] A faint tinge appeared for a moment in [the lady]2082-the lady ’s cheek , and [she]2082-the lady dropped [her]2082-the lady eyes to the floor ; but [her]2082-the lady voice betrayed no emotion when [she]2082-the lady proceeded-- “ [I]2082-the lady have warned [you]128-hendon -- [I]2082-the lady must still warn [you]128-hendon -- to go hence . [This man]546-this man will destroy [you]128-hendon , else . [He]546-this man is [a tyrant who knows no pity]4346-a tyrant who knows no pity . [I]2082-the lady , who am [[his]546-this man fettered slave]4347-his fettered slave , know this . [Poor Miles]128-hendon , and [Arthur]131-arthur , and [[my]2082-the lady dear guardian]4348-my dear guardian , [Sir Richard]136-sir richard , are free of [him]546-this man , and at rest : better that [you]128-hendon were with [them]4349-them than that [you]128-hendon bide here in the clutches of [this miscreant]4350-this miscreant . [Your]128-hendon pretensions are a menace to [his]546-this man title and possessions ; [you]128-hendon have assaulted [him]546-this man in [[his]546-this man own house]4351-his own house : [you]128-hendon are ruined if [you]128-hendon stay . Go -- do not hesitate . If [you]128-hendon lack money , take this purse , [I]2082-the lady beg of [you]128-hendon , and bribe [the servants]428-the servants to let [you]128-hendon pass . Oh , be warned , [poor soul]3692-poor soul , and escape while [you]128-hendon may . ”[2082-the lady] [Miles]128-hendon declined the purse with a gesture , and rose up and stood before [her]2101-her . “ Grant [me]128-hendon one thing , ”[128-hendon] [he]128-hendon said . “ Let [your]128-hendon eyes rest upon [mine]128-hendon , so that [I]128-hendon may see if they be steady . There -- now answer [me]128-hendon . Am [I]128-hendon [Miles Hendon]128-hendon ? ”[128-hendon] “ No . [I]2082-the lady know [you]128-hendon not . ”[2082-the lady] “ Swear it ! ”[128-hendon] The answer was low , but distinct-- “ [I]2082-the lady swear . ”[2082-the lady] “ Oh , this passes belief ! ”[2082-the lady] “ [Fly]184-fly ! Why will [you]128-hendon waste the precious time ? [Fly]184-fly , and save [yourself]128-hendon . ”[2082-the lady] At that moment [the officers]2102-the officers burst into [the room]507-the room , and a violent struggle began ; but [Hendon]128-hendon was soon overpowered and dragged away . [The King]294-the king was taken also , and [both]1909-both were bound and led to [prison]2106-prison . CHAPTER XXVII . In [Prison]2106-prison . [The cells]2108-the cells were all crowded ; so [the two friends]2024-the two friends were chained in [a large room where [persons charged with trifling offences]2111-persons charged with trifling offences were commonly kept]2110-a large room where persons charged with trifling offences were commonly kept . [They]2024-the two friends had company , for there were some [twenty manacled and fettered prisoners here , of both sexes and of varying ages,--an obscene and noisy gang]2112-twenty manacled and fettered prisoners here , of both sexes and of varying ages,--an obscene and noisy gang . [The King]294-the king chafed bitterly over the stupendous indignity thus put upon [[his]294-the king royalty]1839-his royalty , but [Hendon]128-hendon was moody and taciturn . [He]128-hendon was pretty thoroughly bewildered ; [he]128-hendon had come [home]296-home , [a jubilant prodigal]2116-a jubilant prodigal , expecting to find [everybody]247-everybody wild with joy over [his]128-hendon return ; and instead had got the cold shoulder and [a jail]2118-a jail . The promise and the fulfilment differed so widely that the effect was stunning ; [he]128-hendon could not decide whether it was most tragic or most grotesque . [He]128-hendon felt much as [a man]3486-a man might who had danced blithely out to enjoy a rainbow , and got struck by lightning . But gradually [his]128-hendon confused and tormenting thoughts settled down into some sort of order , and then [his]128-hendon mind centred itself upon [Edith]137-the lady edith . [He]128-hendon turned [her]137-the lady edith conduct over , and examined it in all lights , but [he]128-hendon could not make anything satisfactory out of it . Did [she]137-the lady edith know [him]128-hendon -- or did n’t [she]137-the lady edith know [him]128-hendon ? It was a perplexing puzzle , and occupied [him]128-hendon a long time ; but [he]128-hendon ended , finally , with the conviction that [she]137-the lady edith did know [him]128-hendon , and had repudiated [him]128-hendon for interested reasons . [He]128-hendon wanted to load [her]137-the lady edith name with curses now ; but this name had so long been sacred to [him]128-hendon that [he]128-hendon found [he]128-hendon could not bring [his]128-hendon tongue to profane it . Wrapped in prison blankets of a soiled and tattered condition , [Hendon]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king passed a troubled night . For a bribe [the jailer]2121-the jailer had furnished liquor to [some of [the prisoners]1335-the prisoners]2122-some of the prisoners ; singing of ribald songs , fighting , shouting , and carousing was the natural consequence . At last , a while after midnight , [a man]3486-a man attacked [a woman]1101-a woman and nearly killed [her]1101-a woman by beating [her]1101-a woman over the head with [his]3486-a man manacles before [the jailer]2121-the jailer could come to the rescue . [The jailer]2121-the jailer restored peace by giving [the man a sound clubbing about the head and shoulders]2128-the man a sound clubbing about the head and shoulders -- then the carousing ceased ; and after that , [all]654-all had an opportunity to sleep who did not mind the annoyance of the moanings and groanings of [the two wounded people]2130-the two wounded people . During the ensuing week , the days and nights were of a monotonous sameness as to events ; men whose faces [Hendon]128-hendon remembered more or less distinctly , came , by day , to gaze at [the ‘ impostor ’]2131-the ‘ impostor ’ and repudiate and insult [him]2131-the ‘ impostor ’ ; and by night the carousing and brawling went on with symmetrical regularity . However , there was a change of incident at last . [The jailer]2121-the jailer brought in [an old man]2133-an old man , and said to [him--]2133-an old man “ [The villain]4354-the villain is in [this room]4355-this room -- cast [thy]2133-an old man old eyes about and see if [thou]2133-an old man canst say which is [he]4354-the villain . ”[2121-the jailer] [Hendon]128-hendon glanced up , and experienced a pleasant sensation for the first time since [he]128-hendon had been in [the jail]1996-the jail . [He]128-hendon said to [himself]128-hendon , “ This is [Blake Andrews]185-andrews , [a servant all [his]185-andrews life in [[my]128-hendon father]3049-my father ’s family]4356-a servant all his life in my father ’s family -- [a good honest soul]4358-a good honest soul , with a right heart in [his]185-andrews breast . That is , formerly . But none are true now ; all are [liars]4359-liars . [This man]546-this man will know [me]128-hendon -- and will deny [me]128-hendon , too , like the rest . ”[128-hendon] [The old man]1756-the old man gazed around [the room]507-the room , glanced at each face in turn , and finally said-- “ [I]1756-the old man see none here but [paltry knaves]4361-paltry knaves , scum o ’ [the streets]261-the streets . Which is [he]546-this man ? ”[1756-the old man] [The jailer]2121-the jailer laughed . “ Here , ”[2121-the jailer] [he]2121-the jailer said ; “ scan [this big animal]4363-this big animal , and grant [me]2121-the jailer an opinion . ”[2121-the jailer] [The old man]1756-the old man approached , and looked [Hendon]128-hendon over , long and earnestly , then shook [his]1756-the old man head and said-- “ [Marry]99-marry , _ this _ is no [Hendon]128-hendon -- nor ever was ! ”[1756-the old man] “ Right ! [Thy]1756-the old man old eyes are sound yet . An ’ [I]2121-the jailer were [Sir Hugh]4364-sir hugh , [I]2121-the jailer would take [the shabby carle]4365-the shabby carle and-- ”[2121-the jailer] [The jailer]2121-the jailer finished by lifting [himself]2121-the jailer a - tip - toe with an imaginary halter , at the same time making a gurgling noise in [his]2121-the jailer throat suggestive of suffocation . [The old man]1756-the old man said , vindictively-- “ Let [him]546-this man bless [God]87-god an ’ [he]546-this man fare no worse . An ’ _ [I]1756-the old man _ had the handling o ’ [the villain [he]546-this man should roast]4366-the villain he should roast , or [I]1756-the old man am [no true man]3167-no true man ! ”[1756-the old man] [The jailer]2121-the jailer laughed a pleasant hyena laugh , and said-- “ Give [him]546-this man a piece of [thy]2121-the jailer mind , [old man]4368-old man -- [they]4369-they all do it . [Thou’lt]4370-thou find it good diversion . ”[2121-the jailer] Then [he]2121-the jailer sauntered toward [[his]2121-the jailer ante - room]2142-his ante - room and disappeared . [The old man]1756-the old man dropped upon [his]1756-the old man knees and whispered-- “ [God]87-god be thanked , [thou’rt]4370-thou come again , [[my]1756-the old man master]3639-my master ! [I]1756-the old man believed [thou]4370-thou [wert]4370-thou dead these seven years , and lo , here [thou]4370-thou art alive ! [I]1756-the old man knew [thee]4370-thou the moment [I]1756-the old man saw [thee]4370-thou ; and main hard work it was to keep a stony countenance and seem to see none here but tuppenny knaves and rubbish o ’ [the streets]261-the streets . [I]1756-the old man am old and poor , [Sir Miles]128-hendon ; but say the word and [I]1756-the old man will go forth and proclaim the truth though [I]1756-the old man be strangled for it . ”[1756-the old man] “ No , ”[128-hendon] said [Hendon]128-hendon ; “ [thou]4370-thou shalt not . It would ruin [thee]4370-thou , and yet help but little in [my]128-hendon cause . But [I]128-hendon thank [thee]4370-thou , for [thou]4370-thou hast given [me]128-hendon back somewhat of [my]128-hendon lost faith in [[my]128-hendon kind]4373-my kind . ”[128-hendon] [The old servant]2144-the old servant became very valuable to [Hendon]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king ; for [he]2144-the old servant dropped in several times a day to ‘ abuse ’ [the former]619-the former , and always smuggled in a few delicacies to help out the prison bill of fare ; [he]2144-the old servant also furnished the current news . [Hendon]128-hendon reserved the dainties for [the King]294-the king ; without [them]2148-them [[his]128-hendon Majesty]3254-his majesty might not have survived , for [he]128-hendon was not able to eat the coarse and wretched food provided by [the jailer]2121-the jailer . [Andrews]185-andrews was obliged to confine [himself]185-andrews to brief visits , in order to avoid suspicion ; but [he]185-andrews managed to impart a fair degree of information each time -- information delivered in a low voice , for [Hendon]128-hendon ’s benefit , and interlarded with insulting epithets delivered in a louder voice for the benefit of [other hearers]2151-other hearers . So , little by little , the story of [the family]820-the family came out . [Arthur]131-arthur had been dead six years . This loss , with the absence of news from [Hendon]128-hendon , impaired [the father]281-the father ’s health ; [he]281-the father believed [he]281-the father was going to die , and [he]281-the father wished to see [Hugh]132-hugh and [Edith]137-the lady edith settled in life before [he]281-the father passed away ; but [Edith]137-the lady edith begged hard for delay , hoping for [Miles]128-hendon ’s return ; then the letter came which brought the news of [Miles]128-hendon ’s death ; the shock prostrated [Sir Richard]136-sir richard ; [he]136-sir richard believed [his]136-sir richard end was very near , and [he]136-sir richard and [Hugh]132-hugh insisted upon the marriage ; [Edith]137-the lady edith begged for and obtained a month ’s respite , then another , and finally a third ; the marriage then took place by the death - bed of [Sir Richard]136-sir richard . It had not proved a happy one . It was whispered about [the country]1030-the country that shortly after the nuptials [the bride]2155-the bride found among [[her]2155-the bride husband]309-her husband ’s papers several rough and incomplete drafts of the fatal letter , and had accused [him]136-sir richard of precipitating the marriage -- and [Sir Richard]136-sir richard ’s death , too -- by a wicked forgery . Tales of cruelty to [the Lady Edith]137-the lady edith and [the servants]428-the servants were to be heard on all hands ; and since [the father]281-the father ’s death [Sir Hugh]132-hugh had thrown off all soft disguises and become [a pitiless master]2159-a pitiless master toward all who in any way depended upon [him]132-hugh and [[his]132-hugh domains]2160-his domains for bread . There was a bit of [Andrew]94-father andrew ’s gossip which [the King]294-the king listened to with a lively interest-- “ There is rumour that [the King]294-the king is mad . But in charity forbear to say _ [I]294-the king _ mentioned it , for ’ tis death to speak of it , [they]4375-they say . ”[294-the king] [[His]294-the king Majesty]3254-his majesty glared at [the old man]1756-the old man and said-- “ [The King]294-the king is _ not _ mad , [good man]4284-good man -- and [thou’lt]4378-thou’lt find it to [thy]3254-his majesty advantage to busy [thyself]3254-his majesty with matters that nearer concern [thee]3254-his majesty than this seditious prattle . ”[3254-his majesty] “ What doth [the lad]496-the lad mean ? ”[185-andrews] said [Andrews]185-andrews , surprised at this brisk assault from such an unexpected quarter . [Hendon]128-hendon gave [him]1756-the old man a sign , and [he]128-hendon did not pursue [his]128-hendon question , but went on with [his]128-hendon budget-- “ [The late King]1188-the late king is to be buried at [Windsor]63-windsor in a day or two -- the 16th of the month -- and [the new King]4381-the new king will be crowned at [Westminster]15-westminster the 20th . ”[128-hendon] “ Methinks [they]4382-they must needs find [him]1756-the old man first , ”[3254-his majesty] muttered [[his]128-hendon Majesty]3254-his majesty ; then added , confidently , “ but [they]4382-they will look to that -- and so also shall [I.]3254-his majesty ”[3254-his majesty] “ In the name of-- ”[1756-the old man] But [the old man]1756-the old man got no further -- a warning sign from [Hendon]128-hendon checked [his]1756-the old man remark . [He]128-hendon resumed the thread of [his]128-hendon gossip-- “ [Sir Hugh]132-hugh goeth to the coronation -- and with grand hopes . [He]132-hugh confidently looketh to come back [a peer]4383-a peer , for [he]132-hugh is high in favour with [the Lord Protector]186-the lord protector . ”[128-hendon] “ What [Lord Protector]186-the lord protector ? ”[3254-his majesty] asked [[his]128-hendon Majesty]3254-his majesty . “ [His]132-hugh Grace [the Duke of Somerset]187-the duke of somerset . ”[3254-his majesty] “ What [Duke of Somerset]187-the duke of somerset ? ”[128-hendon] “ Marry , there is but one -- [Seymour]146-tom , [Earl of [Hertford]107-hertford]4384-earl of hertford . ”[294-the king] [The King]294-the king asked sharply-- “ Since when is _ [he]146-tom _ [a duke]3892-a duke , and [Lord Protector]186-the lord protector ? ”[128-hendon] “ Since the last day of January . ”[128-hendon] “ And prithee who made [him]146-tom so ? ”[128-hendon] “ [Himself]146-tom and [the Great Council]4386-the great council -- with help of [the King]294-the king . ”[3254-his majesty] [[His]128-hendon Majesty]3254-his majesty started violently . “ [The _ King _]3187-the _ king _ ! ”[3254-his majesty] [he]3254-his majesty cried . “ _ What _ king , [good sir]3747-good sir ? ”[3254-his majesty] “ [What king]4390-what king , indeed ! ( God - a - mercy , what [aileth]4391-aileth [the boy]520-the boy ? ) Sith [we]4393-we have but one , ’ tis not difficult to answer -- [[his]146-tom most sacred Majesty [King Edward the Sixth]87-god -- whom [God]87-god preserve ! [Yea]4394-yea , and [a dear and gracious little urchin]4395-a dear and gracious little urchin is [he]146-tom , too]87-god ; and whether [he]146-tom be mad or no -- and [they]4396-they say [he]146-tom mendeth daily -- [his]146-tom praises are on [all men]4397-all men ’s lips ; and [all]654-all bless [him]146-tom , likewise , and offer prayers that [he]146-tom may be spared to reign long in [England]2-england ; for [he]146-tom began humanely with saving [the old Duke of [Norfolk]22-norfolk]122-the duke of norfolk ’s life , and now is [he]146-tom bent on destroying the cruellest of the laws that harry and oppress [the people]244-the people . ”[3254-his majesty] This news struck [[his]2169-he Majesty]3254-his majesty dumb with amazement , and plunged [him]3254-his majesty into so deep and dismal a reverie that [he]3254-his majesty heard no more of [the old man]1756-the old man ’s gossip . [He]2169-he wondered if [the ‘ little urchin ’]2172-the ‘ little urchin ’ was [the beggar - boy whom [he]2169-he left dressed in [his]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace own garments in [the palace]425-the palace]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace . It did not seem possible that this could be , for surely [his]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace manners and speech would betray [him]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace if [he]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace pretended to be [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales -- then [he]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace would be driven out , and search made for [the true prince]3154-the true prince . Could it be that [the Court]3339-the court had set up some sprig of [the nobility]3517-the nobility in [[his]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace place]2179-his place ?
