No , for [[his]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace uncle]2180-his uncle would not allow that -- [he]2173-the beggar - boy whom he left dressed in his own garments in the palace was all - powerful and could and would crush such a movement , of course . [The boy]520-the boy ’s musings profited [him]2169-he nothing ; the more [he]2169-he tried to unriddle the mystery the more perplexed [he]2169-he became , the more [his]2169-he head ached , and the worse [he]2169-he slept . [His]2169-he impatience to get to [London]1-london grew hourly , and [his]2169-he captivity became almost unendurable . [Hendon]128-hendon ’s arts all failed with [the King]294-the king -- [he]2169-he could not be comforted ; but [a couple of women who were chained near [him]2169-he]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him succeeded better . Under [their]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him gentle ministrations [he]2169-he found peace and learned a degree of patience . [He]2169-he was very grateful , and came to love [them]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him dearly and to delight in the sweet and soothing influence of [their]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him presence . [He]2169-he asked [them]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him why [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him were in [prison]2106-prison , and when [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him said [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him were [Baptists]2185-baptists , [he]2169-he smiled , and inquired-- “ Is that a crime to be shut up for in [a prison]4400-a prison ? Now [I]2169-he grieve , for [I]2169-he shall lose [ye]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him -- [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him will not keep [ye]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him long for such a little thing . ”[2169-he] [They]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him did not answer ; and something in [their]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him faces made [him]2169-he uneasy . [He]2169-he said , eagerly-- “ [You]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him do not speak ; be good to [me]2169-he , and tell [me]2169-he -- there will be no other punishment ? [Prithee]100-prithee tell [me]2169-he there is no fear of that . ”[2169-he] [They]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him tried to change the topic , but [his]2169-he fears were aroused , and [he]2169-he pursued it-- “ Will [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him scourge [thee]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him ? No , no , [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him would not be so cruel ! Say [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him would not . Come , [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him _ will _ not , will [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him ? ”[2186-the women] [The women]2186-the women betrayed confusion and distress , but there was no avoiding an answer , so [one of [them]2186-the women]681-one of them said , in a voice choked with emotion-- “ Oh , [thou’lt]4401-thou break [our]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him hearts , [thou]4401-thou gentle spirit!--God will help [us]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him to bear our-- ”[681-one of them] “ It is a confession ! ”[294-the king] [the King]294-the king broke in . “ Then [they]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him _ will _ scourge [thee]2183-a couple of women who were chained near him , [the stony - hearted wretches]4402-the stony - hearted wretches ! But oh , [thou]4401-thou must not weep , [I]294-the king can not bear it . Keep up [thy]4401-thou courage -- [I]294-the king shall come to [my]294-the king own in time to save [thee]4401-thou from this bitter thing , and [I]294-the king will do it ! ”[294-the king] When [the King]294-the king awoke in the morning , [the women]2186-the women were gone . “ [They]2186-the women are saved ! ”[294-the king] [he]294-the king said , joyfully ; then added , despondently , “ but woe is [me!--for]4403-me!--for [they]2186-the women were [[my]294-the king comforters]4404-my comforters . ”[294-the king] [Each of [them]2186-the women]2191-each of them had left a shred of ribbon pinned to [his]294-the king clothing , in token of remembrance . [He]294-the king said [he]294-the king would keep these things always ; and that soon [he]294-the king would seek out [these dear good friends of [his]294-the king]2192-these dear good friends of his and take [them]2192-these dear good friends of his under [his]294-the king protection . Just then [the jailer]2121-the jailer came in with [some subordinates]2194-some subordinates , and commanded that [the prisoners]1335-the prisoners be conducted to [the jail - yard]2196-the jail - yard . [The King]294-the king was overjoyed -- it would be a blessed thing to see the blue sky and breathe the fresh air once more . [He]294-the king fretted and chafed at the slowness of [the officers]2102-the officers , but [his]294-the king turn came at last , and [he]294-the king was released from [his]294-the king staple and ordered to follow [the other prisoners]2199-the other prisoners with [Hendon]128-hendon . [The court or quadrangle]2200-the court or quadrangle was stone - paved , and open to the sky . [The prisoners]1335-the prisoners entered [it]2200-the court or quadrangle through a massive archway of masonry , and were placed in file , standing , with [their]1335-the prisoners backs against the wall . A rope was stretched in front of [them]1335-the prisoners , and [they]1335-the prisoners were also guarded by [[their]1335-the prisoners officers]2202-their officers . It was a chill and lowering morning , and a light snow which had fallen during the night whitened [the great empty space]2203-the great empty space and added to the general dismalness of [its]2200-the court or quadrangle aspect . Now and then a wintry wind shivered through [the place]3615-the place and sent the snow eddying hither and thither . In [the centre of [the court]3339-the court]2205-the centre of the court stood [two women , chained to posts]2207-two women , chained to posts . A glance showed [the King]294-the king that these were [[his]294-the king good friends]2209-his good friends . [He]294-the king shuddered , and said to [himself]294-the king , “ [Alack]106-alack , [they]2207-two women , chained to posts are not gone free , as [I]294-the king had thought . To think that such as these should know the lash!--in [England]2-england ! Ay , there ’s the shame of it -- not in [Heathennesse]64-heathennesse , [Christian England]65-christian england ! [They]2207-two women , chained to posts will be scourged ; and [I]294-the king , whom [they]2207-two women , chained to posts have comforted and kindly entreated , must look on and see the great wrong done ; it is strange , so strange , that [I]294-the king , the very source of power in [this broad realm]4405-this broad realm , am helpless to protect [them]2207-two women , chained to posts . But let [these miscreants]4406-these miscreants look well to [themselves]4406-these miscreants , for there is a day coming when [I]294-the king will require of [them]4406-these miscreants a heavy reckoning for this work . For every blow [they]4406-these miscreants strike now , [they]4406-these miscreants shall feel a hundred then . ”[294-the king] A great gate swung open , and [a crowd of [citizens]2211-citizens]2210-a crowd of citizens poured in . [They]2210-a crowd of citizens flocked around [the two women]2212-the two women , and hid [them]2212-the two women from [the King]294-the king ’s view . [A clergyman]2214-a clergyman entered and passed through [the crowd]416-the crowd , and [he]2214-a clergyman also was hidden . [The King]294-the king now heard talking , back and forth , as if questions were being asked and answered , but [he]294-the king could not make out what was said . Next there was a deal of bustle and preparation , and much passing and repassing of [officials]2217-officials through [that part of [the crowd that stood on the further side of [the women]2186-the women]2219-the crowd that stood on the further side of the women]2218-that part of the crowd that stood on the further side of the women ; and whilst this proceeded a deep hush gradually fell upon [the people]244-the people . Now , by command , [the masses]2222-the masses parted and fell aside , and [the King]294-the king saw a spectacle that froze the marrow in [his]294-the king bones . Faggots had been piled about [the two women]2212-the two women , and [a kneeling man]2225-a kneeling man was lighting [them]2212-the two women ! [The women]2186-the women bowed [their]2186-the women heads , and covered [their]2186-the women faces with [their]2186-the women hands ; the yellow flames began to climb upward among the snapping and crackling faggots , and wreaths of blue smoke to stream away on the wind ; [the clergyman]2227-the clergyman lifted [his]2227-the clergyman hands and began a prayer -- just then [two young girls]2228-two young girls came flying through the great gate , uttering piercing screams , and threw [themselves]2228-two young girls upon [the women at the stake]2229-the women at the stake . Instantly [they]2228-two young girls were torn away by [the officers]2102-the officers , and one of [them]2228-two young girls was kept in a tight grip , but [the other]1645-the other broke loose , saying [she]1645-the other would die with [[her]1645-the other mother]3925-her mother ; and before [she]1645-the other could be stopped [she]1645-the other had flung [her]1645-the other arms about [[her]1645-the other mother]3925-her mother ’s neck again . [She]1645-the other was torn away once more , and with [her]1645-the other gown on fire . [Two or three men]2234-two or three men held [her]1645-the other , and the burning portion of [her]1645-the other gown was snatched off and thrown flaming aside , [she]1645-the other struggling all the while to free [herself]1645-the other , and saying [she]1645-the other would be alone in [the world]1021-the world , now ; and begging to be allowed to die with [[her]1645-the other mother]3925-her mother . [Both the girls]2237-both the girls screamed continually , and fought for freedom ; but suddenly this tumult was drowned under a volley of heart - piercing shrieks of mortal agony -- [the King]294-the king glanced from [the frantic girls]2239-the frantic girls to the stake , then turned away and leaned [his]294-the king ashen face against the wall , and looked no more . [He]294-the king said , “ That which [I]294-the king have seen , in that one little moment , will never go out from [my]294-the king memory , but will abide there ; and [I]294-the king shall see it all the days , and dream of it all the nights , till [I]294-the king die . Would [God]87-god [I]294-the king had been blind ! ”[294-the king] [Hendon]128-hendon was watching [the King]294-the king . [He]128-hendon said to [himself]128-hendon , with satisfaction , “ [His]294-the king disorder mendeth ; [he]294-the king hath changed , and groweth gentler . If [he]294-the king had followed [his]294-the king wo nt , [he]294-the king would have stormed at these varlets , and said [he]294-the king was [King]3155-king , and commanded that [the women]2186-the women be turned loose unscathed . Soon [his]294-the king delusion will pass away and be forgotten , and [his]294-the king poor mind will be whole again . [God]87-god speed the day ! ”[128-hendon] That same day [several prisoners]2241-several prisoners were brought in to remain over night , who were being conveyed , under guard , to various places in [the kingdom]2242-the kingdom , to undergo punishment for crimes committed . [The King]294-the king conversed with these -- [he]294-the king had made it a point , from the beginning , to instruct [himself]294-the king for the kingly office by questioning [prisoners]2244-prisoners whenever the opportunity offered -- and the tale of [their]2244-prisoners woes wrung [his]294-the king heart . [One of [them]2244-prisoners]681-one of them was [a poor half - witted woman who had stolen a yard or two of cloth from [a weaver]2247-a weaver]2246-a poor half - witted woman who had stolen a yard or two of cloth from a weaver -- [she]2246-a poor half - witted woman who had stolen a yard or two of cloth from a weaver was to be hanged for it . [Another]2248-another was [a man who had been accused of stealing a horse]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse ; [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse said the proof had failed , and [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse had imagined that [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse was safe from the halter ; but no -- [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse was hardly free before [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse was arraigned for killing a deer in [the King ’s park]2250-the king ’s park ; this was proved against [him]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse , and now [he]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse was on [his]2249-a man who had been accused of stealing a horse way to the gallows . There was [[a tradesman]2251-a tradesman ’s apprentice whose case particularly distressed [the King]294-the king]2252-a tradesman ’s apprentice whose case particularly distressed the king ; [this youth]2254-this youth said [he]2254-this youth found a hawk , one evening , that had escaped from its owner , and [he]2254-this youth took it [home]296-home with [him]2254-this youth , imagining [himself]2254-this youth entitled to it ; but [the court]3339-the court convicted [him]2254-this youth of stealing it , and sentenced [him]2254-this youth to death . [The King]294-the king was furious over these inhumanities , and wanted [Hendon]128-hendon to break [jail]2005-jail and fly with [him]128-hendon to [Westminster]15-westminster , so that [he]128-hendon could mount [his]128-hendon throne and hold out [his]128-hendon sceptre in mercy over [these unfortunate people]2259-these unfortunate people and save [their]2259-these unfortunate people lives . “ [Poor child]3366-poor child , ”[128-hendon] sighed [Hendon]128-hendon , “ these woeful tales have brought [his]3366-poor child malady upon [him]3366-poor child again ; alack , but for [this evil hap]4410-this evil hap , [he]3366-poor child would have been well in a little time . ”[128-hendon] Among [these prisoners]2260-these prisoners was [an old lawyer]2261-an old lawyer -- [a man with a strong face]2262-a man with a strong face and [a dauntless mien]2263-a dauntless mien . Three years past , [he]2261-an old lawyer had written a pamphlet against [the Lord Chancellor]682-the lord chancellor , accusing [him]682-the lord chancellor of injustice , and had been punished for it by the loss of [his]2261-an old lawyer ears in the pillory , and degradation from the bar , and in addition had been fined 3,000 pounds and sentenced to imprisonment for life . Lately [he]2261-an old lawyer had repeated [his]2261-an old lawyer offence ; and in consequence was now under sentence to lose _ what remained of [his]2261-an old lawyer ears _ , pay a fine of 5,000 pounds , be branded on both cheeks , and remain in [prison]2106-prison for life . “ These be honourable scars , ”[2261-an old lawyer] [he]2261-an old lawyer said , and turned back [his]2261-an old lawyer grey hair and showed the mutilated stubs of what had once been [his]2261-an old lawyer ears . [The King]294-the king ’s eye burned with passion . [He]294-the king said-- “ [None]3179-none believe in [me]294-the king -- neither wilt [thou]4412-thou . But no matter -- within the compass of a month [thou]4412-thou shalt be free ; and more , the laws that have dishonoured [thee]4412-thou , and shamed the English name , shall be swept from the statute books . [The world]1021-the world is made wrong ; [kings]4414-kings should go to school to [their]4414-kings own laws , at times , and so learn mercy . ”[294-the king] { 1 } CHAPTER XXVIII . The sacrifice . [Meantime Miles]128-hendon was growing sufficiently tired of confinement and inaction . But now [his]2261-an old lawyer trial came on , to [his]2261-an old lawyer great gratification , and [he]2261-an old lawyer thought [he]2261-an old lawyer could welcome any sentence provided a further imprisonment should not be a part of it . But [he]2261-an old lawyer was mistaken about that . [He]2261-an old lawyer was in a fine fury when [he]2261-an old lawyer found [himself]2261-an old lawyer described as [a ‘ sturdy vagabond ’]2267-a ‘ sturdy vagabond ’ and sentenced to sit two hours in the stocks for bearing that character and for assaulting [the master of [Hendon Hall]41-hendon hall]2268-the master of hendon hall . [His]2261-an old lawyer pretensions as to brothership with [[his]2261-an old lawyer prosecutor]2269-his prosecutor , and rightful heirship to the [Hendon]128-hendon honours and estates , were left contemptuously unnoticed , as being not even worth examination . [He]2261-an old lawyer raged and threatened on [his]2261-an old lawyer way to punishment , but it did no good ; [he]2261-an old lawyer was snatched roughly along by [the officers]2102-the officers , and got an occasional cuff , besides , for [his]2261-an old lawyer irreverent conduct . [The King]294-the king could not pierce through the rabble that swarmed behind ; so [he]294-the king was obliged to follow in the rear , remote from [[his]294-the king good friend]2272-his good friend and servant . [The King]294-the king had been nearly condemned to [the stocks]2274-the stocks [himself]294-the king for being in such bad company , but had been let off with a lecture and a warning , in consideration of [his]294-the king youth . When [the crowd]416-the crowd at last halted , [he]294-the king flitted feverishly from point to point around its outer rim , hunting a place to get through ; and at last , after a deal of difficulty and delay , succeeded . There sat [[his]294-the king poor henchman]2276-his poor henchman in the degrading stocks , the sport and butt of [a dirty mob]2277-a dirty mob -- [he]2276-his poor henchman , [the body servant of [the King of [England]2-england]4051-the king of england]2278-the body servant of the king of england ! [Edward]87-god had heard the sentence pronounced , but [he]87-god had not realised the half that it meant . [His]87-god anger began to rise as the sense of this new indignity which had been put upon [him]87-god sank [home]296-home ; it jumped to summer heat , the next moment , when [he]87-god saw an egg sail through the air and crush itself against [Hendon]128-hendon ’s cheek , and heard [the crowd]416-the crowd roar its enjoyment of the episode . [He]87-god sprang across the open circle and confronted [the officer in charge]2282-the officer in charge , crying-- “ For shame ! This is [[my]87-god servant]3897-my servant -- set [him]3897-my servant free ! [I]87-god am the-- ”[87-god] “ Oh , peace ! ”[128-hendon] exclaimed [Hendon]128-hendon , in a panic , “ [thou’lt]4416-thou’lt destroy [thyself]3897-my servant . Mind [him]3897-my servant not , [officer]4417-officer , [he]3897-my servant is mad . ”[128-hendon] “ Give [thyself]3897-my servant no trouble as to the matter of minding [him]3897-my servant , [good man]4284-good man , [I]87-god have small mind to mind [him]3897-my servant ; but as to teaching [him]3897-my servant somewhat , to that [I]87-god am well inclined . ”[87-god] [He]87-god turned to [a subordinate]2283-a subordinate and said , “ Give [the little fool]4419-the little fool a taste or two of the lash , to mend [his]3897-my servant manners . ”[87-god] “ [Half a dozen]4420-half a dozen will better serve [his]3897-my servant turn , ”[132-hugh] suggested [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , who had ridden up , a moment before , to take a passing glance at the proceedings . [The King]294-the king was seized . [He]294-the king did not even struggle , so paralysed was [he]294-the king with the mere thought of the monstrous outrage that was proposed to be inflicted upon [[his]294-the king sacred person]3612-his sacred person . History was already defiled with the record of the scourging of [an English king with whips]2286-an english king with whips -- it was an intolerable reflection that [he]294-the king must furnish a duplicate of that shameful page . [He]294-the king was in the toils , there was no help for [him]294-the king ; [he]294-the king must either take this punishment or beg for its remission . Hard conditions ; [he]294-the king would take the stripes -- [a king]390-a king might do that , but [a king]390-a king could not beg . But meantime , [Miles Hendon]128-hendon was resolving the difficulty . “ Let [the child]3829-the child go , ”[128-hendon] said [he]128-hendon ; “ [ye]4422-ye heartless dogs , do [ye]4422-ye not see how young and frail [he]3829-the child is ? Let [him]3829-the child go -- [I]128-hendon will take [his]3829-the child lashes . ”[128-hendon] “ Marry , a good thought -- and thanks for it , ”[132-hugh] said [Sir Hugh]132-hugh , [his]132-hugh face lighting with a sardonic satisfaction . “ Let [the little beggar]3476-the little beggar go , and give [this fellow]4424-this fellow a dozen in [his]4424-this fellow place -- [an honest dozen]4425-an honest dozen , well laid on . ”[132-hugh] [The King]294-the king was in the act of entering a fierce protest , but [Sir Hugh]132-hugh silenced [him]294-the king with the potent remark , “ Yes , speak up , do , and free [thy]294-the king mind -- only , mark [ye]294-the king , that for each word [you]294-the king utter [he]4424-this fellow shall get six strokes the more . ”[132-hugh] [Hendon]128-hendon was removed from [the stocks]2274-the stocks , and [his]128-hendon back laid bare ; and whilst the lash was applied [the poor little King]1755-the poor little king turned away [his]1755-the poor little king face and allowed unroyal tears to channel [his]1755-the poor little king cheeks unchecked . “ Ah , brave good heart , ”[1755-the poor little king] [he]1755-the poor little king said to [himself]1755-the poor little king , “ this loyal deed shall never perish out of [my]1755-the poor little king memory . [I]1755-the poor little king will not forget it -- and neither shall _ [they]4426-they _ ! ”[1755-the poor little king] [he]1755-the poor little king added , with passion . Whilst [he]1755-the poor little king mused , [his]1755-the poor little king appreciation of [Hendon]128-hendon ’s magnanimous conduct grew to greater and still greater dimensions in [his]1755-the poor little king mind , and so also did [his]1755-the poor little king gratefulness for it . Presently [he]1755-the poor little king said to [himself]1755-the poor little king , “ Who saves [[his]128-hendon prince]4427-his prince from wounds and possible death -- and this [he]128-hendon did for [me]1755-the poor little king -- performs high service ; but it is little -- it is nothing -- oh , less than nothing!--when ’ tis weighed against the act of [him]128-hendon who saves [[his]128-hendon prince]4427-his prince from _ shame _ ! ”[1755-the poor little king] [Hendon]128-hendon made no outcry under the scourge , but bore the heavy blows with soldierly fortitude . This , together with [his]128-hendon redeeming [the boy]520-the boy by taking [his]128-hendon stripes for [him]128-hendon , compelled the respect of [even that forlorn and degraded mob that was gathered [there]3216-there]2293-even that forlorn and degraded mob that was gathered there ; and its gibes and hootings died away , and no sound remained but the sound of the falling blows . The stillness that pervaded [the place]3615-the place , when [Hendon]128-hendon found [himself]128-hendon once more in [the stocks]2274-the stocks , was in strong contrast with the insulting clamour which had prevailed there so little a while before . [The King]294-the king came softly to [Hendon]128-hendon ’s side , and whispered in [his]128-hendon ear-- “ [Kings]4414-kings can not ennoble [thee]128-hendon , [thou]128-hendon good , great soul , for One who is higher than [kings]4414-kings hath done that for [thee]128-hendon ; but [a king]390-a king can confirm [thy]128-hendon nobility to [men]649-men . ”[294-the king] [He]294-the king picked up the scourge from the ground , touched [Hendon]128-hendon ’s bleeding shoulders lightly with it , and whispered , “ [Edward]87-god of [England]2-england dubs [thee]128-hendon [Earl]159-ken ! ”[294-the king] [Hendon]128-hendon was touched . The water welled to [his]128-hendon eyes , yet at the same time the grisly humour of the situation and circumstances so undermined [his]128-hendon gravity that it was all [he]128-hendon could do to keep some sign of [his]128-hendon inward mirth from showing outside . To be suddenly hoisted , naked and gory , from [the common stocks]2298-the common stocks to [the Alpine altitude]66-the alpine altitude and splendour of an Earldom , seemed to [him]128-hendon the last possibility in the line of the grotesque . [He]128-hendon said to [himself]128-hendon , “ Now am [I]128-hendon finely tinselled , indeed ! [The spectre - knight of the Kingdom of Dreams and Shadows]4433-the spectre - knight of the kingdom of dreams and shadows is become [a spectre - earl]4434-a spectre - earl -- a dizzy flight for a callow wing ! An ’ this go on , [I]128-hendon shall presently be hung like [a very maypole with fantastic gauds and make - believe honours]4435-a very maypole with fantastic gauds and make - believe honours . But [I]128-hendon shall value them , all valueless as [they]4436-they are , for the love that doth bestow [them]4436-they . Better [these poor mock dignities of mine , that come unasked , from a clean hand and a right spirit]4437-these poor mock dignities of mine , that come unasked , from a clean hand and a right spirit , than [real ones bought by servility from grudging and interested power]4438-real ones bought by servility from grudging and interested power . ”[128-hendon] [The dreaded Sir Hugh]132-hugh wheeled [his]132-hugh horse about , and as [he]132-hugh spurred away , the living wall divided silently to let [him]132-hugh pass , and as silently closed together again . And so remained ; [nobody]650-nobody went so far as to venture a remark in favour of [the prisoner]1342-the prisoner , or in compliment to [him]1342-the prisoner ; but no matter -- the absence of abuse was a sufficient homage in itself . [A late comer who was not posted as to the present circumstances]2301-a late comer who was not posted as to the present circumstances , and who delivered a sneer at [the ‘ impostor , ’]2302-the ‘ impostor , ’ and was in the act of following it with a dead cat , was promptly knocked down and kicked out , without any words , and then the deep quiet resumed sway once more . CHAPTER XXIX . To [London]1-london . When [Hendon]128-hendon ’s term of service in the stocks was finished , [he]128-hendon was released and ordered to quit [the region]352-the region and come back no more . [His]128-hendon sword was restored to [him]128-hendon , and also [his]128-hendon mule and [his]128-hendon donkey . [He]128-hendon mounted and rode off , followed by [the King]294-the king , [the crowd]416-the crowd opening with quiet respectfulness to let [them]416-the crowd pass , and then dispersing when [they]416-the crowd were gone . [Hendon]128-hendon was soon absorbed in thought . There were questions of high import to be answered . What should [he]128-hendon do ? [Whither]188-whither should [he]128-hendon go ? [Powerful help]2306-powerful help must be found somewhere , or [he]128-hendon must relinquish [his]128-hendon inheritance and remain under the imputation of being [an impostor besides]2307-an impostor besides . Where could [he]128-hendon hope to find this powerful help ? Where , indeed ! It was a knotty question . By - and - by a thought occurred to [him]128-hendon which pointed to a possibility -- the slenderest of slender possibilities , certainly , but still worth considering , for lack of any other that promised anything at all . [He]128-hendon remembered what [old Andrews]185-andrews had said about [the young King]2308-the young king ’s goodness and [his]185-andrews generous championship of [the wronged and unfortunate]2309-the wronged and unfortunate . Why not go and try to get speech of [him]185-andrews and beg for justice ? Ah , yes , but could so fantastic [a pauper]3411-a pauper get admission to the august presence of [a monarch]2311-a monarch ? Never mind -- let that matter take care of itself ; it was a bridge that would not need to be crossed till [he]128-hendon should come to [it]2312-it . [He]128-hendon was [an old campaigner]2313-an old campaigner , and used to inventing shifts and expedients : no doubt [he]128-hendon would be able to find a way . Yes , [he]128-hendon would strike for [the capital]2314-the capital . Maybe [[[his]128-hendon father]306-his father ’s old friend Sir [Humphrey Marlow]147-humphrey]2316-his father ’s old friend sir humphrey marlow would help [him--‘good]2317-him--‘good old Sir [Humphrey]147-humphrey , [Head Lieutenant of [[the late King]1188-the late king ’s kitchen]2320-the late king ’s kitchen]2318-head lieutenant of the late king ’s kitchen , or [stables]2321-stables , or something’--Miles could not remember just what or which . Now that [he]128-hendon had something to turn [his]128-hendon energies to , a distinctly defined object to accomplish , the fog of humiliation and depression which had settled down upon [his]128-hendon spirits lifted and blew away , and [he]128-hendon raised [his]128-hendon head and looked about [him]128-hendon . [He]128-hendon was surprised to see how far [he]128-hendon had come ; [the village]3790-the village was away behind [him]128-hendon . [The King]294-the king was jogging along in [his]128-hendon wake , with [his]294-the king head bowed ; for [he]294-the king , too , was deep in plans and thinkings . A sorrowful misgiving clouded [Hendon]128-hendon ’s new - born cheerfulness : would [the boy]520-the boy be willing to go again to [a city where , during all [his]520-the boy brief life , [he]520-the boy had never known anything but ill - usage and pinching want]2325-a city where , during all his brief life , he had never known anything but ill - usage and pinching want ? But the question must be asked ; it could not be avoided ; so [Hendon]128-hendon reined up , and called out-- “ [I]128-hendon had forgotten to inquire whither [we]2326-them are bound . [Thy]128-hendon commands , [[my]128-hendon liege]3243-my liege ! ”[128-hendon] “ To [London]1-london ! ”[128-hendon] [Hendon]128-hendon moved on again , mightily contented with the answer -- but astounded at it too . The whole journey was made without an adventure of importance . But it ended with one . About ten o’clock on the night of the 19th of February [they]2326-them stepped upon [London Bridge]4-london bridge , in the midst of a writhing , struggling jam of [howling and hurrahing people , whose beer - jolly faces stood out strongly in the glare from manifold torches]2327-howling and hurrahing people , whose beer - jolly faces stood out strongly in the glare from manifold torches -- and at that instant the decaying head of [some former duke or other grandee]2328-some former duke or other grandee tumbled down between [them]2326-them , striking [Hendon]128-hendon on the elbow and then bounding off among the hurrying confusion of feet . So evanescent and unstable are [men]649-men ’s works in this world!--the late good King is but three weeks dead and three days in [his]520-the boy grave , and already the adornments which [he]520-the boy took such pains to select from [prominent people for [[his]520-the boy noble bridge]2331-his noble bridge]2330-prominent people for his noble bridge are falling . [A citizen]2332-a citizen stumbled over that head , and drove [his]2332-a citizen own head into the back of somebody in front of [him]2332-a citizen , who turned and knocked down [the first person that came handy]2333-the first person that came handy , and was promptly laid out [himself]2332-a citizen by [[that person]2334-that person ’s friend]2335-that person ’s friend . It was the right ripe time for a free fight , for the festivities of the morrow -- Coronation Day -- were already beginning ; [everybody]247-everybody was full of strong drink and patriotism ; within five minutes the free fight was occupying a good deal of ground ; within ten or twelve it covered an acre of so , and was become a riot . By this time [Hendon]128-hendon and [the King]294-the king were hopelessly separated from each other and lost in the rush and turmoil of [the roaring masses of humanity]2338-the roaring masses of humanity . And so [we]2339-we leave [them]2326-them . CHAPTER XXX . [Tom]146-tom ’s progress . Whilst [the true King]2340-the true king wandered about [the land]3332-the land poorly clad , poorly fed , cuffed and derided by [tramps]2342-tramps one while , herding with [thieves]291-thieves and [murderers]2344-murderers in [a jail]2118-a jail another , and called [idiot and impostor]2346-idiot and impostor by all impartially , [the mock King Tom Canty]90-tom enjoyed quite a different experience . When [we]2339-we saw [him]90-tom last , [royalty]436-royalty was just beginning to have a bright side for [him]90-tom . This bright side went on brightening more and more every day : in a very little while it was become almost all sunshine and delightfulness . [He]90-tom lost [his]90-tom fears ; [his]90-tom misgivings faded out and died ; [his]90-tom embarrassments departed , and gave place to an easy and confident bearing . [He]90-tom worked [the whipping - boy]1252-the whipping - boy mine to ever - increasing profit . [He]90-tom ordered [[my]0-my Lady [Elizabeth]91-the lady elizabeth]2349-my lady elizabeth and [[my]0-my Lady]2350-my lady [Jane Grey]97-the lady jane grey into [his]90-tom presence when [he]90-tom wanted to play or talk , and dismissed [them]2351-them when [he]90-tom was done with [them]2351-them , with the air of [one familiarly accustomed to such performances]2352-one familiarly accustomed to such performances . It no longer confused [him]90-tom to have [these lofty personages]2353-these lofty personages kiss [his]90-tom hand at parting . [He]90-tom came to enjoy being conducted to bed in state at night , and dressed with intricate and solemn ceremony in the morning . It came to be a proud pleasure to march to dinner attended by a glittering procession of [officers of state]2354-officers of state and [gentlemen - at - arms]2355-gentlemen - at - arms ; insomuch , indeed , that [he]90-tom doubled [his]90-tom guard of [gentlemen - at - arms]2355-gentlemen - at - arms , and made [them]2357-them a hundred . [He]90-tom liked to hear the bugles sounding down [the long corridors]2358-the long corridors , and the distant voices responding , “ Way for [the King]294-the king ! ”[90-tom] [He]90-tom even learned to enjoy sitting in throned state in council , and seeming to be something more than [the Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector ’s mouthpiece . [He]90-tom liked to receive [great ambassadors]2360-great ambassadors and [their]2360-great ambassadors gorgeous trains , and listen to the affectionate messages [they]2360-great ambassadors brought from [illustrious monarchs who called [him]90-tom [brother]4261-brother]2361-illustrious monarchs who called him brother . O happy [Tom Canty]90-tom , [late of Offal Court]2363-late of offal court ! [He]90-tom enjoyed [his]90-tom splendid clothes , and ordered more : [he]90-tom found [[his]90-tom four hundred servants]2364-his four hundred servants too few for [his]90-tom proper grandeur , and trebled [them]2364-his four hundred servants . The adulation of [salaaming courtiers]2365-salaaming courtiers came to be sweet music to [his]90-tom ears . [He]90-tom remained kind and gentle , and [a sturdy and determined champion of all that were oppressed]2366-a sturdy and determined champion of all that were oppressed , and [he]90-tom made tireless war upon unjust laws : yet upon occasion , being offended , [he]90-tom could turn upon [an earl]3538-an earl , or even [a duke]3892-a duke , and give [him]90-tom a look that would make [him]90-tom tremble . Once , when [[his]90-tom royal ‘ sister]2369-his royal ‘ sister , ’ [the grimly holy Lady Mary]98-the lady mary , set [herself]2369-his royal ‘ sister to reason with [him]90-tom against the wisdom of [his]90-tom course in pardoning [so many people who would otherwise be jailed , or hanged , or burned]2370-so many people who would otherwise be jailed , or hanged , or burned , and reminded [him]90-tom that [[[their]2371-their august late father]2372-their august late father ’s prisons]2373-their august late father ’s prisons had sometimes contained as high as [sixty thousand convicts]2374-sixty thousand convicts at one time , and that during [his]90-tom admirable reign [he]90-tom had delivered [seventy - two thousand thieves]2375-seventy - two thousand thieves and [robbers]2376-robbers over to death by [the executioner]2377-the executioner , { 9 } [the boy]520-the boy was filled with generous indignation , and commanded [her]2369-his royal ‘ sister to go to [[her]2369-his royal ‘ sister closet]2379-her closet , and beseech [God]87-god to take away the stone that was in [her]2369-his royal ‘ sister breast , and give [her]2369-his royal ‘ sister a human heart . Did [Tom Canty]90-tom never feel troubled about [the poor little rightful prince who had treated [him]90-tom so kindly , and flown out with such hot zeal to avenge [him]90-tom upon [the insolent sentinel at [the palace]425-the palace - gate]2381-the insolent sentinel at the palace - gate]2380-the poor little rightful prince who had treated him so kindly , and flown out with such hot zeal to avenge him upon the insolent sentinel at the palace - gate ? Yes ; [his]90-tom first royal days and nights were pretty well sprinkled with painful thoughts about [the lost prince]2383-the lost prince , and with sincere longings for [his]90-tom return , and happy restoration to [his]90-tom native rights and splendours . But as time wore on , and [the prince]236-the prince did not come , [Tom]90-tom ’s mind became more and more occupied with [his]90-tom new and enchanting experiences , and by little and little [the vanished monarch]2385-the vanished monarch faded almost out of [his]90-tom thoughts ; and finally , when [he]90-tom did intrude upon [them]2386-them at intervals , [he]90-tom was become [an unwelcome spectre]2387-an unwelcome spectre , for [he]90-tom made [Tom]90-tom feel guilty and ashamed . [[Tom]90-tom ’s poor mother]2388-tom ’s poor mother and [sisters]796-sisters travelled [the same road]2390-the same road out of [his]90-tom mind . At first [he]90-tom pined for [them]2386-them , sorrowed for [them]2386-them , longed to see [them]2386-them , but later , the thought of [their]2386-them coming some day in [their]2386-them rags and dirt , and betraying [him]90-tom with [their]2386-them kisses , and pulling [him]90-tom down from [his]90-tom lofty place , and dragging [him]90-tom back to penury and degradation and [the slums]2391-the slums , made [him]90-tom shudder . At last [they]2386-them ceased to trouble [his]90-tom thoughts almost wholly . And [he]90-tom was content , even glad : for , whenever [their]2386-them mournful and accusing faces did rise before [him]90-tom now , [they]2386-them made [him]90-tom feel more despicable than the worms that crawl . At midnight of the 19th of February , [Tom Canty]90-tom was sinking to sleep in [his]90-tom rich bed in [the palace]425-the palace , guarded by [[his]90-tom loyal vassals]2393-his loyal vassals , and surrounded by [the pomps of royalty]2394-the pomps of royalty , [a happy boy]2395-a happy boy ; for tomorrow was the day appointed for [his]90-tom solemn crowning as [King of [England]2-england]3460-king of england . At that same hour , [Edward]87-god , [the true king , hungry and thirsty , soiled and draggled , worn with travel , and clothed in rags and shreds]2397-the true king , hungry and thirsty , soiled and draggled , worn with travel , and clothed in rags and shreds -- [his]87-god share of the results of the riot -- was wedged in among [a crowd of people who were watching with deep interest]2398-a crowd of people who were watching with deep interest certain [hurrying gangs of workmen who streamed in and out of [Westminster Abbey]67-westminster abbey]2399-hurrying gangs of workmen who streamed in and out of westminster abbey , busy as ants : [they]2399-hurrying gangs of workmen who streamed in and out of westminster abbey were making the last preparation for the royal coronation . CHAPTER XXXI . The Recognition procession . When [Tom Canty]90-tom awoke the next morning , the air was heavy with a thunderous murmur : all the distances were charged with it . It was music to [him]90-tom ; for it meant that [the English world]2400-the english world was out in [its]2400-the english world strength to give loyal welcome to the great day . Presently [Tom]90-tom found [himself]90-tom once more [the chief figure in [a wonderful floating pageant on [the Thames]7-the thames]2402-a wonderful floating pageant on the thames]2401-the chief figure in a wonderful floating pageant on the thames ; for by ancient custom the ‘ recognition procession ’ through [London]1-london must start from [the Tower]19-the tower , and [he]90-tom was bound thither . When [he]90-tom arrived [there]3216-there , [the sides of [the venerable fortress]2405-the venerable fortress]2404-the sides of the venerable fortress seemed suddenly rent in a thousand places , and from every rent leaped a red tongue of flame and a white gush of smoke ; a deafening explosion followed , which drowned the shoutings of [the multitude]960-the multitude , and made the ground tremble ; the flame - jets , the smoke , and the explosions , were repeated over and over again with marvellous celerity , so that in a few moments [the old Tower]2407-the old tower disappeared in the vast fog of its own smoke , all but the very top of the tall pile called [the White Tower]2408-the white tower ; this , with [its]2407-the old tower banners , stood out above the dense bank of vapour as [a mountain - peak projects above a cloud - rack]2409-a mountain - peak projects above a cloud - rack . [Tom Canty]90-tom , splendidly arrayed , mounted a prancing war - steed , whose rich trappings almost reached to the ground ; [[his]90-tom ‘ uncle]578-his ‘ uncle , ’ [the Lord Protector Somerset]186-the lord protector , similarly mounted , took place in [his]90-tom rear ; [the King]294-the king ’s Guard formed in single ranks on either side , clad in burnished armour ; after [the Protector]2412-the protector followed a seemingly interminable procession of [resplendent nobles]2413-resplendent nobles attended by [[their]2413-resplendent nobles vassals]2414-their vassals ; after these came [the lord mayor]597-the lord mayor and [the aldermanic body]2416-the aldermanic body , in crimson velvet robes , and with [their]2413-resplendent nobles gold chains across [their]2413-resplendent nobles breasts ; and after these [the officers and members of [all the guilds of [London]1-london]2418-all the guilds of london]2417-the officers and members of all the guilds of london , in rich raiment , and bearing the showy banners of [the several corporations]2419-the several corporations . Also in the procession , as a special guard of honour through [the city]370-the city , was [the Ancient and Honourable Artillery Company]2421-the ancient and honourable artillery company -- [an organisation already three hundred years old at that time]2422-an organisation already three hundred years old at that time , and [the only military body in [England]2-england possessing the privilege ( which [it]2421-the ancient and honourable artillery company still possesses in [our]2424-our day ) of holding [itself]2421-the ancient and honourable artillery company [independent of the commands of Parliament]2425-independent of the commands of parliament]2423-the only military body in england possessing the privilege ( which it still possesses in our day ) of holding itself independent of the commands of parliament . It was a brilliant spectacle , and was hailed with acclamations all along the line , as it took its stately way through [the packed multitudes of [citizens]2211-citizens]2426-the packed multitudes of citizens . [The chronicler]1396-the chronicler says , ‘ [The King]294-the king , as [he]294-the king entered [the city]370-the city , was received by [the people]244-the people with prayers , welcomings , cries , and tender words , and all signs which argue an earnest love of subjects toward [[their]244-the people sovereign]2432-their sovereign ; and [the King]294-the king , by holding up [his]294-the king glad countenance to such as stood afar off , and most tender language to those that stood nigh [his]294-the king Grace , showed [himself]294-the king no less thankful to receive [the people]244-the people ’s goodwill than [they]244-the people to offer it . To all that wished [him]294-the king well , [he]294-the king gave thanks . To such as bade “ God save [his]294-the king Grace , ”[294-the king] [he]294-the king said in return , “ [God]87-god save [you]244-the people all ! ”[294-the king] and added that “ [he]294-the king thanked [them]244-the people with all [his]294-the king heart . ”[294-the king] Wonderfully transported were [the people with the loving answers and gestures]2435-the people with the loving answers and gestures of [[their]2435-the people with the loving answers and gestures King]2436-their king . ’ In [Fenchurch Street]68-fenchurch street a ‘ [fair child]2437-fair child , in costly apparel , ’ stood on a stage to welcome [[his]2437-fair child Majesty]3254-his majesty to [the city]370-the city . The last verse of [his]2437-fair child greeting was in these words-- ‘ Welcome , [O King]2440-o king ! as much as hearts can think ; Welcome , again , as much as tongue can tell,--Welcome to joyous tongues , and hearts that will not shrink : God [thee]2441-thee preserve , [we]2442-we pray , and wish [thee]2441-thee ever well . ’ [The people]244-the people burst forth in a glad shout , repeating with one voice what [the child]3829-the child had said . [Tom Canty]90-tom gazed abroad over the surging sea of eager faces , and [his]90-tom heart swelled with exultation ; and [he]90-tom felt that the one thing worth living for in [this world]1024-this world was to be [a king]390-a king , and [a nation ’s idol]2447-a nation ’s idol . Presently [he]90-tom caught sight , at a distance , of [a couple of [[his]90-tom ragged Offal Court comrades]2449-his ragged offal court comrades]2448-a couple of his ragged offal court comrades -- one of [them]2448-a couple of his ragged offal court comrades [the lord high admiral in [[his]2450-the lord high admiral in his late mimic court late mimic court]2451-his late mimic court]2450-the lord high admiral in his late mimic court , [the other]1645-the other [the first lord of the bedchamber]1153-the first lord of the bedchamber in the same pretentious fiction ; and [his]90-tom pride swelled higher than ever . Oh , if [they]2448-a couple of his ragged offal court comrades could only recognise [him]90-tom now ! What unspeakable glory it would be , if [they]2448-a couple of his ragged offal court comrades could recognise [him]90-tom , and realise that [the derided mock king of [the slums]2391-the slums and [back alleys]2456-back alleys]2454-the derided mock king of the slums and back alleys was become [a real King]2457-a real king , with [illustrious dukes]2458-illustrious dukes and [princes]314-princes for [[his]90-tom humble menials]2460-his humble menials , and [the English world at [his]90-tom feet]2461-the english world at his feet ! But [he]90-tom had to deny [himself]90-tom , and choke down [his]90-tom desire , for such a recognition might cost more than it would come to : so [he]90-tom turned away [his]90-tom head , and left [the two soiled lads]2462-the two soiled lads to go on with [their]2462-the two soiled lads shoutings and glad adulations , unsuspicious of whom it was [they]2462-the two soiled lads were lavishing [them]2462-the two soiled lads upon . Every now and then rose the cry , “ A largess ! a largess ! ”[90-tom] and [Tom]90-tom responded by scattering a handful of bright new coins abroad for [the multitude]960-the multitude to scramble for . [The chronicler]1396-the chronicler says , ‘ At the upper end of [Gracechurch Street]69-gracechurch street , before the sign of the Eagle , [the city]370-the city had erected a gorgeous arch , beneath which was a stage , which stretched from one side of [the street]853-the street to the other . This was an historical pageant , representing [[the King]294-the king ’s immediate progenitors]2468-the king ’s immediate progenitors . There sat [Elizabeth of York]189-elizabeth of york in the midst of an immense white rose , whose petals formed elaborate furbelows around [her]189-elizabeth of york ; by [her]189-elizabeth of york side was [Henry VII]190-henry vii . , issuing out of a vast red rose , disposed in the same manner : the hands of [the royal pair]2469-the royal pair were locked together , and the wedding - ring ostentatiously displayed . From the red and white roses proceeded a stem , which reached up to a second stage , occupied by [Henry VIII]105-henry viii . , issuing from a red and white rose , with the effigy of [[the new King]4381-the new king ’s mother]2471-the new king ’s mother , [Jane Seymour]191-jane seymour , represented by [his]294-the king side . One branch sprang from this pair , which mounted to a third stage , where sat the effigy of [Edward VI]192-edward vi . [himself]192-edward vi , enthroned in royal majesty ; and the whole pageant was framed with wreaths of roses , red and white . ’ This quaint and gaudy spectacle so wrought upon [the rejoicing people]2472-the rejoicing people , that [their]2472-the rejoicing people acclamations utterly smothered the small voice of [the child whose business it was to explain the thing in eulogistic rhymes]2473-the child whose business it was to explain the thing in eulogistic rhymes . But [Tom Canty]90-tom was not sorry ; for this loyal uproar was sweeter music to [him]90-tom than any poetry , no matter what its quality might be . [Whithersoever Tom]193-whithersoever tom turned [his]90-tom happy young face , [the people]244-the people recognised the exactness of [his]90-tom effigy ’s likeness to [himself]90-tom , [the flesh and blood counterpart]2475-the flesh and blood counterpart ; and new whirlwinds of applause burst forth . The great pageant moved on , and still on , under one triumphal arch after another , and past a bewildering succession of spectacular and symbolical tableaux , each of which typified and exalted some virtue , or talent , or merit , of [the little King]1042-the little king ’s . ‘ Throughout [the whole of [Cheapside]8-cheapside]2477-the whole of cheapside , from [every penthouse]2478-every penthouse and window , hung banners and streamers ; and the richest carpets , stuffs , and cloth - of - gold tapestried [the streets]261-the streets -- specimens of the great wealth of the stores within ; and the splendour of [this thoroughfare]2480-this thoroughfare was equalled in [the other streets]2481-the other streets , and in some even surpassed . ’ “ And all these wonders and these marvels are to welcome [me]90-tom -- [me]90-tom ! ”[90-tom] murmured [Tom Canty]90-tom . [The mock King]2482-the mock king ’s cheeks were flushed with excitement , [his]90-tom eyes were flashing , [his]90-tom senses swam in a delirium of pleasure . At this point , just as [he]90-tom was raising [his]90-tom hand to fling another rich largess , [he]90-tom caught sight of a pale , astounded face , which was strained forward out of the second rank of [the crowd]416-the crowd , its intense eyes riveted upon [him]90-tom . A sickening consternation struck through [him]90-tom ; [he]90-tom recognised [[his]90-tom mother]287-his mother ! and up flew [his]90-tom hand , palm outward , before [his]90-tom eyes -- that old involuntary gesture , born of a forgotten episode , and perpetuated by habit . In an instant more [she]287-his mother had torn [her]287-his mother way out of the press , and past [the guards]2485-the guards , and was at [his]90-tom side . [She]287-his mother embraced [his]90-tom leg , [she]287-his mother covered it with kisses , [she]287-his mother cried , “ O [[my]287-his mother child]3390-my child , [[my]287-his mother darling]4442-my darling ! ”[287-his mother] lifting toward [him]90-tom a face that was transfigured with joy and love . The same instant [an officer of [the King ’s Guard]2487-the king ’s guard]2486-an officer of the king ’s guard snatched [her]287-his mother away with a curse , and sent [her]287-his mother reeling back whence [she]287-his mother came with a vigorous impulse from [his]90-tom strong arm . The words “ [I]2486-an officer of the king ’s guard do not know [you]287-his mother , [woman]4443-woman ! ”[2486-an officer of the king ’s guard] were falling from [Tom Canty]90-tom ’s lips when this piteous thing occurred ; but it smote [him]90-tom to the heart to see [her]287-his mother treated so ; and as [she]287-his mother turned for a last glimpse of [him]90-tom , whilst [the crowd]416-the crowd was swallowing [her]287-his mother from [his]90-tom sight , [she]287-his mother seemed so wounded , so broken - hearted , that a shame fell upon [him]90-tom which consumed [his]90-tom pride to ashes , and withered [[his]90-tom stolen royalty]2489-his stolen royalty . [[His]90-tom grandeurs]2490-his grandeurs were stricken valueless : [they]2490-his grandeurs seemed to fall away from [him]90-tom like rotten rags . [The procession]2491-the procession moved on , and still on , through ever augmenting splendours and ever augmenting tempests of welcome ; but to [Tom Canty]90-tom [they]2490-his grandeurs were as if [they]2490-his grandeurs had not been . [He]90-tom neither saw nor heard . [Royalty]436-royalty had lost [its]436-royalty grace and sweetness ; its pomps were become a reproach . [Remorse]194-remorse was eating [his]90-tom heart out . [He]90-tom said , “ Would [God]87-god [I]90-tom were free of [my]90-tom captivity ! ”[90-tom] [He]90-tom had unconsciously dropped back into the phraseology of the first days of [his]90-tom compulsory greatness . [The shining pageant]2493-the shining pageant still went winding like a radiant and interminable serpent down [the crooked lanes of [the quaint old city]2495-the quaint old city]2494-the crooked lanes of the quaint old city , and through [the huzzaing hosts]2496-the huzzaing hosts ; but still [the King]294-the king rode with bowed head and vacant eyes , seeing only [[his]294-the king mother]287-his mother ’s face and that wounded look in it . “ Largess , largess ! ”[294-the king] The cry fell upon an unheeding ear . “ Long live [[Edward]87-god of [England]2-england]4444-edward of england ! ”[294-the king] It seemed as if [the earth]2499-the earth shook with the explosion ; but there was no response from [the King]294-the king . [He]294-the king heard it only as [one]3093-one hears the thunder of the surf when it is blown to the ear out of a great distance , for it was smothered under another sound which was still nearer , in [his]294-the king own breast , in [his]294-the king accusing conscience -- a voice which kept repeating those shameful words , “ [I]2504-i do not know [you]287-his mother , [woman]4443-woman ! ”[2504-i] The words smote upon [the King]294-the king ’s soul as the strokes of a funeral bell smite upon the soul of [a surviving friend]2503-a surviving friend when [they]2504-i remind [him]294-the king of secret treacheries suffered at [his]294-the king hands by [him]294-the king that is gone . New glories were unfolded at every turning ; new wonders , new marvels , sprang into view ; the pent clamours of waiting batteries were released ; new raptures poured from the throats of [the waiting multitudes]2505-the waiting multitudes : but [the King]294-the king gave no sign , and the accusing voice that went moaning through [his]294-the king comfortless breast was all the sound [he]294-the king heard . By - and - by the gladness in the faces of [the populace]2507-the populace changed a little , and became touched with a something like solicitude or anxiety : an abatement in the volume of the applause was observable too . [The Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector was quick to notice these things : [he]2359-the lord protector was as quick to detect the cause . [He]2359-the lord protector spurred to [the King]294-the king ’s side , bent low in [his]2359-the lord protector saddle , uncovered , and said-- “ [[My]2359-the lord protector liege]3243-my liege , it is an ill time for dreaming . [The people]244-the people observe [thy]294-the king downcast head , [thy]294-the king clouded mien , and [they]244-the people take it for an omen . Be advised : unveil the sun of [royalty]436-royalty , and let it shine upon these boding vapours , and disperse [them]244-the people . Lift up [thy]294-the king face , and smile upon [the people]244-the people . ”[2359-the lord protector] So saying , [the Duke]2510-the duke scattered a handful of coins to right and left , then retired to [[his]2510-the duke place]2179-his place . [The mock King]2482-the mock king did mechanically as [he]294-the king had been bidden . [His]294-the king smile had no heart in it , but few eyes were near enough or sharp enough to detect that . The noddings of [his]294-the king plumed head as [he]294-the king saluted [[his]294-the king subjects]2513-his subjects were full of grace and graciousness ; the largess which [he]294-the king delivered from [his]294-the king hand was royally liberal : so [the people]244-the people ’s anxiety vanished , and the acclamations burst forth again in as mighty a volume as before . Still once more , a little before the progress was ended , [the Duke]2510-the duke was obliged to ride forward , and make remonstrance . [He]2510-the duke whispered-- “ [O dread sovereign]4450-o dread sovereign ! shake off these fatal humours ; the eyes of [the world]1021-the world are upon [thee]4450-o dread sovereign . ”[2510-the duke] Then [he]2510-the duke added with sharp annoyance , “ [Perdition]195-perdition catch [that crazy pauper]4452-that crazy pauper ! ’ twas [she]4452-that crazy pauper that hath disturbed [[your]4450-o dread sovereign Highness]3271-your highness . ”[2510-the duke] [The gorgeous figure]2516-the gorgeous figure turned a lustreless eye upon [the Duke]2510-the duke , and said in a dead voice-- “ [She]4452-that crazy pauper was [[my]2516-the gorgeous figure mother]3205-my mother ! ”[2516-the gorgeous figure] “ [[My]2412-the protector God]4210-my god ! ”[2412-the protector] groaned [the Protector]2412-the protector as [he]2412-the protector reined [his]2412-the protector horse backward to [his]2412-the protector post , “ [the omen]4456-the omen was pregnant with prophecy . [He]4456-the omen is gone mad again ! ”[2412-the protector] CHAPTER XXXII . Coronation Day . Let [us]2519-we go backward a few hours , and place [ourselves]2519-we in [Westminster Abbey]67-westminster abbey , at four o’clock in the morning of this memorable Coronation Day . [We]2519-we are not without [company]2520-company ; for although it is still night , [we]2519-we find [the torch - lighted galleries]2521-the torch - lighted galleries already filling up with [people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours]2522-people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours till the time shall come for [them]2522-people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours to see what [they]2522-people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours may not hope to see twice in [their]2522-people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours lives -- the coronation of [a King]390-a king . Yes , [London]1-london and [Westminster]15-westminster have been astir ever since the warning guns boomed at three o’clock , and already crowds of [untitled rich folk who have bought the privilege of trying to find sitting]2524-untitled rich folk who have bought the privilege of trying to find sitting - room in [the galleries]3878-the galleries are flocking in at [the entrances reserved for [their]2522-people who are well content to sit still and wait seven or eight hours sort]2526-the entrances reserved for their sort . The hours drag along tediously enough . All stir has ceased for some time , for [every gallery]2527-every gallery has long ago been packed . [We]2519-we may sit , now , and look and think at [our]2519-we leisure . [We]2519-we have glimpses , here and there and yonder , through the dim cathedral twilight , of portions of many galleries and balconies , wedged full with [other people]1261-other people , the other portions of these galleries and balconies being cut off from sight by intervening pillars and architectural projections . [We]2519-we have in view the whole of [the great north transept]2529-the great north transept -- empty , and waiting for [[England]2-england ’s privileged ones]2530-england ’s privileged ones . [We]2519-we see also [the ample area or platform , carpeted with rich stuffs]2531-the ample area or platform , carpeted with rich stuffs , whereon the throne stands . The throne occupies the centre of [the platform]2532-the platform , and is raised above it upon an elevation of four steps . Within the seat of the throne is enclosed a rough flat rock -- the stone of [Scone]70-scone -- which [many generations of [Scottish kings]2534-scottish kings]2533-many generations of scottish kings sat on to be crowned , and so it in time became holy enough to answer a like purpose for [English monarchs]2535-english monarchs . Both the throne and [its]2536-its footstool are covered with cloth of gold . [Stillness]196-stillness reigns , the torches blink dully , the time drags heavily . But at last the lagging daylight asserts itself , the torches are extinguished , and a mellow radiance suffuses [the great spaces]2537-the great spaces . All features of [the noble building]2538-the noble building are distinct now , but soft and dreamy , for the sun is lightly veiled with clouds . At seven o’clock the first break in the drowsy monotony occurs ; for on the stroke of this hour [the first peeress]2539-the first peeress enters [the transept]2540-the transept , clothed like [Solomon]197-solomon for splendour , and is conducted to [her]2539-the first peeress appointed place by [an official clad in satins and velvets]2541-an official clad in satins and velvets , whilst [a duplicate of [him]2541-an official clad in satins and velvets]2542-a duplicate of him gathers up [[the lady]2082-the lady ’s long train]2544-the lady ’s long train , follows after , and , when [the lady]2082-the lady is seated , arranges [the train]2546-the train across [her]2082-the lady lap for [her]2082-the lady . [He]2541-an official clad in satins and velvets then places [her]2082-the lady footstool according to [her]2082-the lady desire , after which [he]2541-an official clad in satins and velvets puts [her]2082-the lady coronet where it will be convenient to [her]2082-the lady hand when the time for the simultaneous coroneting of [the nobles]567-the nobles shall arrive . By this time [the peeresses]2548-the peeresses are flowing in in a glittering stream , and [the satin - clad officials]2549-the satin - clad officials are flitting and glinting everywhere , seating [them]2548-the peeresses and making [them]2548-the peeresses comfortable . The scene is animated enough now . There is stir and life , and shifting colour everywhere . After a time , quiet reigns again ; for [the peeresses]2548-the peeresses are all come and are all in [their]2548-the peeresses places , a solid acre or such a matter , of human flowers , resplendent in variegated colours , and frosted like a Milky Way with diamonds . There are all ages here : [brown , wrinkled , white - haired dowagers who are able to go back , and still back , down the stream of time]2551-brown , wrinkled , white - haired dowagers who are able to go back , and still back , down the stream of time , and recall the crowning of [Richard III]198-richard iii . and the troublous days of that old forgotten age ; and there are [handsome middle - aged dames]2552-handsome middle - aged dames ; and [lovely and gracious young matrons]2553-lovely and gracious young matrons ; and [gentle and beautiful young girls , with beaming eyes and fresh complexions]2554-gentle and beautiful young girls , with beaming eyes and fresh complexions , who may possibly put on [their]2554-gentle and beautiful young girls , with beaming eyes and fresh complexions jewelled coronets awkwardly when the great time comes ; for the matter will be new to [them]2548-the peeresses , and [their]2548-the peeresses excitement will be a sore hindrance . Still , this may not happen , for the hair of [all these ladies]2555-all these ladies has been arranged with a special view to the swift and successful lodging of the crown in its place when the signal comes . [We]2556-we have seen that this massed array of [peeresses]2557-peeresses is sown thick with diamonds , and [we]2556-we also see that it is a marvellous spectacle -- but now [we]2556-we are about to be astonished in earnest . About nine , the clouds suddenly break away and a shaft of sunshine cleaves the mellow atmosphere , and drifts slowly along the ranks of [ladies]254-ladies ; and every rank it touches flames into a dazzling splendour of many - coloured fires , and [we]2556-we tingle to [our]2556-we finger - tips with the electric thrill that is shot through [us]2556-we by the surprise and the beauty of the spectacle ! Presently [a special envoy from [some distant corner of [the Orient]71-the orient]2560-some distant corner of the orient , marching with [the general body of [foreign ambassadors]2562-foreign ambassadors]2561-the general body of foreign ambassadors]2559-a special envoy from some distant corner of the orient , marching with the general body of foreign ambassadors , crosses this bar of sunshine , and [we]2556-we catch [our]2556-we breath , the glory that streams and flashes and palpitates about [him]2559-a special envoy from some distant corner of the orient , marching with the general body of foreign ambassadors is so overpowering ; for [he]2559-a special envoy from some distant corner of the orient , marching with the general body of foreign ambassadors is crusted from head to heel with gems , and [his]2559-a special envoy from some distant corner of the orient , marching with the general body of foreign ambassadors slightest movement showers a dancing radiance all around [him]2559-a special envoy from some distant corner of the orient , marching with the general body of foreign ambassadors . Let [us]2556-we change the tense for convenience . The time drifted along -- one hour -- two hours -- two hours and a half ; then the deep booming of artillery told that [the King]294-the king and [[his]294-the king grand procession]2564-his grand procession had arrived at last ; so [the waiting multitude]2565-the waiting multitude rejoiced . [All]654-all knew that a further delay must follow , for [the King]294-the king must be prepared and robed for the solemn ceremony ; but this delay would be pleasantly occupied by the assembling of [the peers of the realm]3344-the peers of the realm in [their]3344-the peers of the realm stately robes . These were conducted ceremoniously to [their]3344-the peers of the realm seats , and [their]3344-the peers of the realm coronets placed conveniently at hand ; and meanwhile [the multitude]960-the multitude in [the galleries]3878-the galleries were alive with interest , for most of [them]960-the multitude were beholding for the first time , [dukes]2571-dukes , [earls]3874-earls , and [barons , whose names had been historical for five hundred years]2573-barons , whose names had been historical for five hundred years . When [all]654-all were finally seated , the spectacle from [the galleries]3878-the galleries and [all coigns of vantage]2576-all coigns of vantage was complete ; a gorgeous one to look upon and to remember . Now the robed and mitred great heads of [the church]4114-the church , and [[their]3344-the peers of the realm attendants]759-their attendants , filed in upon [the platform]2532-the platform and took [their]3344-the peers of the realm appointed places ; these were followed by [the Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector and [other great officials]2581-other great officials , and these again by [a steel - clad detachment of the Guard]2582-a steel - clad detachment of the guard . There was a waiting pause ; then , at a signal , a triumphant peal of music burst forth , and [Tom Canty]90-tom , clothed in a long robe of cloth of gold , appeared at a door , and stepped upon [the platform]2532-the platform . [The entire multitude]2584-the entire multitude rose , and the ceremony of the Recognition ensued . Then a noble anthem swept [the Abbey]2585-the abbey with its rich waves of sound ; and thus heralded and welcomed , [Tom Canty]90-tom was conducted to the throne . The ancient ceremonies went on , with impressive solemnity , whilst [the audience]1273-the audience gazed ; and as [they]2587-they drew nearer and nearer to completion , [Tom Canty]90-tom grew pale , and still paler , and a deep and steadily deepening woe and despondency settled down upon [his]90-tom spirits and upon [his]90-tom remorseful heart . At last the final act was at hand . [The Archbishop of]2588-the archbishop of [Canterbury]46-canterbury lifted up the crown of [England]2-england from its cushion and held it out over [the trembling mock - King]2589-the trembling mock - king ’s head . In the same instant a rainbow - radiance flashed along [the spacious transept]2590-the spacious transept ; for with one impulse [every individual in the great concourse of nobles]2591-every individual in the great concourse of nobles lifted a coronet and poised it over [his]2592-his or [her]2593-her head -- and paused in that attitude . A deep hush pervaded [the Abbey]2585-the abbey . At this impressive moment , a startling apparition intruded upon the scene -- an apparition observed by [none in the absorbed multitude]2595-none in the absorbed multitude , until it suddenly appeared , moving up [the great central aisle]2596-the great central aisle . It was [a boy]239-a boy , bareheaded , ill shod , and clothed in coarse plebeian garments that were falling to rags . [He]90-tom raised [his]90-tom hand with a solemnity which ill comported with [his]90-tom soiled and sorry aspect , and delivered this note of warning-- “ [I]90-tom forbid [you]4457-you to set the crown of [England]2-england upon that forfeited head . [I]90-tom am [the King]294-the king ! ”[90-tom] In an instant several indignant hands were laid upon [the boy]520-the boy ; but in the same instant [Tom Canty]90-tom , in [his]90-tom regal vestments , made a swift step forward , and cried out in a ringing voice-- “ Loose [him]520-the boy and forbear ! [He]90-tom _ is _ [the King]294-the king ! ”[90-tom] A sort of panic of astonishment swept the assemblage , and [they]2599-they partly rose in [their]2599-they places and stared in a bewildered way at [one another]2600-one another and at the chief figures in this scene , like [persons who wondered whether [they]2599-they were awake and in [their]2599-they senses , or asleep and dreaming]2601-persons who wondered whether they were awake and in their senses , or asleep and dreaming . [The Lord Protector]186-the lord protector was as amazed as [the rest]3914-the rest , but quickly recovered [himself]186-the lord protector , and exclaimed in a voice of authority-- “ Mind not [[his]520-the boy Majesty]3254-his majesty , [his]520-the boy malady is upon [him]520-the boy again -- seize the vagabond ! ”[186-the lord protector] [He]186-the lord protector would have been obeyed , but [the mock - King]2603-the mock - king stamped [his]2603-the mock - king foot and cried out-- “ On [your]520-the boy peril ! Touch [him]520-the boy not , [he]520-the boy is [the King]294-the king ! ”[2603-the mock - king] The hands were withheld ; a paralysis fell upon [the house]292-the house ; [no one]554-no one moved , [no one]554-no one spoke ; indeed , [no one]554-no one knew how to act or what to say , in so strange and surprising an emergency . While [all minds]2608-all minds were struggling to right [themselves]2608-all minds , [the boy]520-the boy still moved steadily forward , with [high port and confident mien]2610-high port and confident mien ; [he]520-the boy had never halted from the beginning ; and while the tangled minds still floundered helplessly , [he]520-the boy stepped upon the platform , and [the mock - King]2603-the mock - king ran with a glad face to meet [him]520-the boy ; and fell on [his]520-the boy knees before [him]520-the boy and said-- “ Oh , [[my]520-the boy lord [the King]294-the king]4462-my lord the king , let poor [Tom Canty]90-tom be first to swear fealty to [thee]294-the king , and say , ‘ Put on [thy]90-tom crown and enter into thine own again ! ’ ”[520-the boy] [The Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector ’s eye fell sternly upon [the new - comer]2613-the new - comer ’s face ; but straightway the sternness vanished away , and gave place to an expression of wondering surprise . This thing happened also to [the other great officers]2614-the other great officers . [They]2614-the other great officers glanced at [each other]246-each other , and retreated a step by a common and unconscious impulse . The thought in each mind was the same : “ What a strange resemblance ! ”[2359-the lord protector] [The Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector reflected a moment or two in perplexity , then [he]2359-the lord protector said , with grave respectfulness-- “ By [your]294-the king favour , [sir]3053-sir , [I]2359-the lord protector desire to ask certain questions which-- ”[2359-the lord protector] “ [I]2510-the duke will answer them , [[my]2510-the duke lord]3168-my lord . ”[2510-the duke] [The Duke]2510-the duke asked [him]2613-the new - comer many questions about [the Court]3339-the court , [the late King]1188-the late king , [the prince]236-the prince , [the princesses]1240-the princesses -- [the boy]520-the boy answered [them]2623-them correctly and without hesitating . [He]520-the boy described [the rooms of state in [the palace]425-the palace]2624-the rooms of state in the palace , [[the late King]1188-the late king ’s apartments]2627-the late king ’s apartments , and those of [the Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3050-the prince of wales . It was strange ; it was wonderful ; yes , it was unaccountable -- so [all said that]2629-all said that heard it . The tide was beginning to turn , and [Tom Canty]90-tom ’s hopes to run high , when [the Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector shook [his]2359-the lord protector head and said-- “ It is true it is most wonderful -- but it is no more than [[our]4466-our lord]4467-our lord [the King]294-the king likewise can do . ”[2359-the lord protector] This remark , and this reference to [himself]90-tom as still [the King]294-the king , saddened [Tom Canty]90-tom , and [he]90-tom felt [his]90-tom hopes crumbling from under [him]90-tom . “ These are not _ proofs _ , ”[2412-the protector] added [the Protector]2412-the protector . The tide was turning very fast now , very fast indeed -- but in the wrong direction ; it was leaving [poor Tom Canty]90-tom stranded on the throne , and sweeping the other out to [sea]2633-sea . [The Lord Protector]2359-the lord protector communed with [himself]2359-the lord protector -- shook [his]2359-the lord protector head -- the thought forced itself upon [him]2359-the lord protector , “ It is perilous to [the State]4469-the state and to [[us]4470-us all]4471-us all , to entertain so fateful a riddle as this ; it could divide [the nation]4472-the nation and undermine the throne . ”[2359-the lord protector] [He]2359-the lord protector turned and said-- “ [Sir Thomas]146-tom , arrest this -- No , hold ! ”[2359-the lord protector] [His]2359-the lord protector face lighted , and [he]2359-the lord protector confronted [the ragged candidate]2635-the ragged candidate with this question-- “ Where lieth [the Great Seal]4473-the great seal ? Answer [me]2359-the lord protector this truly , and the riddle is unriddled ; for only [he]3154-the true prince that was [Prince of [Wales]3-wales]3225-prince of wales _ can _ so answer ! On so trivial a thing hang a throne and a dynasty ! ”[2359-the lord protector] It was a lucky thought , a happy thought . That it was so considered by [the great officials]2636-the great officials was manifested by the silent applause that shot from eye to eye around [their]2636-the great officials circle in the form of bright approving glances . Yes , none but [the true prince]3154-the true prince could dissolve the stubborn mystery of [the vanished Great Seal]2638-the vanished great seal -- [this forlorn little impostor]2639-this forlorn little impostor had been taught [his]2639-this forlorn little impostor lesson well , but here [his]2639-this forlorn little impostor teachings must fail , for [[his]2639-this forlorn little impostor teacher]2640-his teacher [himself]2640-his teacher could not answer _ that _ question -- ah , very good , very good indeed ; now [we]2641-we shall be rid of this troublesome and perilous business in short order ! And so [they]2636-the great officials nodded invisibly and smiled inwardly with satisfaction , and looked to see [this foolish lad]2642-this foolish lad stricken with a palsy of guilty confusion . How surprised [they]2636-the great officials were , then , to see nothing of the sort happen -- how [they]2636-the great officials marvelled to hear [him]2642-this foolish lad answer up promptly , in a confident and untroubled voice , and say-- “ There is nought in this riddle that is difficult . ”[2642-this foolish lad] Then , without so much as a by - [your]2643-you - leave to [anybody]2644-anybody , [he]2642-this foolish lad turned and gave this command , with the easy manner of one accustomed to doing such things : “ [[My]2642-this foolish lad [Lord St. John]109-lord st. john]4475-my lord st. john , go [you]2643-you to [[my]2642-this foolish lad private cabinet]4476-my private cabinet in [the palace]425-the palace -- for [none]3179-none knoweth the place better than [you]2643-you -- and , close down to the floor , in the left corner remotest from the door that opens from the ante - chamber , [you]2643-you shall find in the wall a brazen nail - head ; press upon it and a little jewel - closet will fly open which not even [you]2643-you do know of -- no , nor any soul else in all [the world]1021-the world but [me]2642-this foolish lad and [the trusty artisan that did contrive it for [me]2642-this foolish lad]4480-the trusty artisan that did contrive it for me .
